column2: Senior Android Engineer for a Global Consumer Device company
column5: [\nWill contribute to the R&D team focusing on next generation mobile applications and system software.\xa0Making modifications to Android system software below the Application Java layer to add new functionality to new products.Must Have:5+ years of strong Java programmingExperience in the internals of Android and/or Android NDK in addition to general Android app coding experience.Proven track record of work developing Java code and dealing with Android system softwareUnderstand responsive design and layout for mobile devicesExperience working with R&D groups that create new products from prototype through to mature implementations.Proficient in either native\xa0Android application development.\xa0High bar for quality and passion for building a great user experience\xa0Experience delivering at least one major Android application that is still available on Play StoreExperience with connected/distributed systems sharing data with the cloud desiredExperience with debugging cross-layer and distributed systemsDesired:Experience delivering rapid prototypes.Experience in optimizing code based on initial issue analysisLocation: \xa0Mountain View, CAType: ContractDuration:\xa0 6-12 months\xa0\n]

[\nMy client located in King of Prussia area is looking Python Developer to join their team.\xa0 It's great environment; friendly, collaborative and working with lastest technologies.\xa0 In addition to salary, they have excellent benefits and cool place to work.Looking for following skills:3-5 years Python Development including Django and PostgreSQLSolution Design and Development experienceExcellent communication skillsAbility to translate business requirements in technical solutions\xa0** NO SPONSORSHIPS FOR THIS ROLE \n]

[\nDescription: THE COMPANY Are you interested in helping solve today's most critical housing challenges? In simplest terms, Fannie Mae serves the people who house America. We work at the heart of housing by providing reliable, affordable mortgage financing in all markets at all times, buying loans that banks and other lenders originate, so they can fund new loans. This gives more people the opportunity to buy, refinance, or rent homes and apartments. Creating these opportunities is what drives the people who work at Fannie Mae. For more information about Fannie Mae, visit  http\\://www.fanniemae.com/progress JOB INFORMATION Under limited supervision, plan, manage, and execute varied software development, customization, or IT systems development projects. Gather information at front end to determine project parameters and specifications, and to budget human, financial and other resources. May provide technical oversight to some staff and track attainment of project milestones. Report on progress and budget expenditures to project owners. KEY JOB FUNCTIONS Meet with application owners, application developers and analysts, coding staff and the like to determine business needs and functionalities desired for new or revised application.  Plan course of projects, including milestones, resources needed in the form of staff hours, budget, use of technology and tools and document in project plan, following established project management methodology.  Track course of project from meetings, conferring with developers, and receiving reports. Update project plan as needed. Document changes to scope or functionalities with change ticket, project plan, or other format.  Assess compliance of development process with accepted methodology and communicate to responsible managers or staff. Document exceptions or deviations as needed. Convene meetings and plan agenda to ensure important issues are aired and resolved.  Report on progress of project, use of staff, $ expenditures, progress on milestones and the like to application owners.  Provide guidance to project staff. May plan, document, manage and evaluate staff performance, or contribute to evaluation by their managers. Qualification:EDUCATION \xa0\xa0Bachelor's Degree or equivalent required\xa0\xa0MINIMUM EXPERIENCE \xa0\xa04+ years of related experience\xa0\xa0SPECIALIZED KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS Leads large, global, virtual multi-(engineering) teams in an Agile methodology to develop custom solutions for complex integration program, affecting mission critical systems.  Develops and refines program deliverables including project plans specifying goals, strategy, staffing, scheduling, identification of risks, contingency plans, and allocation of available resources.  Leads the execution of the tasks as defined in the project plan in order to achieve project goals while managing changes to the project scope, schedule, and costs.  Maintains and develops strong working relationships with Business and Product Owners, company executives and cross-functional stakeholders, communicating frequently regarding program status.  Supports the budget/forecast process and related financial analysis and reporting, including capacity / resource utilization and alignment to financial system.  Motivates and manages the team using appropriate tools and techniques increasing commitment to the program objectives.\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0  EMPLOYMENT \xa0As a condition of employment with Fannie Mae, any successful job applicant will be required to pass a pre-employment drug screen and to successfully complete a background investigation, which may also include a credit check for positions in some areas of our business.\xa0\xa0Fannie Mae is an Equal Opportunity Employer. \xa0 Department:  Information Management\n\t\t]

[\nExperis leads in the creation and delivery of services that enable our clients to win in the changing world of work. We are the premier vendor for some of the most prestigious companies in the Wisconsin area. We have partnered together with a local Government/State Agency to find an IT Vendor Relationship Manager to join their team in Wisconsin.Title: IT Vendor Relationship ManagerSUMMARY: Manages the outsourcing process for the organization's IT department. Oversees the evaluation and selection of vendors as well as the negotiation of purchase contracts or service level agreements. Handles problems with vendors or products as necessary. May be responsible for budgeting. Requires a bachelor's degree and at least 7 years of experience in the field or a related area. Familiar with a variety of the field's concepts, practices, and procedures. Relies on extensive experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. Performs a variety of tasks. Leads and directs the work of others. A wide degree of creativity and latitude is required. Typically reports to a head of a unit/department.DUTIES: Draft, revise and negotiate agency contracts with partners; research and provide related technical assistance to agency staff; collaborate with other County departments and elected bodies to ensure compliance with established contract policy. Collaborate with Corporation Counsel to review, analyze and evaluate applicable statues and ordinances for compliance and/or modification Develop and maintain contract databases, provide fiscal quality assurance monitoring across divisions, lead audit evaluations to ensure compliance, and general contract monitoring reports. Assist in the preparation and presentation of materials for standing committee review. Prepare Requests for Proposals and provide coordination and guidance throughout the process to ensure compliance with County ordinances. Maintain master files on all contracted agencies and partners. Ensure that all required information has been provided by the agency or provided to the agency by the partner.If this sounds like you and you are interested in learning more contact kelsey.faber@experis.com Experis is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE/AA) Experis is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE/AA)\n\t\t]
column6: [\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\tExperis is the global leader in professional resourcing and project-based workforce solutions. We accelerate organizations' growth by intensely attracting, assessing, and placing specialized expertise in IT, Finance, Engineering, and Healthcare to precisely deliver in-demand talent for mission-critical positions, enhancing the competitiveness of the organizations and people we serve. Visit www.experis.com to learn more.\n\t\t\t\t\t\t]

column5: [\nWorks within IT Governance to provide oversight, direction and guidance/consultation for IT policy/process development.Works within the Office of the CTO to provide oversight, direction and guidance/consultation for IT projects from project request submission through project close-out and post-implementation review.\xa0\xa0 As a liaison, works with project teams, agency partners, clients, etc. to ensure project are receiving the appropriate level of executive support and direction.\xa0 Ensures issues are evaluated and resolved, escalates Risk and directs corrective actions in any area where performance falls below objectives.\xa0Ensure projects/programs have adequate executive and strives to enable the success of the projects/programs. Verifies and validates project status reports and communicates key items to IT leadership. Reviews and contributes to project documentation including project initiation documents such as the project charter, budget, schedule, cost benefit analysis, etc. throughout the project lifecycle until the end of the project including the project closeout report. Recommends approval of documents to the appropriate sponsors and executive oversight committees. Attends project review and steering committee meetings for all projects for which he or she is governance liaison.\xa0Acts in a consulting role, supporting the Office of the CTO.\xa0 Attends meetings with or on behalf of the CTO and manages action items and issues logs that require attention.\xa0 Takes on small work requests and tasks for the Office of the CTO.\xa0 Creates progress dashboards and metrics as part of an overall governance support role.\xa0 Recommends process improvements and efficiency steps to overall benefit the department.Assist in the preparation of reports and materials for regularly scheduled project and program portfolio reviews with IT leadership.\xa0\n]

[\nSummary: We are looking for an iOS Development Manager to help us build awesome iOS apps that integrate with our services platform. The iOS development manager for the Mobile Team will report to the Director of Mobile. The Mobile group is responsible for application architecture, development and innovation of new feature development to support consumer mobile solutions. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in iOS design and development, with one or more apps in the Apple iTunes AppStore.\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Position Type: Full Time EmploymentLocation: San Francisco, CASalary : 140000- 180000 Per Annum DOERequired Skills:\xa0IOS, swift, Xcode, Objective-CTravel: Up to 5% travel \u2013 Offices Onshore and Offshore, Conferences \u2013 up to 4x a yr.\xa0What you will be doing?As an\xa0IOS Dev Manager, these are few of the important job duties you will be performing:\u2022 Successfully lead a high-performing software engineering team; participate in code reviews, wireframe designs and proof of concepts\u2022 Coach and develop team members. Help set and fulfill the engineering hiring plan for the team, including sourcing, screening, and interviewing\u2022 Help set team goals and technical direction while ensuring that they align with the goals of the larger organization\u2022 Represent the team in planning, estimation and product meetings, effectively communicating the available features of the iOS platform\u2022 Help implement effective engineering processes and policies that emphasize quality and forward progress\u2022 Work with QA team in analyzing and resolving production issues and defects\u2022 Regular, dependable attendance and punctuality\xa0What you need for this role?\xa0To qualify for\xa0IOS Dev Manager, you will need the following:Bachelor's degree in Computer Science/Engineering or equivalent work experience\u2022 3+ years as a technical lead/Manager with deep understanding of iOS UX and UI design paradigms, and ability to implement and design iOS apps\u2022 5+ years of broad knowledge of Objective-C, XCode, UIKit and Interface Builder\u2022 An Object Oriented philosopher with experience understanding and applying OO design patterns\u2022 Experience working with and tuning high volume mobile applications\u2022 Experience integrating with RESTful API backends\xa0\xa0\xa0Connect with Us:If you think this post is all about you, ping me at\xa0hpurohit@bayonesolutions.com. I will be happy to answer your questions at\xa0(925) 307-7276.\xa0About Us:We are a\xa0business and technology services firm specializing in IT Consulting, Application Development, Systems Integration, Cloud Computing, Data Warehousing and Business Intelligence, and others.\xa0Our portfolio of clients includes Fortune 500 and startups. We believing in matching our Consultants talent and core values with that of our clients resulting in \u2018Happy\u2019 customers.\xa0We provide \xa0equal opportunity to all qualified persons without regard to race, ethnicity, color, religion, gender, age, disability, genetic information, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, veteran/military status or any other basis protected by law.\xa0\xa0Thanks,Himanshu PurohitTechnical RecruiterBayOne Solutions Pleasanton, CA 94588hpurohit@bayonesolutions.comPh:\xa0(925) 307-7276\n]

[\nThe IT Division at Newport News Shipbuilding is in the second year of implementing an agile methodology. To continue to grow and mature agile capabilities, we are seeking an experienced agilest who can train and coach new teams, as well as improve the discipline and maturity of the nine existing teams.The Agile Coach will:Enable teams to mature their agile practice through consistent and timely coaching on basic and advanced agile principles and concepts;Work with new agile teams intensely for approximately 3 months to ensure good practices and principals are adopted;Continue to provide support to teams on an on-going basis;Regularly attending team ceremonies for each assigned team;Ensuring team roles are well understood;Providing additional guidance/recommendations for specific team needs (upon request and based on analysis/observation);Leading, at regular intervals, team maturity assessments and utilizing the results to build action plans for improvement;Analyzing industry best practice and bringing awareness to applicable practices within individual teams or through organization level training;Guiding on tool best practices and ensuring adoption;Conduct new team, advanced, and \u201cagile essential\u201d training courses;Performs technical planning, system integration, verification and validation, cost and risk, and supportability and effectiveness analyses for total systems;Ensures the logical and systematic conversion of customer or product requirements into total systems solutions that acknowledge technical, schedule, and cost constraints;Performs functional analysis, timeline analysis, detail trade studies, requirements allocation and interface definition studies to translate customer requirements into hardware and software specifications.\xa0Basic Qualifications2 Years of relevant experience with Bachelor of Science degree; 0 Years with Master\u2019s degreePreferred QualificationsFamiliarity with one or more agile varieties and previous work experience as an agile team member;Experience leading agile transformation at a programmatic and team level;Strong oral communication/ presentation and facilitation skills;Resilience to drive cultural change.\n]

[\nMeridian Knowledge Solutions, LLC, is the leading provider of enterprise, web-based learning management software. Meridian\u2019s powerful yet easy-to-use solutions are leveraged by organizations dedicated to building world-class learning enterprises inspired and focused on delivering exceptional results. With over 3 million users worldwide, Meridian offers a flexible, best-of-breed learning management system that gives organizations and users alike a seamless, integrated experience, all while strengthening the bottom line. The company is headquartered in Reston, VA. For additional information about Meridian, visit www.meridianks.com.\xa0  As a Marketing Specialist focused on Demand Generation/Lead Generation marketing you will work to create scalable processes that ensure best practices in lead generation and database management. You will be expected to work internally, as well as with third party vendors, to create and execute a quarterly demand generation calendar of integrated, multi-touch marketing campaigns utilizing webinars, email marketing and digital advertising/paid media. You will also work hand-in-hand with the sales team to manage metrics that clearly demonstrate the impact of marketing on the sales pipeline.  Responsibilities:Manage technical aspects of key marketing systems (Marketo, Salesforce) used to generate, distribute, and report on leads. Establish and maintain scalable processes that ensure best practices in campaign and\xa0lead management \u2013 including metrics and reports on marketing and sales activities, effectiveness, and business impact. Create and maintain a quarterly demand generation calendar of activities. Collaborate and negotiate with third party vendors to secure digital/paid media placements. Analyze marketing and sales data to develop insights and make recommendations on areas for optimization. Monitor and maintain data quality within the marketing database. Additional Responsibilities:Assist with marketing content creation \u2013 including writing of promotional emails, landing pages and blog posts Assist with the planning and execution of trade show and event logistics (shipment of booth displays, materials, giveaways, etc.) - may include traveling to industry events Strong analytical skills and experience with reporting and data analysis. High proficiency in marketing automation systems \u2013 Marketo experience strongly preferred. Past experience with email marketing, lead nurturing, demand generation marketing and digital marketing. Ability to manage multiple projects at the same time in a fast-paced environment. Technically capable, excellent communicator, and a desire to improve processes. Superior writing ability. Detail oriented with a strong commitment to quality. Education: Bachelor\u2019s Degree Required, Marketing, Business or Communications degree preferred Experience: Two to four years relevant business to business marketing experience with an emphasis on lead generation/demand generation, preferably for a services or software company. Must have demonstrated Marketo/marketing operations experience. \xa0 PostingID:  448991 Position:  Marketing Specialist Category:  Business Support FullTime:  Full-Time Shift:  -not applicable- ExperienceLevel:  None LocationName:  Meridian EducationLevel:  Bachelor's Degree OpenDate:  1/30/2017 ExpireDate:  3/1/2017\n\t\t]

[\nAt SOLTECH, we work with a catered selection of incredible clients that match our integrity and standard for tech talent in order to help them grow teams that will create significant impact on Atlanta's tech community.\xa0We're excited to present opportunities to our network to work in some incredible environments that we've vetted first-hand. Apply through SOLTECH for a catered approach to your job search, and we'll make sure you land where you will be nurtured in your career growth.\xa0\xa0About the\xa0Client\xa0Winners in the 2016 Stevie\xae Awards for great employers, this trail blazing leader\xa0in the Financial Technology\xa0space is a wonderful place\xa0to land\xa0if you're jazzed by innovation\xa0and positive culture.\xa0They've founded a new state-of-the-art HQ in Buckhead\xa0and are hiring the brightest technology pros\xa0and thought leaders in financial technology. Their commitment\xa0is\xa0to deliver better business solutions for a\xa0variety of merchant segments from small retailers to B2B wholesalers and global e-commerce enterprises. More importantly to you, they're committed to continuous improvement,\xa0making it a great place to work, and encouraging your ideas so that you can experience first-hand the impact of your contributions.\xa0\xa0If you're looking for a positive change in your career, we encourage you to apply today to learn more!\xa0Day-To-Day ResponsibilitiesDiagnose customer needs, guide them API implementation issues and provides sample code.\xa0Production support for systems and applications, monitoring APIs & data\xa0Provide technical support to application developers using API framework\xa0Tracking and driving resolution/improvements to API deficienciesLead and support merchants integration and implementationDocument developer FAQs and maintain the knowledge base\xa0Interact with solutions team to drive the evolution of the technical design and implementation of the solutionBack-end development, support, maintain, and server side engineering.Interact and support the development of front-end applicationsSupport and improve our tools for continuous integration, automated testing and release management.Fast-paced environment with the right balance of quick, iterative development versus more deliberate, smart architecting.Strengthen or improve development and release processes within the team.Engage in integration with various third parties software with a wide range of integration specifications (Linux and Solaris, networking, Oracle, MySql, web services)Be a key contributor on a fast moving development teams using agile methodologiesDesired educationB.S. degree in Computer Science or related field of study, or equivalent educationQualifications desired6+ years support or engineering experience, customers facing experienceSolid understanding of REST/SOAP API(s)\xa0Previous experience working on various tool sets both on client side and server side (application logs, access logs etc.) to debug, analyze API/application from issues to performance perspective.\xa0Strong knowledge in API/SaaS domain working closely with product management and engineering teams.\xa0Able to work with batch job processing and multiple teams to troubleshoot and analyze and issue from end-to-end.Set up alerts base on application needs. Create automation script to automate major repetitive tasksKnowledge of the payments industry and/or financial servicesAble to work within the software development lifecycle, and contribute within a team.Stronge knowledge and experience on Oracle and database modeling, optimizing queries, etcKnowledge of secure coding principals and security issues that affect both front and backend systems\xa0Previous experience on Application Integration and Data Analytics solutionsRally experience is a bonus.\xa0Welcome to SOLTECH\xa0\xa0At SOLTECH, our founders started with a vision over 18 years ago for the success of our firm: to provide expert custom software solutions and project management support to our incredible community here in Atlanta, GA. That vision has not only come to fruition, but has grown into a wide portfolio of solutions we provide to our clients \u2013 clients nurtured over decades of genuine connection with the technology community. We\u2019re homegrown and founder-led, and we welcome creative, intuitive thinkers to our team that can help pave the landscape for what\u2019s next to come in high quality custom software development and staffing.\xa0\xa0Read more at\xa0http://soltech.net/our-story.\xa0\xa0\n]

[\nREQUIRED CERTIFICATION:ISC(2), ISACA, SANS GIAC, or other similar Information Security Certification is required.EDUCATION PREFERRED:Bachelors degree in computer science or similar discipline is preferred.Required Knowledge/Skills:1. Strong working knowledge of FISMA, NIST, and HIPAA Security and Privacy requirements, standards, and guidelines.2. 5+ years of experience working in the Information Technology field or auditing Information Technology systems or programs.3. ISC(2), ISACA, SANS GIAC, or other similar Information Security Certification is required.4. Documented experience in the creation and maintenance of Risk Management Framework (RMF) and Assessment and Authorization (A&A) artifacts such as System Security Plans, Privacy Impact Assessments, Interconnection Security Agreements, Computer Matching Agreements, and Plans of Action and Milestones.5. Ability to work independently and as a member of a team.6. Ability to multitask and prioritize tasks effectively in order to meet deadlines.7. Ability to engage diverse audiences of varying technical and non-technical skill-levels to ensure effective alignment of technical requirements to business objectives.8. Ability to collaborate and coordinate efforts among multiple teams and vendors.9. Must have intermediate to advanced skills in Microsoft Office products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio) to include working with templates and style guidelines for branding consistency.10. Keen attention to detail while maintaining the ability to see the big picture.11. Ability to absorb, retain, and communicate complex processes.12. Strong English language skills.13. Demonstrable understanding of the rules of English grammar and usage.14. Ability to accept changes and constructive criticism and to remain flexible in dealing with leadership and teams of varying technical and business knowledge.Preferred Requirements/Skills:1. Bachelors degree in computer science or similar discipline.2. Strong working knowledge of CMS MARS-E compliance requirements.3. Prior experience working with an organization subject to CMS MARS-E requirements.4. Experience and training with eGRC solutions.5. Prior Health Information Technology experience.6. Previous Medicaid experience.7. Understanding of LEAN and Agile development practices.\n]

column2: Service Desk Analyst TIER II - DOD Top secret required
column5: [\n\xa0Service Desk AnalystInformation Technology | Stafford, VA, United States | 16-313\xa0\xa0InfoReliance is Hiring!Service Desk AnalystStafford, VAInfoReliance is seeking a TIER II Service Desk Analyst to join our support team for our DoD customer in Stafford, VA.\xa0As a Tier II Service Desk Analyst, you will be responsible for answering, documenting, analyzing, tracking, and responding to requests for assistance in support of a variety of issues, from supporting the Tier 1 issues such as re-imaging, software, account creation, password resets, network issues, phones, email, and hardware problems, to tougher issues the Tier 1 Analysts are not equipped to handle, such as handling as break/fix, configuration issues, basic network troubleshooting, software installations, hardware repair (including in-house repair or coordinating depot services). You will be expected to provide exemplary customer service to your customers. You will be responsible for documentation and tracking of requests within our ticketing system.\xa0 \xa0\xa0This position requires an active TOP SECRET clearance. A six month waiver may be granted for candidates (eligible for TOP SECRET) while holding a current SECRET clearance, giving time to complete a TS application.In order to be successful in this role, we expect that you will have the following required experience, skills, and credentials:At least 2 year of experience working in a Help Desk/Call Center environmentAssociates Degree or higher level required or three years\u2019 experience in lieu of the degreeCompTIA Security+ Certification is requiredEffective written communication skills are imperative, with efficient and accurate typing skillsProven exemplary customer service experience, preferably with letters of recommendation and/or commendationExperience working directly with customers, preferably providing information technology supportProven ability to work in a team environment, especially with diverse technologies and user groupsIntermediate to Advanced experience with Remedy, BMC FootPrints, or comparable Information Technology Service Management (ITSM) ticketing systemsAbility to analyze, evaluate and solve problems of a difficult process or technical nature with strong interpersonal and troubleshooting skillsAbility to provide second-tier support to end users for either PC, server, or mainframe applications or hardware.Ability to interact with network services, software systems engineering, and/or applications development to restore service and/or identify and correct core problemsAble to simulates or recreate user problems to resolve operating difficultiesAbility to recommends systems modifications to reduce user problems\xa0The following desired skills, while not required, are highly desirable:Experience with ITIL and other quality assurance processes is preferredAbility to identify process improvement areas and author work instructions reflecting the new/improved workflow processAdministrative, logistical, or technical support experience with any branch of service is a plusFinally, your consultative approach and work ethic should be described by the following:\xa0You are proactive, you make and meet commitments, and you execute brilliantly.You have the ability to work with diverse, integrated, deliverable-driven teams to accomplish the larger missionYou have strong time management and organizational skills, with the ability to work on multiple tasks/initiatives with multiple deadlinesYou have excellent listening, oral, and written communication skillsYou are a quick study; you have a unique ability to adapt to new environments and to assimilate information quickly.Thank you for taking the time to read about our opportunity and to consider InfoReliance for your career. We look forward to talking with you about this position.\xa0Our BenefitsAll benefits are effective Day 1 of your employment with InfoReliance.\xa0Our reputation is built upon the talents and integrity of our employees. We value the contributions of each and every person that is a part of our organization. We offer exciting, challenging career opportunities, competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package to include the following:10 Paid Company Holidays Annually18 days a year of Paid Time Off (PTO) Annually for new employees (accrued)Comprehensive Medical and Dental CoverageTuition & Professional Certification Support401(k) planFlexible work arrangements, where possibleFlexible Spending Accounts for Commuter Costs, Medical and Dependent CareAll employees are eligible for our performance-based bonus program recognizing our outstanding contributors.\xa0About InfoRelianceInfoReliance Corporation is an Information Technology (IT) consulting company that builds, deploys and manages custom solutions that transform the business operations of federal government agencies.\xa0Microsoft Federal Solution Partner of the Year 2014 & Microsoft Public Sector Services Partner of the Year 2013 & 6 Time Microsoft Partner Awardee. Microsoft Consulting Services and Cloud Services Partner. Office 365 ResellerAmazon Web Services (AWS) Advanced Consulting Partner, AWS ResellerMcAfee Security Innovation Alliance, Elite PartnerFounded in 2000, InfoReliance is a thriving, privately-held business that has repeatedly been named as a \u201cfastest growing company\u201d by organizations such as Inc. Magazine, Washington Business Journal, and Washington Technology. Our continued growth offers opportunity for you to succeed and grow in your career.\xa0InfoReliance does not discriminate in employment opportunities, terms and conditions of employment, or practices. [\nThe tension between possibility and practicality is what we resolve. At Arrow, weave come full circlea from being a parts supplier at the physical heart of the radio business to being a global partner in the ongoing transformation of the most complex and exciting business on the planet. We are visionaries. Innovators. Mentors. In order to thrive and survive in todayas marketplace, we anticipate what will come tomorrow for our forward-thinking partners. A Arrow serves as a supply channel partner for over 100,000 original equipment manufacturers, contract manufacturers and commercial customers through a global network of more than 460 locations in 56 countries. A  We are a Fortune 150 company with over 17,000 employees globally. Headquartered in beautiful Denver, Colorado, with offices worldwide. A  Five Years Out is a community of builders, designers, engineers and imaginers who navigate the path between possibility and practicality. Creating the future of everything from coffee makers to cars. Are you one of them? Then you're working with us. A  A  Stay connected with us through social media Twitter Instagram Facebook Glassdoor A  Summary: At present we have an excellent opportunity for a Software System Engineer at our Melville, NY location. As an integral member of the Application Development Group, you will be responsible for the day-to-day quality and integrity of our Warehouse Management Systems. \xa0 Responsibilities: Capturing customer requirements and apply expert judgment and analysis for the design, development and implementation of technical products and systems. The engineer should have solid experience in software development of applications from the requirements gathering phase to design, development, testing, implementation and documentation of the application. Monitoring and maintaining warehousing applications to ensure reliability/functionality Ability to work with other functional technical areas including business analysts, DBA\u2019s, Network Engineers, Quality Assurance specialists, and Project Managers. Ability to acquire and maintain thorough knowledge of operational, logistical, business processes. Serve as a focal point subject matter expert of warehousing activities. Assist with off-hour production support of our Warehouse Management Systems. Perform other related duties as assigned. Domestic and International travel may be required. \xa0 Requirements: Bachelor level degree in a CS discipline or 5+ years of relevant experience. Hands on experience with C, ProC, PL/SQL, XML in a Unix environment. Experience with Oracle database. Excellent analytical and problem solving skills. Excellent customer service skills. Ability to monitor and manage the progress of tasks. Strong written and verbal communication skills. \xa0 Preferred Qualifications: Experience in development/support of a warehousing applications.\xa0 Experience implementing a warehouse management system. Experience with Oracle Forms/Reports. Experience with Unix shell scripting. Experience with a GUI development tool.  \xa0 What is in it for you?  Training Skills development Performance coaching Medical, dental, vision, paid time off, 401k domestic partners program and more. Community involvement opportunities FUNCTION:IT \xa0 #dice# At Arrow, we are driving innovation and choice by offering employees a variety of benefits designed to keep you and your family physically and financially healthy. A  Our comprehensive, competitive benefits program is an important part of your total compensation package. We offer a variety of plans and coverage including health and welfare, retirement, paid time off, and voluntary benefits as well as resources to help you make cost-effective decisions for you and your family. Everyone counts at Arrow, and our benefits enable you to achieve and maintain better health and plan for your future as we work together toward smarter solutions in tomorrowas technology. A  Arrow offers competitive time off for you, which includes accrued vacation time, personal and floating holidays, in addition to other observed holidays. These are granted based on the date you join the company in any given year. A  http://benefits.arrow.com A  A  EOE Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled A  Arrow Electronics, Inc. is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with disabilities. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please refer to ourA  Hiring Process &A Accommodations Request Instructions A on our Career Site to let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.\n\t\t]

[\nOur client is a trading and they are looking for Project manager/Business Analyst.We operate at the heart of the foreign exchange and fixed income global markets providing electronic trading technology and services. We offer access to multiple execution options, valuable liquidity from diverse sources and help execute transactions efficiently. Our financial technology, platforms and products are continuously evolving to meet the needs of a globally diverse community of professional traders who depend upon our services. For more information ROLE SUMMARY: The Requirements Management & Analysis group, within Technology, is seeking a highly motivated and self-starting Project Manager/Business Analyst. The successful candidate will be responsible for the requirements definition and overall success of a project. Project Management responsibilities include scope and resource management, manage day-to-day project issues and resolution, establish and maintain communication to key stakeholders, and be able to work effectively across organizational boundaries. As a Business Analyst, the successful candidate serves as a liaison between Business users and technical resources in the development or enhancements of complex information systems supporting the Trading Systems (e.g., Settlement System, Billing Systems, Market Monitoring tools). The successful candidate is responsible for creating Business Requirements Documents and Functional Specifications.KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES: \xa0Create and execute project work plans \xa0Identify resource needs and assign individual responsibility Manage day-to-day aspects of project including scope management \xa0Report status to key stakeholders \u2013 project team, internal management \xa0Manage the client through the lifecycle of the project Analyze and document business requirements POSITION: Project Manager/Business Analyst JOB DESCRIPTION Carry out business analysis and assist developers with business knowledge \xa0Write and publish IT technical documentation (i.e. Functional Specifications, process flows, and use cases) in line with NEX SDLC process \xbf Form strong relationships and interface closely with all functional areas, e.g. Product Managers, Development, and QA to gather data and ensure the final work product complies with \xa0expectations \xbf Understand NEX business, product offerings and technology \xa0Participate in issue management and tracking \xa0Review and validate test cases PERSON SPECIFICATION: SKILLS: \xa0Ability to manage multiple schedules and commitments. \xa0Entrepreneurial, willing and ability to multi-task. Polished and professional demeanor with excellent communication and presentation skills.Proven ability to influence cross-functional teams without formal authority \xa0Excellent analytical and problem solving skills \xa0Strong communication and interpersonal skills Efficient time management and organizational skills KNOWLEDGE/EXPERIENCE: \xa05+ years' work experience in Fixed Income either within an investment bank or a systems vendor. \xa05+ years' work experience in I.T. project management. \xa05-7 years Business Analysis experience within the Financial Services IT environmentBachelor's Degree or higher, or equivalent professional experience *\xa0Mindy Passner 201-946-1777 \xa0mpassner@lenmarit.com\n]

column2: Technical Project Manager - Data and Analytics
column5: [\nProject roleDrive the process of rearchitecting our data/reporting infrastructure to support the online arm of Home Services. The existing process has several challenges and needs to support new business needs. The person in this role is expected to reach out to and work with other teams across the enterprise to discover a) what is there and b) how things should be done. While technical expertise is required, deeper technical expertise will be provided by the Reporting & Analytics team as well as the Data Engineering team. This person is expected to use their expertise appropriately to execute on the project and be able to communicate/coordinate effectively across time zones.Required skillsProven experience as a successful project/team leadExcellent written and verbal communication skillsDetail oriented and very well organizedTechnical expertise in data transport systems and protocols; e.g. HTTP, HTTPS, FTP, SFTPTechnical understanding of application-level security; e.g. public/private key crypto, OAUTH2 and other token based cryptography standards/methodsTechnical understanding of database technologies; e.g. relational vs. object vs. columnar data stores, Hadoop/Hive, CSV/TSV data formatsBasic familiarity with cloud offerings such as Google Cloud or AWSProject deliverablesUnderstand the context: come up to speed on the current and future technical landscape, the business insofar as it relates to providing data/reporting, and upcoming data and reporting needs.Identify and document pain points: these may be technical or organizational challenges that specifically need to be addressed to allow our business to move forward.Solution proposals: document and present feasible changes and their likely timelines. These will be evaluated by the Reporting & Analytics team directors to decide on the course of action to take.Solution: drive the organizational and technical project forward through implementation of the solution.Communication: at all steps of the process, in particular where there may be difficult challenges or roadblocks, the Reporting & Analytics team directors should be informed in writing. In addition to this, a weekly summary of progress must be produced to share with the wider org about progress.\xa0\n]

[\nOur client, a leading global financial services company, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 140 countries. They provide consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.Investment Bank's Resource & Location Strategy (R&LS) Staffing Office function is a centralized model developed to support Investment Bank's non-employee utility tool by delivering a best in class end-to-end service for management of the nonemployee population. The Program's purpose is to drive a consistent and streamlined process globally for Approvals, Recruitment, On/Off-boarding, Supplier Performance Management, and Reporting Analytics for Investment Bank's Non-employee Program. Additionally, the Program has business ownership of the Fieldglass and NEMS ID non-employee systems.The Middle Office Risk & Control Lead's primary role will manage multiple risk and control programs/initiatives for the R&LS organization. This includes defining and executing the Business' strategy & approach, processes & controls and system updates/tools and reporting needs to make certain complaint alignment with global risk management policies and procedures. This role will report to the R&LS Staffing Office Middle Office Manager.Key responsibilities will include:- Engage targeted Countries' Senior Management (Legal, Tax and ESC Cluster Head) to initiate, plan and deploy Fieldglass Electronic Work Orders and Invoicing- Ensure Third Party Management compliance for the R&LS Preferred Supplier List. Liaison with Business Activity Owners as required.- Initiate and manage Third Party Management Risk Assessments and Renewal process.- Ensure Third Party Management compliance for the R&LS Inter-company services agreement.- Ensure consistent implementation of plans aligned with the Investment Bank Standard PM Methodology.- Lead the Data Privacy program for R&LS which will include the intake of all Data Privacy submissions, data quality review and interaction with the DPO office, Ensure Cross Border Data Privacy compliance for R&LS Staffing Office Business' processes and systems.- Oversee and drive the Annual Risk Assessment (ARA) process and quarterly Manager's Control Assessment.- Bring together the appropriate stakeholders (within HR/Business/Legal/Tax & Finance) to facilitate strategic discussions on projects and programs- Identify opportunity areas on projects to bring additional value add to internal sectors and stakeholder's i.e. HRCC/Finance/Legal/Business sectors.- Proactively liaise with regional counterparts and keep abreast with industry standards and emerging risks for the R&LS Staffing Office.- Work closely with the R&LS Internal Clients or Key Stakeholders, and various other teams, with focus on maintaining excellent service delivery and ensuring appropriate service control mechanisms are put in place for all projects and programs- Managing and delivering against key projects- Providing communication updates and reviews of all projects \u2013 providing status updates when required- Key interface to Investment Bank Internal audit. Ensure all internal audits are well prepared for and managed effectively. Key participant in reviewing findings and responses.Required skills:- 7-10 years of experience professional experience in DPO/CBDC, risk & control and third party management.- Experience in implementation, execution, quality management of risk and control programs. Experience working with Internal and External Auditors a plus.- Demonstrated leader with knowledge and experience in CBDC/DPO and Risk & Control management policies and standards- Demonstrated ability to lead global efforts and manage team members in a matrix environment.- Willing to be an individual contributor as well as lead. Very strong work ethic, results oriented- Excellent problem solving skills. Ability to see the big pictures with high attention to critical details.- Demonstrated ability to develop and implement strategy and process improvement initiatives.- Ability to present a balanced view of Risk Management to key stakeholders and R&LS Senior leadership.- Strong Excel, PowerPoint and written and verbal communication skills. Experience with CASP, CASP +, iCAPS, Investment BankRisk, COBTRAC, CBAT, eSourcing, and TPRAP a huge plus.- BA/BA required.Please see our complete list of jobs at:www.rmscorp.com\n]

[\n Position Description Position Summary:  The System Administrator will provide sustainment services in support of a DoD Red Hat Enterprise Linux web application hosted in Amazon Web Services. Principle Duties & Responsibilities:  - Monitor and maintain system servers and operating system within a cloud hosting environment. This includes OS patching, updates, and DoD Security Technical Implementation Guides (STIG) management. - Monitor application performance and resource utilization using provided tools and report potential issues to application owners. - Provide initial help desk triage and coordinate trouble ticket resolution with application owners. Work closely with application owners and system users to ensure rapid resolution and highly professional customer service. - Perform back-ups following established processes. - Support shift work to maintain 24/7 coverage of duties. Required Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities:  - Must have at least three or more years experience in RHEL system administration - IAT II certification requirements (Security +, CISSP, CASM, CEH, etc) - Experience in implementing DoD STIGs Additional Requirements:  - Ability to successfully complete the CGI Background Investigation to include; 50 State Criminal, Education and Employment; Additionally, your ability to successfully complete a Credit and/or Driving Records Checks may be conducted if required by the contract for continued employment. - Possession of an ACTIVE SECRET security clearance with a Special Clearance Investigation is required to begin employment; US Citizenship is required. - Demonstrate sufficient knowledge and experience to appropriately apply a methodology to projects that have reasonably well-defined project requirements and deliverables - Proficient in Microsoft Office products and SharePoint - Ability to successfully complete drug testing based on contract requirements. - Ability to establish working relations at all organizational levels. Demonstrate ability to diplomatically and effectively deal with Government officials and program office stakeholders. - Self-motivator with ability to work as part of a team or independently with little supervision or direction. - Professional oral and written presentation skills - Attention to detail and effective problem-solving skills Desired Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities:  - Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Science, Mathematics, or Business - Experience in DoD projects and communications - RHEL System Administration certification Your future duties and responsibilities Required qualifications to be successful in this role At CGI, we're a team of builders. We call our employees members because all who join CGI are building their own company - one that has grown to 65,000 professionals located in 40 countries. Founded in 1976, CGI is a leading IT and business process services firm committed to helping clients succeed. We have the global resources, expertise, stability and dedicated professionals needed to achieve results for our clients - and for our members. Come grow with us. Learn more at www.cgi.com. This is a great opportunity to join a winning team. CGI offers a competitive compensation package with opportunities for growth and professional development. Benefits for full-time, permanent members start on the first day of employment and include a paid time-off program and profit participation and stock purchase plans. We wish to thank all applicants for their interest and effort in applying for this position, however, only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted. No unsolicited agency referrals please. All CGI offers of employment in the U.S. are contingent upon the ability to successfully complete a background investigation. Background investigation components can vary depending upon specific assignment, or upon any US government security clearance if required. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, gender Identity, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, pregnancy, or other status protected by law. CGI will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with CGI's legal duty to furnish information. Skills  * Communication (Oral/Written) * Detail-oriented * Linux * RedHat * System Administration\xa0 Department:  Information Technology\n\t\t]

We believe strongly that if \u201cwe build it, they will come.\u201d Therefore, OUR CULTURE is at the CORE of everything that we do. OUR company VALUES and BELIEFS drive our actions on a daily basis and we believe that Doing The Right Thing for our employees, consultants and clients is what sets us apart from our peers in the industry. As a leading provider of IT staffing resources for a wide variety of industries, we pride ourselves on the ability to supply consistent white-glove service on a national level to both our clients and consultants. Our unique delivery model, built on our company core values, provides a collaborative team approach that ensures success for both the client and the consultant. We partner each client with a single point of contact within our organization and build a team around that account in order to establish a deep understanding of the client\u2019s culture and needs. We then provide the support of our Onboarding and Compliance Department, which works directly with our consultants throughout the whole engagement life cycle. They focus daily on helping both the client and consultant achieve results for a successful outcome. The results speak for themselves! column5: [\nA major end user in the is looking to bring on a MS Business Intelligence Developer / Analyst. [\nThe National Center for Supercomputing Applications (NCSA) advances discovery and innovation through extreme-scale computing, science-enabling software, and the skills of our expert staff. The center is part of the flagship University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign--a world leader in research, teaching, and public engagement\u2014and is located in a micro-urban community that combines cultural vibrancy with affordability and quality of life.\xa0NCSA is looking for one or more Senior Research Programmers to lead software development projects for the research, delivery and support of storage-related products and services on the Blue Waters Petascale system, one of the world\u2019s largest and most powerful scientific resources and follow-on systems. The Senior Research Programmer will provide leadership both at NCSA and within the community on High-Performance Data solutions. Projects include enhancing the state of the art in parallel file systems, advanced tiered data storage solutions, and the development and deployment of new data focused strategies for meeting science team needs on current and future NCSA systems. The position will provide both leadership and hands-on development and support of data related technologies at NCSA. The incumbent will also engage and represent NCSA in the High-Performance Computing and Data communities such as the Lustre community. This individual must be able to work with a diverse population and analyze, modify, and/or create new systems software based on user/project requirements.\xa0Key ResponsibilitiesLead the development of new data related technologies for the Blue Waters project by gathering partner requirements, researching solutions and developing project development and deployment plans.Provide key software development for data related technologies working with and delegating responsibilities to other team members, as appropriate.Provide operational support for data technologies through the production of documentation, appropriate monitoring tools and hands-on support of active problem resolution.Oversee the NCSA support and integration of the Globus Online technology into the NCSA environment to ensure enhancements are made to support the necessary workflow and data management features specified by our partners.Lead efforts toanalyze and resolve software and hardware-related problems, including functional as well as performance issues.Maintain documentation on systems functions, both for internal group use and for operations staff. Work with documentation staff to provide material for production of partner documentation.Train other staff and science team partners on the use and support of new capabilities and services.Research, design, implement and maintain specialized file system servers for multiple environments and users. Lead the testing of these user requirements to make sure the environment fulfills needs.Lead and advise application developers, partners, and consultants on best practices for the use of the supported data systems.Ensure that the data components of the NCSA systems environment are in compliance with NCSA security standards and practices.Working autonomously, produce technical reports and give presentations highlighting work of interest to the broader community.Keep current on skills and knowledge regarding NCSA duties by researching on-line, with periodicals or by attending lectures or conferences.Supervise students, including assigning project tasks and monitoring work.Provide on-call and off-hours support as assigned.Required Education and TrainingBachelor's degree in computer science or related field. Alternate degree fields will be considered/accepted if accompanied by equivalent experience (depending on the nature and depth of experience as it relates to NCSA\u2019s current technologies).Minimum of five years of software development experience with diverse teams, and large software projects including contributions to a file system or other significant data storage technology in a Linux environment.Experience programming in C/C++ as well as Linux shell scripts.\xa0Preferred ExperienceExperience with high-performance computing and data systems including parallel file systems, object based storage, map-reduce and distributed database technologies.Experience programming in a Linux environment ranging from scripting to kernel modules.Two or more years of Unix or Linux System Administration experience in a production HPC environment including developing and using various technologies to monitor the function and performance of data subsystems.Experience with multiple file system types, particularly parallel file systems.Experience performance tuning the entire data storage pathway from an application all the way to the data storage media.\xa0This is a regular academic professional position at NCSA and is an annually renewable, 12/12, 100%-time appointment with regular University benefits. Salary is commensurate with experience and start date will be as soon as possible after the close date of the search. Applicants must possess required education and experience by start date of position. Interviews and hires may occur before the closing date; however, all applications received by the closing date will receive full consideration.To apply, please create your candidate profile at http://jobs.illinois.edu\xa0and upload your cover letter and CV/resume by the close date (02/17/2017). Contact information for three references must be included on the application (letters maybe also be uploaded or sent to the contact below).\xa0 For full consideration, candidates must complete the Hiretouch application process by the above date. The University of Illinois conducts criminal background checks on all job candidates upon acceptance of a contingent offer.\n]

[\n ***This position requires relocation to Orlando, FL or Mechanicsburg, PA***   \xa0 Are you passionate about delivering goals to your client that go above and beyond their expectations?\xa0 Does the opportunity to work with the world\u2019s leading businesses excite you? \xa0Our Workforce Management team helps a lign the needs and priorities of the client organization with those of its workforce, while ensuring the long-term success of the organization.  \xa0 Work you\u2019ll do \xa0 As a Workforce Management Solution Manager ,  you should expect to be involved in the following :  \xa0  ? Navigate the client effectively  ? Establish r elationships with senior clients (VP-C level)  ?  Leading/managing more than one person/team   ?  Design workplans for large complex global engagements, owning risk, budget, resources, client relationship, etc.\xa0   ? M anage and deliver, craft your brand  \xa0  The HRT team   At Deloitte Consulting LLP, helping our clients exploit new technologies like employee engagement tools, advanced workforce planning and analytics we empower HR to better support the business and create value. HR organizations now reduce costs and improve operating effectiveness through process improvements, shared services, outsourcing and employee self-service, but that\u2019s only part of the story, we help them to drive the value this delivers and help the business achieve its strategic objectives in performance and growth.    Learn more about our HR Transformation practice . \xa0 Workforce Strategy & Insights  With the emergence of the gig economy, the change in the demographics of the workforce and the ever-evolving business needs, it\u2019s clear that the workforce of tomorrow will look very different than the workforce of today.\xa0 To be a true business partner with the  credibility  to lead the business \u2011 not just sit at the table - HR can\u2019t just be managing talent, you need to be building the workforce of the future.\xa0 Working with Deloitte enables you to gain the insights you need to build and execute a workforce strategy that will help the business survive today\u2019s disruption. \xa0 \xa0 Qualifications \xa0 Required: 6+ years' related experience Consulting experience required Superior knowledge of the HR function & processes Experience with workforce software such as Kronos, Workbrain, Workforce Software,\xa0ADP eTime, or Ceridian suite of time and attendance software and system infrastructure  Experience in one or more of the following areas:\xa0 Workforce Management, labor cost optimization, payroll tracking, workforce analytics, interfaces using WIM Lead the full lifecycle of a project including, Business Analysis, Functional Specification, System Configuration, Design, Testing  Experience leading requirements gathering workshops or facilitating meetings Experience leading the vendor selection process(client and supplier sides) including RFPs, RFIs, scoring and evaluating products and services  Ability to interact at all levels of the client organization Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills with the ability to exercise mature judgment Experience with and desire to mentor junior staff Up to 20% travel required \xa0 \xa0 Preferred: 8-10 years of related experience Bachelor's degree strongly preferred External consulting experience with a big consulting firm. \xa0 \xa0 ***This position requires relocation to Orlando, FL or Mechanicsburg, PA*** \xa0 \xa0 Deloitte\u2019s culture Our positive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best work every day. We celebrate individuals by recognizing their uniqueness and offering them the flexibility to make daily choices that can help\xa0them to be healthy, centered, confident, and aware. We offer well-being programs and are continuously looking for new ways to maintain a culture where our people excel and lead healthy, happy lives. \xa0 Learn more about Life at Deloitte. \xa0 Corporate citizenship Deloitte is led by a purpose: to make an impact that matters. This purpose defines who we are and extends to relationships with our clients, our people and our communities.\xa0 We believe that business has the power to inspire and transform. We focus on education, giving, skill-based volunteerism, and leadership to help drive positive social impact in our communities.\xa0  Learn more about Deloitte\u2019s impact on the world. \xa0 Recruiter tips We want job seekers exploring opportunities at Deloitte to feel prepared and confident. To help you with your interview, we suggest that you do your research: know some background about the organization and the business area you\u2019re applying to.  Check out recruiting tips from Deloitte professionals. \xa0 #LI:PTY \xa0Deloitte is one of the leading professional services organizations in the United States, specializing in audit, tax, consulting, and financial advisory services with clients in more than 20 industries. We provide powerful business solutions to some of the world's most well-known and respected companies, including more than 75 percent of the Fortune 100.  At Deloitte, you can have a rewarding career on every level. In addition to challenging and meaningful work, you'll have the chance to give back to your community, make a positive impact on the environment, participate in a range of diversity and inclusion initiatives, and find the support, coaching, and training it takes to advance your career. Our commitment to individual choice lets you customize aspects of your career path, your educational opportunities and your benefits. And our culture of innovation means your ideas on how to improve our business and your clients' will be heard. About Deloitte As used in this document, \u201cDeloitte\u201d means Deloitte LLP and its subsidiaries. Please see www.deloitte.com/us/about for a detailed description of the legal structure of Deloitte LLP and its subsidiaries. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law. Disclaimer: If you are not reviewing this job posting on our Careers' site (careers.deloitte.com) or one of our approved job boards we cannot guarantee the validity of this posting. For a list of our current postings, please visit us at careers.deloitte.com.\n\t\t]

Our commitment to individual choice lets you customize aspects of your development. Finally, our culture of innovation means your ideas on how to improve our business and your clients\u2019 will be heard. \xa0 Visit    www.deloitte.com/us/careers    to learn more about our culture, benefits and opportunities. \xa0 Deloitte Consulting LLP is one of the world\u2019s leading management consulting firms for executable strategy, operations, technology, and human capital advisory services. The consulting practice is built around integrated core capabilities \u2011 people, process and technology and industry expertise \u2011 the capabilities needed to help our clients to tackle their most complex challenges. \xa0 Oracle HCM Cloud (Fusion) Solution Engineer \xa0 If you're interested in working on mission-critical solutions, then joining Deloitte Consulting as an Oracle HCM Cloud (Fusion) Solution Engineer could be your most rewarding move. The role provides you the opportunity to sharpen your functional, analytical and business skills while working as a part of a team committed to delivering excellent service for clients around the globe. You will learn new skills that are in demand by our clients, gain expertise in Deloitte\u2019s methodologies and contribute to increasingly complex duties. \xa0 As an Oracle HCM Cloud (Fusion) functional solution engineer, you will use your knowledge and experience with this premier SaaS tool to help your clients solve the most pressing issues facing their HR function today by: \xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0  Working closely with a large team to deliver results for your client Finding deep satisfaction by being responsible for final work product Enjoying the opportunity to forge strong relationships with both the client and project team that will contribute to your growth and development \xa0 To qualify for our Oracle HCM Cloud (Fusion) Solution Engineer role, you should possess the following: \xa0 Knowledge of the HR function and processes  2 - 4 years\u2019 experience in all phases of a full implementation lifecycle (requirements gathering, design, build, go-live, testing) in Oracle HCM Cloud, Oracle EBS HCM, or other Cloud based HRIS Demonstrated interest in Human Resource Information Systems (preferably cloud based technologies) and/or HR Transformation subject matter Ability to travel up to 15 percent U.S. Citizenship preferred, but not required Associate or Bachelor's degree, preferably in Business/Human Resources, Management Information Systems, Computer Science, or related HR / IT discipline \xa0 In Addition, successful Oracle HCM Cloud (Fusion) Solution Engineers will also have the following preferred skills: Strong oral and written communication skills, including presentation skills (MS Visio, MS PowerPoint)  Excellent teamwork and interpersonal skills Ability to handle multiple clients and multiple team members with confidence Aptitude for trouble-shooting and problem-solving, with the ability to exercise mature judgment  \u201cThis position requires relocation to either Orlando, F L or Mechanicsburg, PA\u201d  Deloitte is one of the leading professional services organizations in the United States, specializing in audit, tax, consulting, and financial advisory services with clients in more than 20 industries. We provide powerful business solutions to some of the world's most well-known and respected companies, including more than 75 percent of the Fortune 100.  At Deloitte, you can have a rewarding career on every level. In addition to challenging and meaningful work, you'll have the chance to give back to your community, make a positive impact on the environment, participate in a range of diversity and inclusion initiatives, and find the support, coaching, and training it takes to advance your career. Our commitment to individual choice lets you customize aspects of your career path, your educational opportunities and your benefits. And our culture of innovation means your ideas on how to improve our business and your clients' will be heard. About Deloitte As used in this document, \u201cDeloitte\u201d means Deloitte LLP and its subsidiaries. Please see www.deloitte.com/us/about for a detailed description of the legal structure of Deloitte LLP and its subsidiaries. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law. Disclaimer: If you are not reviewing this job posting on our Careers' site (careers.deloitte.com) or one of our approved job boards we cannot guarantee the validity of this posting. For a list of our current postings, please visit us at careers.deloitte.com.\n\t\t]

[\nKey Responsibilities: Perform various administrative and project-related activities in support of Chandler Factory management.CW will routinely handle details that are confidential and critical in nature.Typical duties may include but are not limited to the following: \u2022 Organizes and manages calendar/schedules for managers \u2022 Makes travel arrangements and prepares expense reports \u2022 Schedules and coordinates logistics for meetings and events \u2022 Maintains office supplies \u2022 Manages departmental recognition \u2022 Creates and sustains systems for retention, protection, retrieval, transfer and disposal of confidential information \u2022 Tracks headcount and spending \u2022 Manages meeting logistics to include uploading to sharepoint/web \u2022 Working within a globally dispersed team We require a willingness to learn and take on additional responsibility, strong interpersonal skills with ability to work well with all levels of internal management and staff, proactive communication skills and a resume that shows a progression of administrative positions supporting higher level management.Requirements: Minimum of 5 years of experience in the following areas: - Knowledgeable on use of Microsoft Office suite including Sharepoint - Experienced at managing highly dynamic meeting schedules and calendaring - Capable and experienced in arranging the logistics of on-site team meetings. - Familiar with purchase order systems (department expenditures) - Understands how to track expenses, create and submit expense report. - Must be experienced in working with a geographically dispersed team (global) - Must be able to work independently with minimal supervision - Will be part of leadership in the Admin teamApply : - Gaurav (gaurav@mavenco.com)\xa0\xa0\n]

[\nProgram Delivery Manager Qualification: Science / Engineering graduateResponsibility:Account Operations: * Review the operational parameters which impact the bottomline (eg pyramid size, utilization etc) for the Project to ensure margins are met. * Raise invoices, as and when due. * Submit monthly budget plans and seek approvals required in case of any deviations. * Communicate and build awareness around MSA and contractual terms. Opportunity Identification and Pursuit: * Identify areas of valueadd in the current Project which can be taken up for account mining. * Support opportunity pursuit when requested (eg differentiators, estimates, underlying risks, scope etc). * Submit draft proposal for review to the Program Delivery Manager. Contracting: * Build an understanding of the MSA structure. * Prepare or validate the SOW / work orders inclusive of scope and milestones, acceptance criteria for the Project. * Negotiate on resources, time, scope, milestones within the scope of the Project. Program Setup: * 1 Project Planning: Create Project plan including aspects such as cost, schedule, scope, requirements, risk, quality, communication & stakeholder management, effort estimation, resource planning. * Seek review comments from Program / Engagement Manager and customer (as required). 2 Risk Management and Dependency Management: Identify and manage Risk during Project onset and during the course of the Project * 3 Establish Project review and communication governance. * 4 Estimation and Resource Planning: Leverage scientific models to arrive at effort estimation and subsequently resource loading and scheduling. * Work with support teams eg Admin, HR to ensure resources are available. * Understand Project boundaries against SOW (scope of work, out of scope and assumptions). * Accountable for internal and customer Project environment including knowledge repository, C20, Project administration tools/applications, helpdesk/ticketing system, customer network connectivity, etc. * Setup team work environment wrt desktops/software/workspace. * 5 Requirements Gathering: Coordinate/ work on requirements gathering and execution process. * Identify key acceptance criteria items, key dependencies and complexity to be managed. Program Delivery: * 1 Requirements Understanding: Understand high level requirements. * Plan and track work packages under purview. * Understand and manage intercomponent dependencies within a work package and interwork package dependencies. * Validate that the requirements given are ready and full to be taken up by the Technical Lead and the team. * Identify gaps in requirements vs the envisaged high level scope and milestone (including NFRs, usability, user adoption and other implicit requirements). 2 Status Reporting: Prepare status reports and conduct management reviews with applicable stakeholders * 3 Signoff: Review design and architecture artifacts through the design, development and implementation phases as applicable. * Oversee timely reviews and sign off by the customer. 4 Re-planning: Undertake continuous re-planning and reprioritization as required to complete the Project on time * 5 Scope Management: Conduct an impact analysis on the cost and other organizational parameters and report to the customer of any changes in the Project. * Perform Project estimation reviews and get approval from customer. 6 Escalation Management: Inform the relevant client stakeholders in a timely manner, in case of exceptions * 7 Metrics Management: Generate and review Project metrics and identify deviations. * Identify and drive corrective actions. * Resolve any escalated issues and escalate further, as required. Change Management: * Set up the Change Control procedures which include a Change Register, Change Impact Analysis and a Change Approval Process for the Project. * Making relevant changes to the SoW to reflect the same. Relationship Management: * Act as the point of contact on the Project delivery, for Project related updates with the client and for regular communication of Project updates. * Understand issues from the client perspective and provide appropriate solutions. * Liaise with relevant stakeholders (onsite Project team, horizontal teams, client team, Delivery Manager, Program Manager, etc) as required. People Management: * Allocate work among team members. * Resolve team conflict & support team building activities. * Provide administrative support as and when required. * Provide inputs on goal setting and performance appraisals of team. * Identify skill gaps and training needs of team members and provide necessary support to address the same. * Provide inputs into the learning and career plans for team members. * Nominate team for awards. * Conduct training through academy and induction of new team members. * Establish backup plan for critical roles (for contingency). Knowledge Management: * Identify reusable assets. * Review any best practices / innovations as circulated within the group. * Identify Project level tools or other items to be built for the Project. * Participate and network with Community of Practice to discuss/ resolve any business problems as faced during projects.Qualifications: Technical Skills SNo Primary Skill Proficiency Level * Rqrd./Dsrd. 1 Duck Creek User Admin NA Required 2 Duck Creek Manuscripts NA Required 3 Duck Creek Batch NA Required 4 .Net Framework NA Required 5 ASP.NET NA Required * Proficiency Legends Proficiency Level Generic Reference PL1 The associate has basic awareness and comprehension of the skill and is in the process of acquiring this skill through various channels. PL2 The associate possesses working knowledge of the skill, and can actively and independently apply this skill in engagements and projects. PL3 The associate has comprehensive, in-depth and specialized knowledge of the skill. She / he has extensively demonstrated successful application of the skill in engagements or projects. PL4 The associate can function as a subject matter expert for this skill. The associate is capable of analyzing, evaluating and synthesizing solutions using the skill.About Cognizant Cognizant (NASDAQ: CTSH) is a leading provider of information technology, consulting, and business process services, dedicated to helping the world's leading companies build stronger businesses. Headquartered in Teaneck, New Jersey (U.S.), Cognizant combines a passion for client satisfaction, technology innovation, deep industry and business process expertise, and a global, collaborative workforce that embodies the future of work. With over 100 development and delivery centers worldwide and approximately 233,000 employees as of March 31, 2016, Cognizant is a member of the NASDAQ-100, the S&P 500, the Forbes Global 2000, and the Fortune 500 and is ranked among the top performing and fastest growing companies in the world. Visit us online at www.cognizant.com or follow us on Twitter: USJobsCognizant.\xa0 EmployeeStatus:  Permanent JobType:  Standard JobShift:  Day Job PostingDate:  Feb 2, 2017, 4:59:42 PM WillTravel:  No Department:  Application Development / Application Maintenance\n\t\t]
