[\nAbout GreenSky  GreenSky is one of the fastest growing companies in America, making it easy for businesses of all sizes to offer credit to their customers with a fast and paperless point-of sale solution. We have 12,000+ merchants enrolled, 600,000+ satisfied customers, $6 billion+ in loans funded, and 700+ employees.  In September, we raised an additional $50 million in funding from Fifth Third Bank. That funding gave us a valuation of $3.6 billion, which puts us in very rare company with other fin-tech unicorns like Stripe and SoFi. Last year alone, we facilitated ~$2 billion in loans and this year we will be close to $4 billion. Our goal is to reach $20 billion by 2020. We have 700+ employees across 4 offices and are growing... fast. That's where you come in...  About the position  We are looking for the best of the best in Atlanta to join our inside sales team. This team is responsible for new merchant acquisition, which means your job is to sell the benefits of the GreenSky platform to the top home improvement contractors in the US. You will be considered wildly successful if you can not only enroll new, high-value merchants, but also make sure they are generating loan volume.  "If you're offered a seat on a rocket ship, you don't ask what seat. You just get on."  - Eric Schmidt, former CEO of Google  Responsibilities  * Develop an understanding of the home improvement industry and GreenSky's competition  * Educate home improvement contractors on the benefits of using GreenSky vs. the competition  * Enroll home improvement contractors in the GreenSky program  * Make a minimum of 60 dials per day  * Document all of your activity in Salesforce.com ("If it's not in Salesforce, it didn't happen")  * Be an awesome employee and teammate  Benefits of working at GreenSky  * Work at one of the fastest growing and most valuable fin-tech startups  * Competitive base salary & uncapped commission  * Upward mobility  * Flexible schedules + PTO  * Medical/dental/vision insurance  * 401k match  * Travel to tradeshows, networking/recruiting events, etc.  * Exposure to executives  * Foosball table and old school Nintendo (we are constantly making our office more awesome)  * Unlimited coffee  * Team happy hours and events  * Fun individual and team contests/incentives  * VP of Sales cooks up pancakes and bacon for everyone on the last day of each month Experience and Skills: \xa0  * BA/BS Degree  * 1-4 years successful sales experience  * You love metrics and data, but you're also a sales beast  * Proven track record of sales success (PS: it's ok to brag, this is sales. Bring awards to your interview)  * Excellent communicator, but an even better listener  * Problem solver (as opposed to a problem spotter)  * Strong closing skills  * Ability to be successful in a fast-pace environment  * Fast learner  * Coachable: You love to constantly improve and seek out feedback  * Team player: You love winning and sharing success with others  * Competitive: You love to win and hate to lose  * Experience with team sports is a HUGE plus  * Salesforce.com experience is a HUGE plus  GreenSky is an equal opportunity employer and will not discriminate against any employee or applicant on the basis of age, color, disability, gender, national origin, race, religion, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any classification protected by federal, state, or local law.  We strongly encourage Armed Forces Veterans to apply \xa0 Job Level:  Mid Career (2+ years) Level of Education:  Any Date Updated:  January 05, 2017 Years of Experience:  2 - 5 Years Starting Date:  ASAP\n\t\t]

[\nEstablished and growing NY based IT staffing firm of almost 20 years seeks a solid Sales / Account Manager with proven Business Development skills.Source, establish, and build upon new and existing accounts, add company to vendor lists, generate solid requisitions for contract, contract to hire and permanent positions (client server, database, networking, ERP, etc..).Work closely and systematically in house with highly experienced IT recruiters.Synthesize and work well with hiring managers, HR, and vendor relation areas.Present qualified candidates to hiring managers.Coordinate interviews between clients and candidates providing professional feedback.Close contract, contract to hire, and permanent position orders while working with recruiters and team.Have a track record of success providing positive communication, proper account/client relationship management and be in constant relentless pursuit of new and repeat business.EXCELLENT COMPENSATION PACKAGE FOR THE RIGHT PERSON!\n]

[\nNorthrop Grumman Mission Systems sector is seeking a Chief Systems Engineer to join the dynamic New Moon team in the Space ISR Systems Division. New Moon is a Major System Acquisition (MSA) providing real-time large-scale automatic and interactive processing and information management. The New Moon Chief Systems Engineer will be responsible for supporting the PM and SE APM in all aspects of schedule and technical performance. Chief Engineer roles and responsibilities include:  * Provide technical leadership and support.  * Lead and/or support Program Management efforts (e.g. Program Management Reviews, MSM, GPMO, etc) * Attend and participate in key engineering forums  * Issue and maintain Technical Directives (TD) which establish and enforce a high quality peer review process, trade study and analysis methodology process  * Build and develop effective technical and program relationships  * Ensure Systems Engineering content is conveyed across the community for System Requirements Reviews (SRR), Critical Design Reviews (CDR), Technology Development Decisions (TDD), Preliminary Design Reviews (PDR) and Product Development Decisions (PDD), Test Readiness Reviews (TRR) * Support program growth initiatives, including identifying and defining new opportunities that result in Engineering Change Proposals (ECPs) This position will be located in Aurora, CO. MSCOMSTR  Qualifications  Basic Qualifications:  * 20+ years with BS (18+ years MS, 15+ years PhD) in Science, Technical, Electrical or Math discipline  * Systems Engineering or Software Engineering background with experience in large development projects, management of multi-discipline teams and management of cost, schedule, and performance  * Bachelor's degree in a technical discipline or equivalent years of experience may be considered in lieu of a degree.  * Prior mission, program or customer experience required.  * An active TS/SCI security clearance w/polygraph is required.  Preferred Qualifications:  * Excellent communicator, with the ability to communicate the program technical baseline and technical vision  * Hands on management and leadership experience within a matrix engineering organization.  * Prior program experience a plus Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit www.northropgrumman.com/EEO. U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.  \xa0  Shift:   1st Shift  Relocation Assistance:   Yes  US Citizenship Required for this Position:   Relocation assistance may be available  Business Sector:   United States-Colorado-Aurora  Clearance:   SCI\xa0 Shift:  1st Shift Relocation Assistance:  Yes US Citizenship Required for this Position:  Relocation assistance may be available Business Sector:  United States-Colorado-Aurora Clearance:  SCI Clearance:  SCI\n\t\t]
column6: [\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\tNorthrop Grumman is a leading global security company providing innovative systems, products and solutions in unmanned systems, cyber, C4ISR, and logistics and modernization to government and commercial customers worldwide. We hold ourselves to a higher standard, both in the products we deliver and in the way we conduct ourselves throughout the entire customer experience. Because, after all, we are in the business of securing a great deal more than just our place in the market. Our mission is to be at the forefront of technology and innovation, delivering superior capability in tandem with maximized cost efficiencies. The security solutions we provide help secure freedoms for our nation as well as those of our allies. Squarely meeting our obligations, fiscally and technologically, isn't just a business goal, but a moral imperative. To that end, as we evolve as a company, the responsibility we feel for our country and the citizens and troops we help support grows with us.\n\t\t\t\t\t\t]

column5: [\nAre you an experienced sales/business development professional in the IT recruiting and staffing space? Do you have a strong existing book of business? Are you comfortable being judged on the strength of the business you bring in?\xa0If you said yes to all of this, then we should talk!\xa0Mercury Systems, Inc.\xa0is a global IT staff augmentation and services firm. Since our inception, we have been providing quality and cost-effective IT talent solutions to Fortune 1000 companies, mid-sized, and start-up companies. We are currently in need of a Client Development Director\xa0with strong client relationships to join our team and bring on new clients. You\u2019ll be supported by a team of hard-working, highly-motivated technical recruiters to ensure clients you win are being served.\xa0Responsibilities:Open new business opportunities through exceptional influencing and relationship building skillsDevelop new business while applying our proprietary methodologies and tools, including identification, qualification, positioning, bidding, competitive analysis, and closingLiaison between client talent acquisition/talent attraction team and internal recruiting team and consistently deliver quick feedback, to deliver high quality candidates for their requirements.Involvement in relevant community, trade, and professional organizationsUnderstand client business and IT initiatives, as well as their specific technical and cultural environments to provide proactive workforce planning.\xa0Qualifications & RequirementsAt least 3 years direct experience in IT staffing sales related to contract staffing, permanent placements, and in-house projectsHigh comfort level with KPI/performance-based evaluationDemonstrably strong existing client network and relationships. Must be able to show proof of past ROI and solid results, not just a list of names.Successful track record of closing deals through strong relationshipsSolid understanding of the IT staffing industry, IT sales, and the full cycle recruitment processesUnderstanding of computer applications and emerging technologiesStrong interpersonal and customer service skillsSuperior time management and communication skillsProficiency with Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, etc.)Self-motivated, energetic, and enthusiastic in carrying out responsibilitiesMust be coachable, collaborative, have the ability to work independently, and as a part of a teamKnowledge or proficiency with Internet-based tools and applicant tracking systems is a plusCollege degree or equivalent business experience\xa0\xa0Compensation package includes base salary plus holiday pay, competitive commission structure, and health insurance.\xa0Qualified candidates who do not now or will not in the future require sponsorship are invited to submit their credentials.\n]

column2: Java Developer - Eden Prairie, MN or Boston, MA
column5: [\nTransform health care and change the way consumers engage with technology.  \xa0 Sounds like a big challenge, right? Here, at Optum, you have the opportunity to achieve great things while you showcase your passion and technical expertise as a (Type of Developer) Applications Developer. You'll be inspired by working alongside some of the most brilliant minds in technology who bring compassion, energy and focus to their work every day on a mission to change health care as we know it. Join us! Come share who you are and start doing  your life's best work.(sm)  \xa0 As part of our development team, you will predominantly be involved in building business solutions by creating new and modifying existing software applications. You'll stretch your skills and grow your careers as a primary contributor in designing, coding, testing, debugging, documenting and supporting all types of applications consistent with the established specifications and business requirements in order to deliver business value.  \xa0 To learn more about Java careers at UnitedHealth Group, watch this video  \xa0  Primary Responsibilities:  * Assist in managing and coordinating all production related activities with Service Coordinator and a team of offshore resources.  * Provide leadership in critical production issue resolution both (Priority 1 and Priority 2).  * Responsibility, at a high level, includes application availability, reliability and stability on a 7 x 24 x 365 basis.  * Be willing to work on 24x7 on call basis.  * Ensure timely resolution of all production issues meeting or exceeding SLA's.  * Ensure that the work delivered by the team is of high quality.  * Work with business to prioritize production issues for resolution.  * Assist Service Coordinator and Service Manager in providing management status reports on daily, weekly and monthly basis.  * Assist Service Coordinator and Service Manager in scheduling OM and work order tasks including management of customer-driven priorities.  * Ensure that all documentation has been updated and that work product meets UDP / SOX compliance requirements  * Conduct or facilitate root cause analysis on all in-scope incidents and recommend a corrective action plan.  * Predict emerging customer needs and develop innovative solutions to meet them  * Solve unique and complex problems with broad impact on the business  * Participate in the development of business strategy  * Develop and manage business plans to achieve objectives  * Lead large, complex projects to achieve key business objectives  * Translate highly complex concepts in ways that can be understood by a variety of audiences  * Influence senior leadership to adopt new ideas, products, and/or approaches  * Direct cross-functional and/or cross-functional teams  * Deploy and maintain Applications/Systems  \xa0  Required Qualifications:  \xa0  * 5 or more years of experience developing in Java  * 1 or more years experience leading a team of software engineers or support personnel.  * 3 or more years experience in developing or supporting applications in a commercial environment  * Demonstrated hands on experience with middleware technologies (e.g. Mule ESB, RabbitMQ or others)   \xa0   Preferred Qualifications:  * Experience leading Scrum teams  * Experience with RESTful security approaches  * Big Data experience  * Experience working within a Cloud environment  * HIPAA/PHI experience  * Healthcare experience Technology Careers with Optum. Information and technology have amazing power to transform the health care industry and improve people's lives. This is where it's happening. This is where you'll help solve the problems that have never been solved. We're freeing information so it can be used safely and securely wherever it's needed. We're creating the very best ideas that can most easily be put into action to help our clients improve the quality of care and lower costs for millions. This is where the best and the brightest work together to make positive change a reality. This is the place to do  your life's best work.(sm)  \xa0  Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.   UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.     Keywords: Java, software, Scrum, Eden Prairie, MN, Minnesota, Boston, MA, Massachusetts  \xa0 Department:  Information Technology\n\t\t]

column5: [\n Overview  \xa0 Deloitte is one of the leading professional services organizations in the United States, specializing in audit, tax, consulting, and financial advisory services with clients in more than 20 industries. We provide powerful business solutions to some of the world\u2019s most well-known and respected companies, including more than 75 percent of the Fortune 100. \xa0 At Deloitte, in addition to challenging and meaningful work, you\u2019ll have the chance to give back to your community and make a positive impact on your peers. Our commitment to individual choice lets you customize aspects of your development. Finally, our culture of innovation means your ideas on how to improve our business and your clients\u2019 will be heard. \xa0 Visit  http://www.deloitte.com/us/careers to learn more about our culture, benefits and opportunities. \xa0 Deloitte Consulting LLP is one of the world\u2019s leading management consulting firms for executable strategy, operations, technology, and human capital advisory services. The consulting practice is built around integrated core capabilities \u2011 people, process and technology and industry expertise \u2011 the capabilities needed to help our clients to tackle their most complex challenges. \xa0 Workday HCM Data Conversion Solution Engineer, Deloitte Consulting LLP \xa0 If you're interested in working on mission-critical solutions, then joining Deloitte Consulting as a Workday HCM Data Conversion Solution Engineer could be your most rewarding move. The role provides you the opportunity to sharpen your technical, analytical and business skills while working as a part of a team committed to delivering excellent service for clients around the globe. You will learn new skills that are in demand by our clients, gain expertise in Deloitte\u2019s methodologies and contribute to increasingly complex duties. \xa0 In conjunction with our other delivery centers around the world, we offer development and sustainment services for our clients, both pre and post-implementation. Our continued growth has created the need for application development and management professionals to provide services in support of our client\u2019s systems and business processes. Successful candidates will demonstrate both their ability to work independently and experience making decisions to complete assigned responsibilities from center leadership. We are seeking exceptional candidates who have the commitment to join a world-class client delivery organization that is a part of one of the world's premier consulting firms. \xa0 We strive to be recognized as the leading professional services firm by demanding and delivering excellence, and by providing interesting, challenging work and opportunities for personal and professional growth. Come and excel within Deloitte Consulting. Our delivery centers provide complete operations services for application management, custom development, and business process support for clients. Our teams develop post implementation support environments, construct the transition plan from the project team to the support team, and support and maintain the client applications and technology infrastructure. \xa0 Illustrative responsibilities include: \xa0 Responsible for supporting and leading data extraction, mapping and conversion tasks Converting ERP data such as PeopleSoft, SAP and Oracle HR into the Workday format Write scripts to automate data conversion Identifies key drivers of a defined problem and proposes solutions Identifies and solves problems using analysis, experience, and judgment Performs analysis and effective diagnosis of clients\u2019 issues Selects the most relevant tools/techniques to meet specific client requirements Develops and shares reusable assets that can be readily applied to new client projects Understands the benefits of using state of the art methods and tools and their application on a particular engagement; contributes to continuous development of methods and tools Develops solutions to client problems through application of personal experience and methods and tools; validates solutions to subject matter experts Demonstrates accountability and contributions to the successful realization of client goals  If you are interested in a position, please contact us. To qualify for our Workday HCM role, you should possess the following:  \xa0 Experience in Workday full life cycle implementations  At least 7 years strong HCM Consulting experience from a leading consulting firm in technologies such as SAP, PeopleSoft, Oracle, Lawson, etc.  We will consider industry hires with no prior consulting experience but they must possess deep prior HRMS experience  Must have experience leading project teams through all phases of the technology implementation lifecycle (requirements gathering, design, build, go-live, testing)  Experience with owning project budget, risk, resources and staffing  Must be hands-on and in the weeds of the project and technology, this is NOT a PMO role  Workday certification is a plus Solid verbal and written communication skills  Bachelor's degree  Ability to travel up to 15 percent \xa0 In addition, successful Workday HCM will also have the following preferred skills: Strong oral and written communication skills, including presentation skills (MS Visio, MS PowerPoint)  Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills with the ability to exercise mature judgment  Eagerness to mentor junior staff  Strong presentation skills \xa0\xa0 \u201cThis position requires relocation to either Orlando, F L or Mechanicsburg, PA\u201d  Deloitte is one of the leading professional services organizations in the United States, specializing in audit, tax, consulting, and financial advisory services with clients in more than 20 industries. We provide powerful business solutions to some of the world's most well-known and respected companies, including more than 75 percent of the Fortune 100.  At Deloitte, you can have a rewarding career on every level. In addition to challenging and meaningful work, you'll have the chance to give back to your community, make a positive impact on the environment, participate in a range of diversity and inclusion initiatives, and find the support, coaching, and training it takes to advance your career. Our commitment to individual choice lets you customize aspects of your career path, your educational opportunities and your benefits. And our culture of innovation means your ideas on how to improve our business and your clients' will be heard. About Deloitte As used in this document, \u201cDeloitte\u201d means Deloitte LLP and its subsidiaries. Please see www.deloitte.com/us/about for a detailed description of the legal structure of Deloitte LLP and its subsidiaries. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law. Disclaimer: If you are not reviewing this job posting on our Careers' site (careers.deloitte.com) or one of our approved job boards we cannot guarantee the validity of this posting. For a list of our current postings, please visit us at careers.deloitte.com.\n\t\t]

[\n\t\t\tWe are seeking a Senior SQL Database Administrator. The incumbent has principal responsibility for providing application support services that involve the design, documentation, development, modification, testing, installation, implementation, and support of the Health Plan database infrastructure(s).RESPONSIBILITIES\u2022 Analyze, design, develop and test utility and other programs (to include third party optimization tools) to monitor or enhance system performance.\u2022 Prepare documentation for application/database development to include project plans, workflow diagrams, deployment diagrams, data dictionaries and database inventory.\u2022 Maintain an infrastructure of test systems for production applications and coordinate refresh schedule for production to test replication.\u2022 Conduct research and evaluation activities for the enhancement or replacement of current applications and software programs deployed in the agency and prepares and presents findings and recommendations.\u2022 Ensure that all IT databases are backed up. Monitor, validate and author appropriate policy in conjunction with current HIPAA and internal IT policy.\u2022 Other duties as assigned.QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED\u2022 B.S. in computer science or 5+ years in the information technology field using skills stated herein.\u2022 Expert knowledge (5+ years) in MS SQL Server (2012), including but not limited to database management concepts and principles; diverse database architectures; data administration; developing and administering data standards, policies, and procedures; and developing and implementing databases. Knowledge of DB2 and/or Oracle optional but preferred.\u2022 Expert knowledge (5+ years) in SSIS, SSRS, SQL Analytics, and other SQL scripting. Exposure to .Net preferred.\u2022 Knowledge of clustering, mirroring, shadowing, performance tuning, capacity planning, and data replication. Ability to conduct workflow analysis to determine application and software requirements.\u2022 Specific knowledge of large-scale project management and ability to work both independently and in a multi-disciplinary team setting.\u2022 Ability to communicate orally and in writing in order to carry out projects, plan and develop systems, prepare reports, provide recommendations, prepare analyzes and findings, and maintain liaison with a variety of officials.\n\t\t]

[\nJob ID: JR06810   Position Description: FIS solutions for capital markets help banks, broker-dealers, futures commission merchants and other financial institutions improve the efficiency, transparency and control of their trading and processing. From market connectivity, trade execution and securities financing to accounting, data management and tax reporting, our solutions provide cross-asset support for the entire trade lifecycle. We help our customers increase efficiency, make more informed decisions, improve their use of capital and manage risk more effectively. For more information, please visit www.sungard.com/capitalmarketsWall Street Concepts (WSC) provides tax information reporting solutions to the financial industry for REMICs, Pass Through Mortgage Backed Securities, Long term OID bonds, Master Limited Partnerships, mutual funds, REITs, Unit Investment Trusts, and Widely Held Fixed Investment Trusts (WHFITs). Our services facilitate the production of Forms 1099 and K-1, as well as the preparation of individual tax returns.WSC is looking for a person who works well in a high paced challenging environment. This is an interactive position where you will be required to understand the client/internal users requests and follow them through to successful resolution, providing operational support for our tax reporting processing.Position ResponsibilitiesRespond to customer inquiries and internal staff regarding the running of operational tasks.Work with WSC staff and customers to ensure the quality and completeness of services and output.Analyze issues and processes in order to troubleshoot potential problems and to develop, and maintain processing efficiencies.Maintain documentation on all operational tasks.RequirementsBachelor's degree At least five years of professional experiencePrior customer service experience in a professional settingAbility to work extended hours during high season of January-AprilProficiency with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Access, Outlook)Sybase experience a plus.     We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal,  state or local protected class.\n]

column5: [\nDescription   Palo Alto Networks(r) is a revolutionary and dynamic company creating next generation enterprise security products. If you are a motivated, intelligent, creative, and hardworking individual who wants to contribute and make a difference, this job is for you! Description:  \xa0 As a member of the management software group, you will be responsible for designing and developing the central/console management software for Palo Alto Networks next-generation security platform. You will take ownership for large software components, work with product management on user requirements, apply your knowledge to functional design, utilize your programming skills for efficient and robust implementation, and interact with quality assurance and field support teams in the whole software development cycle. Responsibilities:  \xa0 * Responsible for development of the User Interface of the central/console management software for Palo Alto Networks' next-generation firewall. * Participate in architecture; define new web based features for firewall appliance and central management software * Individual contribution for complex web software development * Design, develop and maintain web framework * Design, develop and maintain web applications * Work with different development and quality assurance groups to achieve the best quality * Suggest and implement improvements to development processes Qualifications:  \xa0 * Prior experience in web based GUI development, preferably for a networking appliance * Excellent Javascript programming skills * Proficiency in PHP * Experience with EXTJS/Ajax Framework is a plus * Experience with XML is a plus * Strong ability to independently debug development issues * MS/BS in Computer Science or equivalent * 5 years of relevant experience Learn more about Palo Alto Networks here and check out our fast facts https://paloaltonetworks.box.com/s/8h44raowfslfhrfmfkrmrgig0ms3z8ae\n]
column6: [\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\tWe\u2019re searching for dreamers: those who envision a world free from breaches and attacks, where information is safely passed on for the good of humanity. Does this keep you up at night? We\u2019re looking for people who want to challenge themselves in the dynamic world of cybersecurity. Palo Alto Networks is changing the game of threat prevention, and we want you to be a part of it.\n\t\t\t\t\t\t]

[\n Job Title: \xa0 Qlikview Operations Lead Location: \xa0 Atlanta, GA Work Auth: \xa0 US Citizens Only Interview: \xa0 Phone then Skype (Possible F2F) Duration: \xa0 Contract to Permanent Rate: \xa0 $40-45/hr on Corp to Corp Fulltime Salary: \xa0 $100k base + 15% bonus Start Date: \xa0 2-3 weeks after hire Client: \xa0 Leading Bank Primarily looking at backend coding to assure contracts are coding correctly As a member of the Information Delivery Team in Corporate Functions Services (CFS), this person will be the QlikView Operations Lead for QlikView dashboards and serve as the Single Point of Contact (SPOC) to the QlikView Center of Excellence (COE). The Lead will be responsible for operational support of QlikView dashboard deliverables across all Practices in the CFS Business Intelligence Office (BIO) and coordinate with the QlikView COE on a daily basis. The Operations Lead responsibilities include, but are not limited to: * Review of dashboard architecture and design based on business requirements documentation * Perform code review of scripts created by the development team to ensure best practices are followed and dashboard certification meetings with COE are successful * Review and approve dashboard releases for migration to QA and Production environments * Develop Information Delivery documentation for new processes implemented by the COE * Conduct in-depth analysis of usage data to help drive user adoption. * Handles most complex data, designs new process, and architects new QlikView solutions * Manage communications among the Information Delivery Team, Practices and QlikView COE * Mentor QlikView developers * Assist with "white boarding" sessions and development of requirements documentation Basic Qualifications: \xa0 * Bachelor's degree or an equivalent combination of education and related work experience in banking, finance and business intelligence * 4 years' experience as a developer with QlikView/Tableau using the SDLC and Agile processes * Work experience with multiple database platforms, and BI and Dashboard tools * Above average SQL skills in Oracle and DB2 data bases * Knowledge of SDLC and Agile processes * Skilled in use of MS Office Preferred Qualifications: \xa0 * 5-7 years QlikView development experience in QlikView, QlikSense, N-Printing and Qlik Maps * Experience with Financial Services industry * QlikView Developer Certification * Experience with the offshore development model\xa0 Date Posted:  11/30/2016\n\t\t]

[\nAre you passionate about helping clients solve complex challenges and supporting them through critical transformations?\xa0 As a member of our Organization Transformation & Talent (OT&T) practice, you will deliver change management, organization design and governance, culture and technology adoption solutions that enable the success of transformation goals for industry leading clients. \xa0 Would you like to work for an organization committed to your professional development and personal success?\xa0 Deloitte offers an award-winning culture that supports our employees\u2019 development of their personal brand through learning opportunities, professional experiences, inclusion, collaboration and personal well-being.\xa0  \xa0 Work you\u2019ll do As an Organizational Change Management Manager, you will use data-driven solutions to address the human factors affecting an organization\u2019s availability to reach its strategic objectives.\xa0  \xa0 Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Manage the development of frameworks that support improved client future-state organizational design and alignment  Manage the process for preparing job descriptions and profiles that are legally defensible and that may include job responsibilities and tasks, accountabilities, and competency definitions and matrices  Apply behavioral tools to assess the impact of change on organizations, using assessments of organizational culture, performance and readiness for change  Prepare comprehensive change and workforce transition plans and programs, including strategies to support change and transition initiatives and leadership  Manage identification of required leadership/stakeholder attributes and articulate the importance of leadership in an effective change process  Create competency models and career paths to aid in the selection and development of employees Lead and contribute to practice development initiatives including culture building, internal community involvement, eminence, recruiting, whitepapers, etc. Responsible for business development efforts, including Statements of Work (SOW), proposal development, client presentations, etc. Act in a mentoring capacity to support the career development of OT&T colleagues \xa0 The team A part of Deloitte Consulting LLP, our Human Capital professionals work closely with clients around the world to develop effective and efficient people-centered solutions.\xa0 Our team helps clients define their talent strategy and align it with their executive business vision using innovative strategic frameworks that enhance HR service delivery models, set the stage for continuously improving operational excellence, and reimagines the HR brand.\xa0  Learn more about our Human Capital practice . \xa0 Strategic shifts such as new products and services, market expansion, evolving growth strategies, innovative technology, new leadership, or mergers and acquisitions, all impact a company\u2019s most important asset, their people. With these shifts, the need to align corporate culture, structure and talent with business strategy becomes more urgent. Deloitte\u2019s OT&T practice helps our clients with the critical changes required for success, offering business-oriented and data-driven solutions to drive transformation agendas and achieve high impact, sustainable business results.  Learn more about our Organization Transformation & Talent practice  . \xa0 Qualifications Required: Minimum six (6) years of relevant experience in a consulting or industry role, with at least one (1) year of relevant experience in an external consulting role Minimum four (4) years of experience leading multiple project teams simultaneously on relevant engagements Proven experience in business development and/or proposal development in support of related specialty areas Bachelors\u2019 degree Ability to travel 80-100% of the time (Monday \u2011 Thursday/Friday) Preferred: Previous experience mentoring, training and developing junior members of the team; experience in employee performance reviews Previous experience in project planning, budget oversight and staffing of project teams including time management Advanced degree in related specialization area Demonstrated interest in a profession in Human Capital work through professional organizations, coursework, certifications, conference attendance, etc. Strong oral and written communication skills, including presentation skills (MS Visio, MS PowerPoint, MS Word, MS Excel) How you\u2019ll grow At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there\u2019s always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world.\xa0 From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs at Deloitte University, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career. \xa0 Explore Deloitte University, The Leadership Center. \xa0 Benefits At Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits.  Learn more about what working at Deloitte can mean for you. \xa0 Deloitte\u2019s culture Our positive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best work every day. We celebrate individuals by recognizing their uniqueness and offering them the flexibility to make daily choices that can help\xa0them to be healthy, centered, confident, and aware. We offer well-being programs and are continuously looking for new ways to maintain a culture where our people excel and lead healthy, happy lives. \xa0 Learn more about Life at Deloitte. \xa0 Corporate citizenship Deloitte is led by a purpose: to make an impact that matters. This purpose defines who we are and extends to relationships with our clients, our people and our communities.\xa0 We believe that business has the power to inspire and transform. We focus on education, giving, skill-based volunteerism, and leadership to help drive positive social impact in our communities.\xa0  Learn more about Deloitte\u2019s impact on the world. \xa0 Recruiter tips We want job seekers exploring opportunities at Deloitte to feel prepared and confident. To help you with your interview, we suggest that you do your research: know some background about the organization and the business area you\u2019re applying to.  Check out recruiting tips from Deloitte professionals. \xa0 Deloitte is one of the leading professional services organizations in the United States, specializing in audit, tax, consulting, and financial advisory services with clients in more than 20 industries. We provide powerful business solutions to some of the world's most well-known and respected companies, including more than 75 percent of the Fortune 100.  At Deloitte, you can have a rewarding career on every level. In addition to challenging and meaningful work, you'll have the chance to give back to your community, make a positive impact on the environment, participate in a range of diversity and inclusion initiatives, and find the support, coaching, and training it takes to advance your career. Our commitment to individual choice lets you customize aspects of your career path, your educational opportunities and your benefits. And our culture of innovation means your ideas on how to improve our business and your clients' will be heard. About Deloitte As used in this document, \u201cDeloitte\u201d means Deloitte LLP and its subsidiaries. Please see www.deloitte.com/us/about for a detailed description of the legal structure of Deloitte LLP and its subsidiaries. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law. Disclaimer: If you are not reviewing this job posting on our Careers' site (careers.deloitte.com) or one of our approved job boards we cannot guarantee the validity of this posting. For a list of our current postings, please visit us at careers.deloitte.com.\n\t\t]

[\n\xa0Title: ETL Tester PractitionerDescription:\xa0 STG is a SEI CMMi Level 5 company with several Fortune 500 and State Government clients. STG has several openings for ETL Testing Practitioner. These positions are based in Dearborn, MI for a large Fortune 500 Automotive firm.\xa0 Please note that these project assignments are with our own direct clients.\xa0 We do not go through any vendors.\xa0 STG only does business with direct end-clients. These positions are expected to be long term. HQL, python)1+ years of proven test experience in the range of Big Data architectures and frameworks including Hadoop0.5 to 1 year of any application development experience (Preferably Java, ETL, Mainframe, LINUX/UNIX etc.)Must be a self-starter with the ability to work on complex projects and analyze business requirements independentlyAbility to design test scenarios/test cases for positive, negative, alternative flows and ensure complete requirement coverageMust be able to identify and document testing issues and quality risks, as well as participate in defect remediationWillingness to follow the Agile Testing practices and guidelines, including Defect Management using HP ALM Quality Center toolExperience Preferred: Experience working on a Scaled Agile Frameworks Delivery Team using practices from Behavior Driven DevelopmentAbility to work in a diverse global team environment sharing ideas and working collaborativelyMust have strong organizational and analytical skillsMust have excellent interpersonal skills with both written and verbal communication skillsMust be able to work independently with minimal supervision when necessaryAbility to evaluate and implement new initiatives on process improvement and technology projects*** NO THIRD PARTY CANDIDATES***Resume Submittal Instructions:Interested/qualified candidates should email their word formatted resumes to Ms. Rama Narayanan at rama.narayanan@stgit.com /or contact at 248.712.6732. column6: [\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\tTSYS\xae makes payments possible for hundreds of millions of consumers who navigate today's global marketplace. We do more than support payments \u2013 we support people. [\nThis role will be the sole support representative, This position is also responsible to produce operational reports on a scheduled basis. Essential Functions: Strategy & Planning * Participate in and support capacity planning and the development of long-term strategic goals for systems and software in conjunction with end-users and department managers. * Coordinate with relevant business units to implement desktop and server systems that utilize industry best practices to meet corporate objectives. * Deploy workstations, servers, printers, networking equipment, firewalls, and all host security applications. * Assess need for any system reconfiguration (minor or significant), make recommendations, and execute them as required. Operational Management * Manage location communications, including email, VoIP system, call management systems, voice mail, video conferencing systems, workstations, and mobile connectivity to and from the WAN, LAN, and WLANs * Manage all operating systems and end-user software. * Ensure the integrity and security of enterprise data on host computers, multiple databases, and during data transfer in accordance to business needs and industry best-practices and compliance. * Manage user accounts, permissions, and access rights in accordance with company policies. * Recommend, schedule, and perform software and hardware improvements, upgrades, patches, reconfigurations, and/or purchases. * Conduct testing and development of disaster recovery plans to detect faults, minimize malfunctions, and backup systems. * Anticipate, mitigate, identify, troubleshoot, and resolve hardware and software problems on servers, input/output fleet, and workstations. Escalate incidents as necessary. * Analyze system, server, application, network, and input/output device performance through various SNMP and vendor based tools. * Participate in negotiations with vendors and contractors to secure products and services in a timely and professional manner. * Develop, document, and maintain policies, procedures and associated training plans for system/network administration and their appropriate use. - Provide multiple solutions to meet the customer's needs and find ways to delight our customers.\xa0OTHER EXPERIENCE AND QUALIFICATIONS: . 5+ years of experience with server operating systems support specific to Windows and LINUX3+ years of experience with installing and managing VMware Enterprise including Performance tuning, capacity planning, and managing DRS enabled clusters of ESXi hosts. [\nNorthrop Grumman is seeking a motivated professional to join our team as an ARAT Simulation and Test Engineer. This position is located in Aberdeen, MD. ARAT is looking for a full time Junior Simulation and Test Engineer to support a large contract in the APG area in support of the US Army Communications Electronic Command (CECOM). Candidate will serve as a Junior Simulation and Test Engineer for a technical program with US Army CECOM. The primary focus of this position is the development of radar threat simulations that will be used during ASE equipment software testing and validation. The ideal candidate should have strong analytical skills, be curious, resourceful, independently motivated, and detail oriented. Tasks performed may include, but are not limited to, radar signal parameter analysis/interpretation, radar signal simulation development, test plan development and execution, test analysis and reporting, QA, software design and development for applications. This position requires strong written and oral communications skills as well as the ability to work both independently and within a multidisciplinary team. After training, the successful team member will be able to review and interpret EWIR data and other RF parametric information, develop and program RF simulations for lab test purposes, develop and maintain simulation documentation, develop and execute test plans, maintain simulations with configuration control procedures and maintain appropriate file library with programmed simulations.  Qualifications  Basic Qualifications:  1. Must possess BS/MS degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Mathematics, or Physics. 2. Must be a US Citizen 3, Must possess or be able to obtain a Secret Clearance. Note: Must possess a minimum of an Interim Clearance to Start. 4. Must have a basic knowledge, with training, interpret parametric data and descriptions of both mechanical and RF capabilities of a system in order to understand how the system functionally operates and use that information to create radar emitter simulations. 5. Must be capable of discerning which design and functional characteristics of radar systems affect which characteristics of an emitted radar signal. 6. Must be able to develop test plans per provided requirements, execute the testing to support all test phases, perform test analysis, troubleshoot errors (hardware, software, and simulation), and develop test reports. 7. Must be comfortable using standard Windows and Office tools; capable of learning and using basic interfaces of other operating systems (Linux, OpenVMS) 8. Must be capable of reliably following established processes and procedures for development and testing including configuration management. 9. Must have strong communication skills, both written and oral. 10. Must be able to work both within a team and autonomously as tasks dictate. 11. Must be able to digest new technical information at a rapid pace for practical use. 12. Must have good time management capabilities- able to both pace workload and provide feedback to leads on task progress. 13. Must have an eagerness to improve efficiency and streamline work procedures.  Preferred Qualifications:  1. Familiarity with Aircraft Survivability Equipment (ASE) system integration, RF simulators, RWR/RSDS test equipment, ELINT and EO/IR systems. 2. Familiarity with engineering hardware analysis tools (Spectrum Analyzers, Oscilloscopes, Network Analyzers) and hardware connectivity and protocols. Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit www.northropgrumman.com/EEO. U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions  \xa0  Shift:   1st Shift  Relocation Assistance:   Yes  US Citizenship Required for this Position:   No relocation assistance available  Business Sector:   United States-Maryland-Aberdeen  Clearance:   Secret\xa0 Shift:  1st Shift Relocation Assistance:  Yes US Citizenship Required for this Position:  No relocation assistance available Business Sector:  United States-Maryland-Aberdeen Clearance:  Secret Clearance:  Secret\n\t\t]
column6: [\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\tNorthrop Grumman is a leading global security company providing innovative systems, products and solutions in unmanned systems, cyber, C4ISR, and logistics and modernization to government and commercial customers worldwide. We hold ourselves to a higher standard, both in the products we deliver and in the way we conduct ourselves throughout the entire customer experience. Because, after all, we are in the business of securing a great deal more than just our place in the market. Our mission is to be at the forefront of technology and innovation, delivering superior capability in tandem with maximized cost efficiencies. The security solutions we provide help secure freedoms for our nation as well as those of our allies. Squarely meeting our obligations, fiscally and technologically, isn't just a business goal, but a moral imperative. To that end, as we evolve as a company, the responsibility we feel for our country and the citizens and troops we help support grows with us.\n\t\t\t\t\t\t]

column5: [\nSUMMARY:\xa0Designs, develops, implements, and maintains data models, database schemas and database systems. Installs, configures, administers, and maintains databases systems on multiple platforms. Develop, implement, and maintain ETL processes and programs.\xa0This position is for a Data Systems Analyst in our client\u2019s applications development group. The Data Systems Analyst is responsible for understanding and analyzing project requirements to develop flexible and robust Operational and/or Analytical / Dimensional logical and physical data models.The role requires strong collaboration with application development teams, business teams, and key stakeholders to design robust, scalable, operational, data warehouse, data mart, and/or third party solutions. This position demands a well-organized, action oriented team player with exceptional time management skills to support multiple initiatives simultaneously and in a very fast paced environment. The Data Systems Analyst will participate in all aspects of the software development process including, requirements gathering, designing, coding, unit testing, quality assurance, and deployment documentation. The Data Systems Analyst is expected to work well within a collaborative team of software professionals and have technical group leadership abilities to lead data modeling and data management activities.\xa0DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:\xa0Reviews and analyzes database requirements; develops detailed database design specifications to meet identified requirements in a the database environment.\xa0Reviews and analyzes user needs; assist to determine equipment and software requirements for solutions to problems.\xa0Analyze and understand business data requirements to create accurate, extensible, flexible logical data models using modeling tools e.g. ErWin, ER/Studio\xa0Design and develop logical and physical data models that are consistent with data standards, guidelines, work processes and tools.\xa0Develop and/or assist with development of data access protocols and methods. Analyzes and develop codes for ETL, database access, modification and construction\xa0Assists with the development and implementation of database standards and methodologies.\xa0Responsible for adhering to Data Standards and managing metadata quality and integrity.\xa0Identify and analyze data discrepancies and data quality issues and work to ensure data consistency and integrity\xa0Supports the development of Enterprise Data Architectures\xa0Installs, configures, administers, maintains, and tunes databases.\xa0Perform database backup, recovery, and/or replication as needed.\xa0Researches, recommends, and implements database and system software upgrades.\xa0Analyzes and reports on database metrics; administers and controls data resources; monitors and ensures database integrity, security, and performance; and implements tools to improve database performance.\xa0Interact with business partners to share and direct architecture practices that may affect business solution delivery\xa0Take an organization-wide view of the business and its data, (e.g. maintain re-usable or enterprise data models) while providing detailed project-specific modeling and analysis support\xa0Assists in research of data architecture technology industry trends\xa0\xa0QUALIFICATIONS:\xa0Bachelor\u2019s degree in Computer Science or related discipline. Graduate degree preferred.\xa08+ years of experience in IT systems or applications development\xa05+ years of data modeling; database analysis, design, implementation and administration.\xa03+ years of experience architecting or delivering large scale systems in an enterprise environment on multiple platforms, with a focus on Data Warehousing (building and implementing), Big Data, Cloud Technologies, and/or Advanced Analytical solutions\xa0Experience in the development, implementation, and management of Enterprise Data Models, Data Architecture Strategies, Delivery Roadmaps, Information Lifecycle Management, and Data Governance capabilities\xa0Extensive experience building conceptual and physical models\xa0Familiarity with Windows and Linux/Unix administration. Ability to write shell scripts in Linux.\xa0Ability to install software on Linux systems and configure Linux OS.\xa0Experience with data access and database connectivity, the tools and techniques, especially the development experience in web and analytics applications.\xa0Experience with SQL (SQL Server, MySQL, and/or PostgreSQL) and NoSQL Database Systems.\xa0Experience with cloud computing, especially with AWS, including Amazon Redshift.\xa0Advanced knowledge of Data Warehousing and ETL techniques, tools, and best practices\xa0Extensive experience with dimensional modeling and ETL programming\xa0Knowledge of reporting and visualization tools and Executive Information systems design and implementation. Experience with Tableau or similar technologies and tools desired.\xa0Working knowledge of version control techniques and tools. Experience with Git a plus.\xa0Good understanding of software development methodologies and best practices\xa0Experience with Scrum or Kanban Agile methodologies a plus\xa0Commitment to excellence and high standards.\xa0Excellent verbal and written communication and persuasion skills;\xa0Ability to collaborate and engage effectively with technical and non-technical resources at all organization levels.\xa0Strong organizational, problem-solving, and analytical skills with acute attention to detail.\xa0Ability to work independently and as a member of various teams.\xa0Proven ability to handle multiple projects and meet deadlines.\xa0Ability to work on complex projects with general direction and minimal guidance.\xa0Good judgement with the ability to make timely and sound decisions\xa0Understanding of security legislation that affects our businesses, including, but not limited to Sarbanes-Oxley, Payment Card Industry regulations, Customer Data Protection regulations and contemporary security legislation activities that may impact future plans.\xa0Sherlock loves to share $500 referral bonus!"U.S. Citizens and those authorized to work in the U.S. are encouraged to apply. We are unable to sponsor at this time. No H1 Visas."\n]

[\nPMCS Services is an Austin based company and Prime vendor to State of Texas DIR IT staffing. [\nThe new Director must bring strong thought leadership around enterprise business intelligence/analytics architecture, design and strategy experience. Seek out opportunities for simplification, capability enablement and standardization of the IT solutions landscape, instituting best practices and lowering costs. In addition, with an eye towards improving business operations, he/she will focus on vendor contracts and negotiations with a charter to improve the way the organization operates. \\Specific Responsibilities: \xb7 End-to-end global responsibility for creating and aligning Data Strategy with strategic business intent and establishing the IT roadmap; provides architecture direction and guidance; ensures alignment with Strategic Roadmaps, Enterprise Blueprints, and our companies Standards; drives consistency and quality of the Architecture artifacts (business process architecture, data architecture, etc.)Establishes strategic roadmaps and governs key aspects of solution implementation related to Data Management (acquisition, ingest, standardization, enrichment, etc.) and projects to provide end-to-end reporting and analytics capabilities.The implementation solution will involve the use of Big Data capabilities like Hadoop and NoSQL databases as well as leveraging traditional DW technologies where applicable.Architect target architecture and strategy for key business initiatives ensuring alignment with big data strategy and future state architecture vision.Strongly influences the future direction of business solutions based on technology vision. Collaborate closely with other company sector Architects to drive synergies and leverage solutions where applicable.Externally, drives technology roadmap of key vendor partners (e.g. Oracle, SAP) to maximize alignment and value to meet MDD needs. Drive proof-of-concept and industry benchmarking efforts to set strategic global reference architectures that enable new business capabilities.Deeply influences at VP and CIO levels of the organization providing guidance and advice for strategic 3-5 year technology direction. experience in Data required\xb7 Proven experience in best practices in Master Data Management, Data Standards/Definitions, Data Quality, and Big Data required\xb7 Proven experience in enterprise integration with a focus on cloud computing and traditional ERP (JDE, Oracle, SAP) and DW environments\xb7 Experience with the various tools & frameworks of the Hadoop ecosystem (MapReduce, YARN, Pig, Hive, Hbase) and NoSQL (MongoDB, Cassandra, Neo4J)\xb7 Experience with Cloud based data technologies(AWS RDS, Dynamo, Redshift, S3, EMR, Google BigTable, BigQuery, Dataflow)\xb7 Experience with integration methodologies andtools\xb7 Experience designing, developing, and implementing ETL and Relational Database Systems\xb7 Experience with data mining, machine learning, statistical modeling experience in developing strategies and roadmaps with IT architecture focus (e.g. technology blueprints, business process harmonization blueprints, systems integration maps, etc.)\xb7 Experience with leading multi-company teams and global efforts are preferred\xb7 Previous people management experience is preferred\xb7 Demonstrated ability to understand and articulate business requirements, direction, and initiatives from an enterprise-level perspective\xb7 Proven ability to manage team within a matrixed structure\xb7 Demonstrated understanding and management of financial processes and results related to projects, departmental budgets, and enterprise\n]

[\nReq ID: -23081-Areas of Interest:- Information Security- BOK Financial (BOKF),  Headquartered in Tulsa, Oklahoma, BOK Financial Corporation (NASDAQ: BOKF) is a top 25 U.S.-based financial services holding company with operations in ten states - Oklahoma, Texas, Arkansas, Arizona, Colorado, Kansas/Missouri, New Mexico, Nebraska and Wisconsin. The company began more than 100 years ago in Tulsa and has successfully diversified into a variety of industries, businesses and geographies. - - - - -- - - - -.  The  Information Security Risk Consultant  is responsible conducting assessments to determine risk exposures and developing security measures. Responsible for developing and maintaining the risk assessment framework and determining methods of implementing and enforcing security policies. PRINCIPLE DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Performs independent hands-on risk assessments to identify significant information security risks and oversee compliance with numerous regulatory and industry control requirements. Includes application, system, infrastructure, process and vendor security risk assessments to determine compliance with Bank policies and standards, financial laws and regulations such as GLBA, SOX, and PCI along with the FFIEC Information Technology Examination Handbooks. Consults with project teams by providing guidance on appropriate security controls to meet compliance. Identifies and communicates recommended / required security controls for business products. Documents and monitors the implementation of controls for technology and business project plans. Facilitate business alignment with Enterprise Risk Management, Audit and IT by participating in security risk management steering committee or advisory boards. Develops and maintains information security risk assessment framework and practices in consideration of emerging threats and in alignment with changing regulations. Reviews vendor due diligence and availability requirements and recommends appropriate contract language. Protects the integrity, confidentiality, and availability of information. Responds to a loss or misuse of information assets; participates in investigations of suspected information security misuse or in compliance reviews; and communicates unresolved security exposures, misuse, or noncompliance situations. KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS and ABILITIES: In-depth understanding of strategic business risks Ability to develop a comprehensive understanding of the financial business, market and industry and relate that knowledge to identified operations- and IT-related risks Advanced knowledge of risk assessment procedures, policy formation, role-based authorization methodologies, authentication technologies, and security attack vectors Thorough knowledge and understanding of business needs and business planning, systems analysis and application development Strong skills as a negotiator, to facilitate commitment to, and sign-off on, appropriate levels of residual risk from line-of-business managers Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to understand business requirements in order to make decisions on appropriate risk strategies Basic knowledge of a broad range of standards and frameworks - for example, International Standards Organization (ISO) 27001, IT Infrastructure Library and ISO 20000, Capability Maturity Model Integration and Six Sigma This level of knowledge is normally acquired through completion of a Bachelor-s Degree in Computer Technology/Science, Engineering, or a related field and 6+ years of experience in IT which includes at least 3 years- experience in the information security industry or 12+ years related business experience. Prior experience in financial services industry is preferred. Preference: CISSP (Certified Information Systems Security Professional). BOK Financial  is a stable and financially strong organization that provides excellent training and development to support building the long term careers of our employees.  With passion, skill and partnership you can make an impact on the success of the bank, our customers and your own career! - Apply today  and take the first step towards your next career opportunity! - BOK Financial is an equal opportunity employer.- We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for training, compensation, transfer, promotion and other aspects of employment for all qualified applicants and employees without regard to sex, race, color, religion, national origin, age, disability, sexual orientation, genetic information or veteran status.  Attention All Third Party Agencies, Headhunters, and Recruiters BOK Financial and its Subsidiaries will not accept candidate submission by unsolicited third parties through this site or any company email address. All unsolicited candidates presented to BOK Financial and its Subsidiaries will be considered the property of BOK Financial. BOK Financial and its Subsidiaries will not be responsible for any fees associated with unsolicited candidates, nor will a contractual relationship be formed by the submission. BOK Financial and its Subsidiaries are not obligated and will not under any circumstances pay any fees to said third parties submitting candidates in this manner. BOK Financial and its Subsidiaries only forms contracts with recruiters with whom we have an established business relationship and with whom we have in place a signed agreement. All contact with BOK Financial and its Subsidiaries from third parties must be through our Human Resources Department. Any contact made outside of the BOK Financial Human Resources Department by a third party will cancel any future business relationships between the third party and BOK Financial.  \xa0 Department:  Information Technology\n\t\t]

column2: Senior Software Development Engineer in Test
column5: [\nAre you ready to revolutionize entertainment? Gracenote is an entertainment data and technology provider powering the world\u2019s top music services, automakers, cable and satellite operators, and consumer electronics companies. At its core, Gracenote helps people find, discover and connect with the entertainment they love. Daily, Gracenote processes 35 Billion rows of data and is quickly becoming a world-leader in return path \u201cbig data.\u201d Over the past 2 years, the company has grown to more than 1800 employees in 20 countries, including over 400 of the world\u2019s top engineers with a passion for music, video, sports, and entertainment technology. Founded in 1998, Gracenote is a subsidiary of Tribune Media, one of America\u2019s most iconic and respected media companies. We are presently looking for a Senior Software Developer in Test to join our dynamic Software Development Team and help improve Gracenote\u2019s award-winning technologies. \xa0 IN THIS ROLE YOU WILL:  Collaborate with product management, developers to improve testability, automation, and tools Write test automation for Desktop and/or mobile applications, such as Desktop (C/Java), Android(Java), Windows Mobile (C#) and iOS (ObjC/Swift) Whitebox, Greybox and Blackbox testing; test and implement mobile SDK (Software Development Kit). Work with the team to increase the test coverage Lead and execute tests during all stages of development cycles Work with various development team and product management to improve efficiency and effectiveness of test automation Define and implement testing and verification strategies Own documentation that communicates the procedures and test results  FOR THIS ROLE WE ARE LOOKING FOR INDIVIDUALS THAT HAVE:  B.S. in CS/EE preferred, 7+ years applicable industry experience required 7+ years of experience writing test cases and/or test plans 5+ years of software development or equivalent test automation experience Experience writing and executing detailed test cases, test plans and test design documents, Hands-on programming experience in C/Java/C#/ObjC/Swift and in object oriented design Experience with GitHub, JIRA, Jenkins Experience testing SDKs. Strong analytical and debugging skills Strong problem solving skills Excellent written and verbal communication skills Ability to work on multiple simultaneous projects / initiatives Experience working in Agile environment  Nice to have:  Experienced in BDD Test automation with Cucumber framework using JRuby, Cucumber-jvm, Calabash, SpecFlow or OCcukes Experience in using Junit and Jmeter Domain experience with Music MetaData  \xa0 Our passion for music, TV, movies, and sports is at the heart of everything we do. But what really makes us tick is our people. From Emeryville to Sydney and Queensbury to Amsterdam, we are building the team that\u2019s going to disrupt the digital universe. This starts by creating a workplace where all things entertainment are celebrated and innovation can come from anyone. If you are interested in being mission critical and on the leading edge of global entertainment technology then please contact us today!\u2028 \u2028 Gracenote is an EOE M/F/D/V\n]
