column2: Architect, SCOM System Center Operations Manager
column5: [\nPrestigious Organization is seeking an Architect of System Center Operations Manager(SCOM). The SCOM Architect\xa0is responsible for managing and maintaining the enterprise SCOM platform.\xa0The SCOM platform is the primary solution for monitoring all technology systems and applications globally.\xa0Candidate will be responsible for collaborating with the Platform, Network, and Database engineering teams, as well as, application support teams to determine requirements for filters, events, alerts, and dashboards and reporting in various monitoring tools.\xa0This role also has responsibility for maintaining integrations from other monitoring solutions that route through SCOM or an Orchestrator based workflow, as necessary.Responsibilities: \xa0Perform administrative tasks from the Operation Manager console, provide application support for the SCOM platform and create and maintain monitoring and notification rules.Identify monitoring gaps in the environment and propose solutions that leverage our existing investment in SCOM.Identify opportunities to improve SCOM performance specific to agents, console views, MP\u2019s, etc.Review and update SCOM console security, apply patches, create SCOM console roles and reviews, and create and install custom Management Packs (MP) as needed.Review, plan and implement SCOM upgrades and releases (2012 R2 to 2016).Deliver SCOM views via Remote Desktop Web Access, create custom reports on results of SCOM monitoring, using SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) technologies, and provide problem resolution for SCOM components and related custom scripts.Utilize verbal and written communication skills to maintain accurate system documentation and provide training as requiredAbility to communicate how to leverage technology to create business value and become more effective and efficientTransfer knowledge via documentation and training to support team resources.Qualifications:BS/BA in Computer Science, Business Administration or related field or the equivalent work experience.Minimum 7 to 10 years of related work experience including solid exposure to enterprise architectureExperience with the installation and administration of Microsoft System Center Operations Manager 2012Experience in application/network performance and availability monitoringExperience using the Microsoft Windows PowerShell scripting engine to automate tasks with SCOMExperience with System Center Configuration Manager 2012Experience with System Center OrchestratorKnowledge of multiple processor systems, RAID hardware, SCSI attached, and storage area network solutions, preferably experience with HP and EMC hardware.Knowledge of BMC Patrol, EasyVista ITSM, Nagios, Silect MP Author/Studio, XML, and SNMPMust be a self-starter demonstrating the willingness to address / resolve ambiguity and conflict within complex business change projects.Promote and follow prescribed project management guidelines for projectsMaintain documentation for all operational / support processes for the systems supported by the Server Technologies team; automate repetitive processes where appropriate\n]

[\n\t\t\tJob Description:-Client is seeking a Test Engineers - Senior/LeadSummary:-As a Software Quality Engineer you will assist in the planning and testing of ongoing releases of institutional web-based products including applications targeted for mobile devices in addition to traditional software applications. -This role is suitable for individuals that are highly curious and driven to create stable and scalable solutions for an ever-changing environment. -The range and scope of this position will be manual and automated testing of new web-based and traditional applications and services as well as regressive testing and maintenance practices. Qualifications:-Test planning and test execution, requirements analysis, and investigative analysis of defects.-Experience with testing automation tools and frameworks preferred-Experience with testing APIs (stress, load, security testing), including but not limited to REST-based APIs and Services, black box and white box testing-Proficient at Software Developer Level or equivalent experience in the software testing field working as an Automation Engineer-Integration of functional test automation into Continuous Integration approach (i.e. Jenkins)-Integration of manual/automation test results into product management approach (i.e. Atlassian)-Good knowledge of at least one automated testing Tool (i.e. Appium Selenium, UFT, Test Complete), Automation Frameworks (i.e. FitNesse, Cucumber, Spock, TestNG, JUnit, NUnit), and Version Control Systems (i.e. GIT, SVN, Microsoft VSTS)-Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or related field; Advanced degree preferred-3+ years prior hands-on experience in writing automated software testing code (i.e. APIs, Web)-Experience with principles of ALM and software development methodologies preferred-Experience with load and performance testing tools preferred-Effective communication and documentation skills required-Experience working in an Agile environment including hands-on experience with ATDD / TDD methodologies Test Automation Tools / Techniques / Frameworks.\n]

[\n\xa0Global Advertising agency looking for a network administrator / network engineer to work in the NYC office on Cisco and Juniper routers,switches firewalls. \xa0The Network Administrator is responsible for all aspects of the company\u2019s voice and data communications in a matrix relationship with the regional technology management team.\xa0 The Network Administrator will work closely with the Network Engineer and Regional Network Manager to prioritize and balance workload, and closely with the Global Network Team on developing and integrating technology standards and procedures.\xa0 He or she will manage the Local and Wide Area Networks.\xa0This is a CONTRACT TO HIRE position for PERMANENT US RESIDENTS ONLY THAT ARE LOCAL TO NYC CURRENTLY. \xa0The Ad Agency would like a 3month contract to hire:Basic Requirements:\xa0-\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 2-3 years Cisco and/or Juniper routing and switching experiences- \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 2-3 VPN expertise a MUST-\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 2-3 years Juniper Firewall or Cisco Firewall experiences a MUST-\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 2-3 years Cisco VoIP experiences, Callmanager and Unity Connections- NICE TO HAVE\xa0- \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0Responsible for design, plan, implement manage and support switches, routers, firewalls, WAN acceleration and two-factor authentication and VOIP.- \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0Localre candidates only that have permanent working papers.- \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0You agree to a 3 month contract to hire positionEmail resumes to randy@neuringerco.com\n]

[\nPosition :: Identity & Access Management AdministratorLocation :: Los Angeles, CADuration :: Long-Term Contract to Hire\xa0General Responsibility : The Identity & Access Management Administrator is responsible for the overall strategy, planning, evaluation, architecture & implementation of the entire Identity/Access Management stack.The individual in this role will provide overall direction and oversight into the IAM functions across the organization, including areas such as Federation, Privileged Access Management, Authentication & Authorization, Security and Provisioning Identity Data.\xa0The role reports to the Director, IT DBA Services and will be responsible for documenting, designing and administering the IAM infrastructure.\xa0He/She will be providing support to security and develop appropriate audit controls and procedures to ensure the integrity of applications.He/She will be working closely with the project managers, Security and Compliance personnel, application developers and other administrators in creating functional, scalable and secure applications from design and development through implementation for business clients.He/She will also be responsible for identifying, evaluating and participating in decision making around new and emerging technologies.This position will require expert knowledge in Oracle Fusion Middleware, Oracle Identity & Access Management administration, Weblogic administration, installation and configuration, performance tuning, backup recovery methods in multiple computing environments and must be well versed in J2EE, Service Oriented Architecture (SOA), Web Services, LDAP, XML and SAML.This position also requires knowledge of Oracle databases and should be able to support other areas of functions as needed.\xa0\xa0QUALIFICATIONS & REQUIREMENTS EDUCATION/TRAINING: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related Information Technology majors, or equivalent experience with systems administration.\xa0CERTIFICATION: Oracle Identity Administration\xa0REQUIRED EXPERIENCE: 10 years of progressive hands on experience in design, architecture and administration of Identity and Access Management solutions using Oracle Identity and Access Management suite or similar technologies.Thorough knowledge of Oracle Identity Manager, Access Manager, OVD, OID, Oracle Identity Federation, Java, J2EE Service Oriented Architecture (SOA) Oracle Fusion Middleware, Oracle Single Sign-On, and Oracle Application Server platforms.Experience in consolidating and virtualizing the environments.Act as Identity and Access Management subject matter expert for business leaders, end users and IT staff in the areas of application architecture and implementation.Extensive experience in installation ,configuration, backup and recovery of Middleware tools and technology.Experience in administration of user and role provisioning, connectors, workflow, certificate management, session management, encryption technologies,LDAP (MS Active Directory and OID).Experience in deployment of code using Weblogic Admin console as well as WLST.Experience in reviewing application performance metrics and proactively addressing performance concerns.Experience in resource planning / management and source control.Experience in building and maintaining DEV, QA and PROD and Disaster Recovery environments for middleware.Experience in troubleshooting issues and quickly resolve them in an efficient manner that minimizes downtime.Working in a Health Care HMO Organization in a similar capacity.Knowledge of Oracle databases and/or Microsoft SQL ServerKnowledge in Federation, SAML, OpenID, OAuth and other industry standard authentication/authorization solutions.\xa0Preffered :Working in a Health Care HMO Organization in a similar capacity.Knowledge of Oracle databases and/or Microsoft SQL Server.RegardsShashank9166054622\n]

[\nPosition Summary:The Director for Operations is responsible for all day-to-day operational, University-facing activities of the Technical Operations group in the Department of Public Safety. This position directs both the technical team responsible for mission-critical field security devices across the University\u2019s hundreds of buildings and >13MM square feet (includes access control devices, duress/intrusion alarms, cameras, and radios) and Card Services, the team responsible for University-wide badging and access management for over 60,000 cardholders. As business owner, this position also directs \u2013 both as client of and in partnership with NYU central IT and external providers - system administration of systems essential to University security and Public Safety operations. Researches, evaluates and recommends new security technology; ensures Department of Public Safety (DPS) infrastructure is well-maintained by security vendors; conducts customer service audits on all technology installations; oversees the training and development goals for the Department of Public Safety technical operations staff and other DPS employees; coordinates and integrates the use of security technology for the public safety officers, contract security and other DPS personnel; conducts yearly technology reviews, including the divisional IT program; evaluates security technology plans and makes recommendations for operational and capital multi-year goals, including the development of security technology standards, to the Assistant Vice President \u2013 Technical Operations. This position reports directly to the Assistant Vice President for Technical Operations, acts as deputy to the AVP, and serves as the lead in their absence.Qualifications:Required Education:Bachelor's Degree in a related field; or Bachelor's Degree with equivalent experience.Preferred Education:Physical Security Professional; Master's Degree in a related discipline.Required Experience:Seven years of relevant experience, including experience supervising customer service operations, or an equivalent combination of education and experience. Demonstrated track record of accomplishments through leadership.Preferred Experience:Related experience in an academic environment; some budgeting/accounting experience.Required Skills, Knowledge and Abilities:Ability to manage access control, security video, and other systems essential to enterprise security. Outstanding customer service skills. Review and interpretation of system relationship diagrams and architectural plans. Review, interpretation, and revision of spreadsheets, including budget materials. Prior management experience. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to interact with all levels of students, faculty and staff.Preferred Skills, Knowledge and Abilities:Data Mining & Analysis; Lenel Certification; Genetec Certification; ITIL Certification. Ability to identify and address efficiency needs in frontline support and field maintenance operations.Additional Information:EOE/AA/Minorities/Females/Vet/Disabled/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity\n]

[\nAre you a natural leader with a passion to dig in and pioneer new technology-enabled methods and processes for some of the largest corporate entities in the world? Our team works on the cutting edge building and delivering the next generation of HR applications and services to clients. We\u2019re looking for the very best individuals who thrive on what\u2019s possible. \xa0 Work you\u2019ll do As a SAP SuccessFactors functional consultant, you will use your knowledge and experience to help your clients solve the most pressing issues facing their HR function today by: Working closely with a large team to deliver results for your client Finding deep satisfaction by being responsible for final work product Enjoying the opportunity to forge strong relationships with both the client and project team that will contribute to your growth and development \xa0 The HR Transformation Team Deploying HR technology is part art and part science. The science comes from world-class tools and proven methodologies, but the art can only come from experience. The experience to know which technologies to leverage, how they integrate with your processes to create the right employee experience and how they can be deployed in your organization to drive adoption and, mostly importantly, change. Working with Deloitte allows you to leverage our know-how to optimize the value of your technology investment and create the capacity you need to focus on leading the business forward.   Learn more about our HR Transformation practice . \xa0 HR Technology Strategy & Solutions Team \u2011 SAP SuccessFactors Our SAP SuccessFactors practice is a team that clients simply want to do business with because of the way we work. We differentiate ourselves in how we execute the business of consulting demonstrated by our sales and proposal process, thought investment in proposed solutions, efficient and accurate pricing and staffing models and development of our internal training. We were honored as the 2015 Partner of the Year by SuccessFactors, won the North America Partner Excellence Award for Cloud Service and are the #1 SAP SuccessFactors partner in North America. \xa0 Qualifications Required: 2+ years of experience configuring and implementing SAP SuccessFactors/HCM  Strong functional knowledge of the system Superior communications skills, both verbal and written Experience with Microsoft Office Products such as PowerPoint, Visio, and Excel Up to 80% travel required \xa0 Preferred: Minimum of 2 Full Life-cycle implementations of SuccessFactors, from planning to configuration through go-live Certification in at least one SuccessFactors module Bachelor\u2019s degree strongly preferred\xa0\xa0 \xa0 How you\u2019ll grow At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there\u2019s always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world.\xa0 From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs at Deloitte University, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career. \xa0 Explore Deloitte University, The Leadership Center. \xa0 Benefits At Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits.  Learn more about what working at Deloitte can mean for you. \xa0 Deloitte\u2019s culture Our positive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best work every day. We celebrate individuals by recognizing their uniqueness and offering them the flexibility to make daily choices that can help\xa0them to be healthy, centered, confident, and aware. We offer well-being programs and are continuously looking for new ways to maintain a culture where our people excel and lead healthy, happy lives. \xa0 Learn more about Life at Deloitte. \xa0 Corporate citizenship Deloitte is led by a purpose: to make an impact that matters. This purpose defines who we are and extends to relationships with our clients, our people and our communities.\xa0 We believe that business has the power to inspire and transform. We focus on education, giving, skill-based volunteerism, and leadership to help drive positive social impact in our communities.\xa0  Learn more about Deloitte\u2019s impact on the world. \xa0 Recruiter tips We want job seekers exploring opportunities at Deloitte to feel prepared and confident. To help you with your interview, we suggest that you do your research: know some background about the organization and the business area you\u2019re applying to.  Check out recruiting tips from Deloitte professionals. \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Deloitte is one of the leading professional services organizations in the United States, specializing in audit, tax, consulting, and financial advisory services with clients in more than 20 industries. We provide powerful business solutions to some of the world's most well-known and respected companies, including more than 75 percent of the Fortune 100.  At Deloitte, you can have a rewarding career on every level. In addition to challenging and meaningful work, you'll have the chance to give back to your community, make a positive impact on the environment, participate in a range of diversity and inclusion initiatives, and find the support, coaching, and training it takes to advance your career. Our commitment to individual choice lets you customize aspects of your career path, your educational opportunities and your benefits. And our culture of innovation means your ideas on how to improve our business and your clients' will be heard. About Deloitte As used in this document, \u201cDeloitte\u201d means Deloitte LLP and its subsidiaries. Please see www.deloitte.com/us/about for a detailed description of the legal structure of Deloitte LLP and its subsidiaries. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law. Disclaimer: If you are not reviewing this job posting on our Careers' site (careers.deloitte.com) or one of our approved job boards we cannot guarantee the validity of this posting. For a list of our current postings, please visit us at careers.deloitte.com.\n\t\t]

column6: [\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\tThe Creative Group is a leader among creative and marketing staffing agencies. [\n Our Client is looking for a Marketing analyst to join their Web Analytics team. This person will be responsible for helping create Ad Hoc reports, providing analysis of the reports to management and developers. They will also be responsible for performing research for trends within the Websites.This person should have a good background in statistics, SAS or SQL. This role will be more techno-functional that the other analyst roles we've filled.Duties and responsibilities:\xa0 1. Owns subdivision projects that contribute to the effort of defining analytics to measure the effectiveness of our cross-channel client experiences. 2. Builds, maintains, and publishes dashboards and insights that surface key performance indicators. 3. Gathers, cleanses and analyzes data from multiple sources including but not limited to; Adobe Analytics, Tealeaf, Sitespect and Enterprise Databases. 4. Assists with the preparation of presentations that translate analytic insights into tangible, actionable solutions for business partners to implement. 5. Provides analytics implementation requirements, representing our business needs. 6. Provides consulting services (with supervision) to colleagues needing data for specific projects. 7. Suggests analytics infrastructure improvements and decisions regarding skills, process, and technology. 8. Participates in special projects and performs other duties as required.* Undergraduate degree (BS/BA in Economics, Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, Marketing Research preferred), or equivalent combination of training & experience. * A minimum of three years general business experience. * Strategic thinker with tactical abilities. * Proficiency in applied statistical techniques, such as cluster and segmentation analysis, time series analysis, regression/logistic regression analysis, and developing and monitoring scorecards. * Superior testing and quality control skills and attitude. * MS office skills. Strong Excel skills in data manipulation and presentation. * Strong analytical skills coupled with the ability to form hypotheses and draw meaningful insights from disparate data sources. Knowledge of marketing and user experience disciplines a significant plus. * Excellent written/oral communication, project management and presentation skills. Able to clearly articulate and present findings and recommendations to team members and management, and to technical and non-technical audiences. Strong data visualization skills. * Experience with Adobe Analytics, Tealeaf, and SiteSpect.\xa0 ID:  514297 Type:  Contract Salary:  Open\n\t\t]

[\nJob Number: R0000670 Booz Allen Hamilton has been at the forefront of strategy and technology for more than 100 years Today, the firm provides management and technology consulting and engineering services to leading Fortune 500 corporations, governments, and not-for-profits across the globe. Booz Allen partners with public and private sector clients to solve their most difficult challenges through a combination of consulting, analytics, mission operations, technology, systems delivery, cybersecurity, engineering and innovation expertise.Big Data Architect, SeniorKey Role: Design and implement Big Data analytic solutions on a Hadoop-based platform. Create custom analytic and data mining algorithms to help extract knowledge and meaning from vast stores of data. Refine a data processing pipeline focused on unstructured and semi-structured data refinement. Support quick turn and rapid implementations and larger scale and longer duration analytic capability implementations.Basic Qualifications: -6+ years of experience with distributed scalable Big Data store or NoSQL, including Accumulo, Cloudbase, HBase, or Big Table -Experience in MapReduce programming with Apache Hadoop and Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS) and with processing large data stores -Experience with the design and development of multiple object-oriented systems -Experience with extending Free and Open-Source Software (FOSS) or COTS products -Ability to show flexibility, initiative, and innovation when dealing with ambiguous and fast-paced situations -Ability to obtain a security clearance -BA or BS degreeAdditional Qualifications: -Experience with Apache Solr or Hadoop -Experience with R or Python -Experience with using repository management solutions -Experience with deploying applications in a Cloud environment -Experience with designing and developing automated analytic software, techniques, and algorithms -MA or MS degreeClearance: Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.Integrating a full range of consulting capabilities, Booz Allen is the one firm that helps clients solve their toughest problems. by their side to help them achieve their missions. Booz Allen is committed to delivering results that endure.We are proud of our diverse environment, EOE, M/F/Disability/Vet. #LI-AH1, AFH16, AFH26, SIG2016, TMJ16&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;br&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;br&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;\xa0\xa0 dateposted:  20010101 Department:  Design, Engineering\n\t\t]

column3: US Bankruptcy Court, District of Nevada
column5: [\nThis position is located in Las Vegas, Nevada. This is a full-time position with benefits including annual and sick leave, health and life insurance, employee-paid long-term disability, long term care, dental and vision insurance, pre-tax Flexible Spending Accounts, retirement, and flexible work hours.\xa0The position will require development of applications for managing local data systems, custom interfaces for national systems, analyze manual processes and propose automated solutions within the U.S. Courts. The incumbent will be a member of a group of IT support personnel and report directly to the Director of Information Technology. The Department of Information Technology (DoIT) provides support to both the U.S. Probation Office and U.S. Bankruptcy Court.\xa0This position requires the utilization of current technology in programming, such as .NET, C#, Visual Studio, Visual Basic, Java, ASP.NET, to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of local and nationally developed systems of the Court family.\xa0Designs, develops, implements, and tests software based on a multi-tier architecture.\xa0Develops database scripts to make effective use of information in existing systems databases.\xa0Teaches and coaches NVP and NVB personnel in the effective use of automated resources.Monitors day-to-day operations of the locally and nationally supported programs and applications. Acts as the technical expert in solving computer application problems and assists the group with backup and recovery of applications as necessary.\xa0Prepares and maintains user manuals, user and technical documentation for locally-developed software used at the Courts.\xa0Supports the conversion of existing local applications from older technologies and non-supported technologies using a defined project plan.\xa0Evaluates established Court processes and makes recommendations for automating processes.\xa0Works with Court staff to enhance web and other current applications.\xa0Provides guidance and oversight to others performing the automation of manual processes.\xa0Assists IT staff and unit managers with the creation of one-time and recurring reports.\xa0Designs, programs, tests, installs, documents, and maintains web based application.\xa0Other duties as assigned. Preferred Qualifications:Bachelor s Degree in Computer Science, MIS, or related technical field of study from an accredited college or university.Experience with .NET programming, C#, Visual Basic, ASP.NET, Visual Studio, Web Programming, CSS, Java, JavaScript, SQL, HTML, and DHTML.Experience with the latest Microsoft technologies such as WCF, WPF, and AJAX (Atlas).Experience with Reporting Tools such as Crystal Reports and SQL Reporting Services.Experience with the use of directory services such as Active Directory and LDAP for web and database authentication is a plus.Experience in all phases of product development cycle.Good oral and written communication and analytical skills.The ability to take initiative and have good problem solving skills.Must be organized and have the ability to manage multiple priorities to meet strict time demands.Ability to maintain confidentiality with sensitive information is required. Information for Applicants:Incumbent may occasionally be required to work evenings and weekends to meet the needs of the Court.Incumbent may occasionally be required to travel to Reno.Employees of the United States Probation Office & United States Bankruptcy Court are appointed as EXCEPTED SERVICE appointments or Temporary NTE (not to exceed a specific date) appointments are "AT WILL", and as such, can be terminated with or without cause.Federal Government Civil Service classifications or regulations do not apply to this position.The U.S. Courts require employees to adhere to a Code of Ethics and Conduct which is available to applicants for review upon request.ALL applicant information is subject to verification.Travel expenses for interview or relocation expenses will not be paid.All new employees of the U.S. Courts must identify a financial institution for direct deposit of pay before appointment.Hiring for or promotion into this position is subject to funding availability.Employment is contingent upon successful background investigation which will include fingerprinting, criminal history checks, and a credit check.\n]

column5: [\n   CenturyLink (NYSE: CTL) is a global communications, hosting, cloud and IT services company enabling millions of customers to transform their businesses and their lives through innovative technology solutions. CenturyLink offers network and data systems management, Big Data analytics and IT consulting, and operates more than 55 data centers in North America, Europe and Asia. The company provides broadband, voice, video, data and managed services over a robust 250,000-route-mile U.S. fiber network and a 300,000-route-mile international transport network.       This position will act as a primary technical principal and is responsible for delivery of network solutions and new product development. Identify, validate, select, certify and operationalize technology that delivers simple integrated solutions to customers or for network in an efficient and reliable manner. Identify new product opportunity, design, develop and launch new product.   Expertise with network infrastructure technologies such as LAN/WAN, Security, VoIP, Video, and SDN/NFV. Provide advanced technical leadership in research, design, analysis and problem solving efforts to a special design team, technical review team or problem resolution team. Serve as architecture lead on major projects with the ability and expertise to develop overall architectural direction. Initiate and execute advanced research and development activities of importance to the future of the company with minimal supervision and review. Serve as technical consultant to senior management. Represent CTL's vision at Standards forums and conferences.   Demonstrated written and verbal communications skills. Strong interpersonal skills sufficient for team leadership and working with both suppliers and customers. Maintain specific domain technical expertise for multiple areas of technical responsibility.  Ideal candidate shall possess most of the following technical knowledge and experience:  - Extensive knowledge of current access, metro and long haul data and transport network architectures and their application in CTL today.  - Strong Carrier Ethernet MEF technical knowledge and practical experience  - Comprehensive knowledge of OSI layer 3 networks and protocols, including broadcast, multicast, any cast concepts, routing, etc.  - Expertise with various routing/tunneling protocols (BGP, ISIS, EIGRP, VXLAN, GRE)  - In-depth knowledge of Cisco IOS (w/ Cisco routing gears), Juniper JUNOS (w/ Juniper routing gears) and/or Nokia SROS (w/ Nokia routing gears)  - Understanding of SDN/NFV Architecture based around standards from ONF, ETSI NFV ISG, OPNFV, TMF and IETF is a must.  - Hands on experience with OpenSource SDN/NFV platforms like OpenDaylight, ONOS, OpenStack/KVM and data modeling techniques in NetConf/Yang is preferred.  - Experience in automation test frameworks and scripting in Python to validate NFVI, VNFs, MANO stack and Network Services is added advantage.  - Strong programming skills.  Bachelor's degree in Engineering or a related field and 12 years relevant experience or Master's degree in Engineering or a related field and at least 8 years relevant experience.  #LI-POST1  Alternate Location:   US-Colorado-Denver; US-Florida-Winter Park; US-Kansas-New Century; US-Louisiana-Monroe; US-Virginia-Arlington   Requisition #    :    120437         This job may require successful completion of an online assessment. A brief description of the assessments can be viewed on our website at     http://find.centurylink.jobs/testguides/          EEO Statement     No Discrimination. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all persons regardless of race, color, ancestry, citizenship, national origin, religion, veteran status, disability, genetic characteristic or information, age, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, family status, pregnancy, or other legally protected status (collectively, "protected statuses"). We do not tolerate unlawful discrimination in any employment decisions, including recruiting, hiring, compensation, promotion, benefits, discipline, termination, job assignments or training. Any offer of employment is contingent upon the results of a pre-employment drug test and background check.     Disclaimer     The above job definition information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. Job duties and responsibilities are subject to change based on changing business needs and conditions.     \xa0 Department:  Cloud & Networking (Product Development) Jobs\n\t\t]

[\nOur client is one of largest retailers in the world.\xa0 Yet their IT department is nimble and dynamic, and works with cutting edge technologies.\xa0 They are currently in need of an experienced Lead Application Designer to work as part of a team on multiple high visibility projects.\xa0 This position is contract at their Pleasanton, CA facility.\xa0Responsibilities:\xa0\u2022 \xa0 \xa0Develop new applications for the Analytical eco-system and provide consultancy on existing applications. \xa0\u2022 \xa0 \xa0Develop applications in a heterogeneous environment consisting of relational and non-relational technologies. \xa0\u2022 \xa0 \xa0Analyze, design, develop and implement data warehouse / data mart solutions in a large corporation. \xa0\u2022 \xa0 \xa0Develop extensive knowledge of the Operations and the Data of the current business. \xa0\u2022 \xa0 \xa0Develop systems/applications that interface with multiple platforms in the mainframe, midrange and Unix environments. \xa0\u2022 \xa0 \xa0Be proficient with Integration technologies and lead Data virtualization initiatives. \xa0\u2022 \xa0 \xa0Champion and realize the 360 degree view of a customer. \xa0\u2022 \xa0 \xa0Create and maintain models for predictive analytics. \xa0\u2022 \xa0 \xa0Consult with business partners to improve the effectiveness of descriptive and prescriptive analytical systems. \xa0Qualifications: \xa0\xa0\u2022 \xa0 \xa0Bachelor\u2019s Degree in Computer Science with a background in statistics \xa0\u2022 \xa0 \xa04 - 5 years of experience in the retail industry preferred. \xa0\u2022 \xa0 \xa0Programming skills in the following: C, Unix, Python, R, and SQL. \xa0\u2022 \xa0 \xa0Solid understanding of the working in a Teradata and the Hadoop environment. \xa0\u2022 \xa0 \xa0Thorough knowledge of Data Warehouse integration technologies pertaining to ETL, ELT, Messaging, brokering and Data Virtualization. \xa0\u2022 \xa0 \xa0Experience with Hive, Pig, Hadoop Streaming, R, SPSS, SAS, Weka, NoSQL. \xa0\u2022 \xa0 \xa0Experience working with web-analytics data for capture and generating insights. \xa0\u2022 \xa0 \xa0Should have File conversion and data loading experience, good programming skills, and experience with multidimensional design for Data Warehouses. \xa0\u2022 \xa0 \xa0Strong database skills with experience in creating data mart applications and the data marts themselves. \xa0\u2022 \xa0 \xa0Able to utilize a structured methodology for the requirements, design and realization of Data Warehouses/Data Mart solutions. \xa0\u2022 \xa0 \xa0Develop specs and delegate to junior programmers, as well as, be able to provide guidance and mentor their development. \xa0\u2022 \xa0 \xa0Able to work in a fast paced, dynamic, ever evolving work environment. \xa0\u2022 \xa0 \xa0Desire to learn new skills, technologies and adapt to new information demands. \xa0\u2022 \xa0 \xa0Ability to multi-task on many projects and priorities and be able to handle situations that may come with delivery of critical applications. Be adaptable to change direction and priorities quickly, based on changing business needs. \xa0\u2022 \xa0 \xa0Able to switch priorities quickly and easily. \xa0\u2022 \xa0 \xa0Strong organization and communication skills.\xa0Position logistics:Must be currently authorized to work in the USPosition type: Contract to hirePosition location: Pleasanton, CA\xa0What\u2019s in it for You:Competitive pay for contact and permanent position, with excellent stability and opportunity for growth.Great opportunity to enhance or solidify your skills with an excellent, diverse and experienced team.Work on multiple projects allows you to get experience with a variety of technologies and teams.\xa0About the Client:This client has a strong reputation as a responsible corporate citizen and has long been committed to improving the quality of life in the communities they serve.\xa0 With numerous training programs and outlets for development, they ensure that employees are continually strengthening their skill set and developing as individuals.\xa0 Their facilities are modern, clean and comfortable.\xa0About Maxonic:Since 2002 Maxonic has been at the forefront of connecting candidate strengths to client challenges. \xa0Our award winning, dedicated team of recruiting professionals are specialized by technology, are great listeners, and will seek to find a position that meets the long term career needs of our candidates. \xa0We take pride in the over 5,000 candidates that we have placed, and the repeat business that we earn from our satisfied clients.\xa0Interested in Applying?We can\u2019t wait to see your resume. \xa0Please apply below with your most current resume and anything else you\u2019d like us to know about you \u2013 commute preferences, desired work environments, etc. \xa0We promise to get back to you within 24 hours.\xa0 Feel free to email Bhavya Aluri (bhavya.aluri@maxonic.com) or call 408-739-4900 x 118.\n]

[\nFIELD SERVICE TECHNICIAN Office in San Antonio, TX - will travel 60-70%, can work from home officeJOB DUTIES:\xa0 - Repair and Trouble Shoot Industrial Bakery Machines and Production lines - Repair and Trouble Shoot small sized Bakery Machines (e.g. reversible dough sheeters) - Electronic fault analysis and troubleshooting by using a wiring diagram - Travel to Bakeries located all over the U.S. and Canada, about 50% travel time - Technical Line evaluations / check-ups in the field of our Bakery Machines and Lines - Writing of Reports and Spare Part Orders / Offers related to technical jobs - Installation of new machines with teams of technicians from FRITSCH - Modifications of existing machines under instructions and based on drawings and other documentation. - Technical Phone Support while in the office - Handling of Spare Parts requests, issuing offers (under instructions), actively engaged in daily operation of the sales and service office, if not traveling - Working occasionally on weekends and / or Holiday's - Flying or driving to our customers all over U.S. / CanadaJOB REQUIREMENTS:\xa0 - Travel to Bakeries all over the U.S. and Canada - Occasional Travel Overseas to Germany for Training at FRITSCH Germany - Reading and understanding of technical drawings (CAD drawings) - Reading and understanding of electrical wiring diagrams (European Style) - Experience in the electro-mechanical field preferred - Good Social Skills and Communications Abilities - Ability to work under time pressure (in case of a machine being down) and to stay calm - Ability to work alone and self-directed in a certain degree, and to work in larger team's - Making own decisions to get equipment back up and running, often under pressure. - Spanish Language not required but a plus. - PLC skills, such as trouble shooting, changing of small sections in program under instructions of our programmers, not required but a big plus\xa0 ID:  509418 Type:  Contingency Salary:  65000\n\t\t]

column5: [\nOverview:The Remote Monitoring Technical Support Specialist is responsible for assisting the company with successful launch of WiFi connected home standby generators.\xa0 Directly assisting homeowners and installers with issues they encounter during the WiFi pairing process, this position requires a high level of knowledge and troubleshooting skills relevant to a customer\u2019s home WiFi network.\xa0Responsibilities:Diagnoses and troubleshoots end user issues applicable to home WiFi network and cellular issues and is able to provide appropriate solution.Provides timely resolution of problems or escalation on behalf of the customer and ensures their satisfaction.Provides case status updates to management and end-users per service level guidelines.Support and maintain effective relationships with users.Develops, documents, and implements standard operating procedures and customer service guidelines relating to remote IT support.Communicates with customers at all levels of technical and non-technical skills sets.Some support for our current cellular based solution (1X), and new cellular technologies (LTE) will also be required.To meet the challenge, you need experience supporting residential networks. Your ability to diagnose and troubleshoot network issues will bring success for the organization.In this position, your primary role is one of \u201cbreak/fix\u201d, where your mastery of in-depth diagnostics quickly brings network assets back online and heads off future problems. This work requires you to determine the root cause, verify a fix, and recommend a solution.Act as SAP Super User within functional area as assigned.Perform other duties as assigned.\xa0Qualifications:Basic Qualifications:AA degree or technical training preferred or equivalent combination of education and experience;1-2 years of related work experience preferably in an IT Service Desk/Call Center environment.\xa0Preferred Qualifications:Certification in relevant IT products/technologies a plus. Comp TIA Network + and /or Cisco CNNP a plus;Focus on providing exceptional customer service;Ability to type while in involved in a conversation, at least 30 WPM;Sound understanding of customer support, operations, and processes with a desire and enthusiasm to serve customers;Working knowledge of Windows operating systems, networks, databases and network security concepts and tools is required;Working knowledge of the Microsoft Office application suite including MS Outlook;Solid analytical/cognitive skills to troubleshoot complex and technical problems;Ability to coordinate and prioritize multiple tasks simultaneously while maintaining attention to detail and quality;Demonstrated capability to achieve results under pressure in a fast paced client driven environment;Strong problem solving skills, applicable to home WiFi network and cellular scenarios;Practical knowledge of WiFi routers, broadband and cellular carriers and interaction with Smart devices.Experience with WiFi troubleshooting tools;Diplomacy and good customer facing skills to understand and effectively address sensitive customer situations;Good communication, presentation and collaboration skills;Able to write and develop the solutions learned from customer interaction into materials for internal and customer facing FAQs and Knowledge BasePrevious experience using SAP or equivalent ERP\n]

column5: [\nTitle & Id: Systems AdministratorDuration: 01-Mar-2017 - 31-Aug-2017 (Possible Extension)Location: Peachtree Dunwoody Road, Atlanta, GA 30328 Description:Under the general direction of the current System Administrator, this position will have diverse responsibilities for the implementation, maintenance and support of the Enterprise Portal; Windows-based Internet/Intranet applications and sites; Identity Management; and 3rd party applications in the Cox Enterprises Corporate Information Systems portfolio. The System Administrator will be responsible for the general care, maintenance, support and modification of the Development and QA environments for an intranet portal based on the Oracle Web Center Portal suite of products, Oracle WebCenter Portal and WebCenter Content, as well as other custom and 3rd party Windows-based sites/applications. The Administrator will also be responsible for source control and configuration management (build automation) for both environments.Responsibilities Install, configure, upgrade and maintain internet/intranet sites and Oracle Web Center portal instances in development and QA environments.Manage existing development and QA portal installations, including all security to all objects, such as communities, document directories, and portlets. Manage installations and configurations of any Oracle WebCenter Content and Document Management implementation or upgrades in Development and QA environments.Manage portal configuration in Development and QA environments related to any application/system integration, including Identity Management (Symphony Services) Manage installations and configurations of any third-party components for Portal or other Intranet/Internet sites and applications. Participate on, and provide input to, project teams in proper deployment, configuration, and usage of Portal, Identity Management, Identity LifeCycle Management, and other web based products and utilities.Manage source control and configuration (build automation) for development and QA environments. (Team Foundation Server). Subversion experience is a plus.Support project teams to ensure development and QA systems are available for all project work as deemed necessary by Project Manager.Work with Production Administrators to document configuration for all above referenced products for successful transition to Production environment. Work closely with Application Developers and Enterprise Architects to assist in environmental troubleshooting and configuration of new custom applications. Work with QA team to ensure Portal and intranet/Internet environments are up to latest code and functionality for various tests such as load testing, user acceptance testing, and regression testing.  Requirements:Must have at least 5 years experience managing web servers, with IIS 6.0 or higher along with basic knowledge of WebLogic and Apache web servers.Must have experience managing/implementing Oracle\u2019s Web Center portal solution 6.x.Experience with Oracle Content Management and Document Management systems preferred.Must have experience developing and administering application build and deployment processes and managing source control (Visual Source Safe and MS Team System preferred).Must have extensive knowledge of Windows Server Operating Systems with basic understanding of Active Directory security integration into Windows Server OS. Must have experience Administering LDAP directories.Must have experience with identity management platforms (Oracle/Symphony/ preferred).Have basic knowledge of setup and maintenance of virtual environment products (VMware preferred). Have basic knowledge of Visual Studio.NET Development environment and its interaction with .NET Framework and experience debugging Distributed applications. Have experience working with Applications Development team using Microsoft scripting languages (VB script, PowerShell and Windows Scripting Host). Must have basic understanding of SSL certificates in the Windows Server environment. Must have basic understanding of domain name IP address relationship via web server/DNS server configuration. Experience with SQL Server 2005 and 2008 setup and administration is preferred.Customer service and team oriented focus is required.Ability to work on multiple project efforts at the same time is required. MCSE or MCSA, Microsoft Certified Systems Administrator, Certification preferred.Parul ChhabraPrimus Software Corporation Direct: 678\xa0-666- 4393\xa0| Fax: 770-234-4163Email:parul.chhabra@primussoft.com|\xa03061 Peachtree Industrial Blvd, Suite 110 Duluth, GA - 30097Let's connect, LinkedIn:https://in.linkedin.com/pub/parul-chhabra/b1/42b/527\n]

[\nCHZZZZ! Incoming Transmission: Greetings from Panem\u2026as you know, it\u2019s been 150 years since the rebellion lead by Miss Katniss Everdeen\u2026 150 years since control. We are the surviving future generation of the defeated Capitol.  It is time for things to go back to how they once were. Katniss Everdeen is long gone; it is time to bring back the Hunger Games and inflict fear on the land we once ruled! Our entire infrastructure is still destroyed, and our builders are growing weak\u2013 it is time we start looking at the next generation to take back control of Panem. Before you help us take over the world and build/maintain our virtual battleground, we encourage you to look at this Systems Engineer-Server Storage with one of Aureus Group\u2019s best clients\u2026it\u2019s pretty great. *UNABLE TO SPONSOR OR USE CORP-TO-CORP THROUGH 3RD PARTIES AT THIS TIME* Systems Engineer If you love to learn new technologies and lend your skills to others, we have a fantastic Systems Engineer role that you need to check out! We are seeking a Systems Engineer who will be responsible for coordinating, testing and implementing all server, storage, and virtualization technology. As our Systems Engineer, you will provide technical support for infrastructure and exercise your expertise as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) for the configuration of storage and virtualization platform. The ability to work independently as a Systems Engineer is important, but we\u2019d also love to see you guide junior developers so they may one day be as knowledgeable as you are. The position of Systems Engineer requires the ability to handle multiple simultaneous projects and keep them on target with minimal errors. It will be a great challenge with even greater rewards. We can\u2019t wait to meet our next Systems Engineer! QUALIFICATIONS: \xb7 Willingness to provide on-site and remote/phone support in and outside of business hours. \xb7 Ability to achieve resolution within projected timeframe. \xb7 Bachelor's degree with major course work in computer science and/or business administration, or 10 years\u2019 experience in the financial IT field. \xb7 Two and a half years minimum experience working directly with technology platforms, application software configurations and application software implementation management. -Senior level Windows Server Administration experience.  -Prior virtualization experience ideal.  -Must have prior XEN Server, VMWare or Hyper V experience.  Not too bad right? Do this for a while, and maybe one day you can help us take over the world. But, in all honesty, this is a pretty great job opportunity; you might want to stay there and leave the world-taking-over to us\u2026 We\u2019ll give you time to think that over though. Either way, if this job is a good match for you, give us a call! Position: Systems Administrator Specialty/Modality: Systems Administrator-Microsoft Server Networking: XENServer, Networking: VMWare For the most prompt response, please APPLY ONLINE. Resumes may also be sent to isjobs@aureusgroup.com or call (888) 239-5993 for more information.  Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis, and we will not sponsor applicants for employment visa status. We do not accept unsolicited applications or resumes from staffing, recruitment or other employment consulting firms. As always, there is never a fee for candidates to utilize our services. EEO/Veteran/Disabled/E-Verify Employer \n]

column5: [\n  About SAS:SAS believes in the whole employee experience. Meaningful work. Empowerment to make a difference that changes people's lives. Dynamic work environments that foster innovation. And an award-winning culture that makes it all possible. We believe great ideas can come from anywhere. Whether you're a university recruit, or an experienced professional ready for the next big challenge, SAS brings perks, passion, and the potential to grow. No limits. As a Systems Programmer / SAS Platform Administrator for SAS Solutions OnDemand (SSOD) Managed Services Enterprise Hosting team, you will be responsible for all aspects of our hosted application environment. You will work collaboratively with customers, analysts, developers and other implementation team members to implement enterprise software installations and to manage, diagnose, debug, design, and prototype SAS and third-party enterprise class software systems. You will support the SSO team with training, expertise, mentoring and best practices with respect to application technology and architecture, work with the IT teams to ensure that hardware choices are appropriate for the solution; write design documents with supporting justification for architectural choices; arbitrate and enforce design decisions that have a broad impact. You will be responsible for the systems design, implementation, and maintenance of SAS 9 solutions across an enterprise-wide cross-platform infrastructure that is consistent with our business objectives and customer requirements. Additional duties may include:Installation, administration and maintenance of SAS Enterprise software and solutions Providing pre- and post-implementation documentation Integration of SAS software with systems and other third-party software Configuring, managing, monitoring and debugging mid-tier software such as tcServer, JBoss, etc. Developing tools and software to manage SAS and third-party software Diagnosing, documenting, reporting, and resolving system problemsWorking directly with external customers Interfacing with other support teams and vendors Performing other duties as assignedEssential Technical & Education Requirements:Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field, preferably Computer Science, Information Technology or related field Experience in systems support, user support, customer support or training of enterprise class software and/or hardware Experience with UNIX or Linux supporting enterprise class applicationsUS Citizen Ability to travel up to 10% of the timeAdditional Experience and Knowledge:Expertise in Linux system administration including configuration, troubleshooting, and automation. Ability to write scripts in some administrative language (Perl, a *nix shell, Powershell, etc).Familiarity with fundamental networking/distributed computing environment concepts; can use nslookup or dig to check information in the DNS; understands basic routing concepts, etc.Knowledge of change management procedures and version control Ability to comprehend the details of complex, multi-tier, system and application software Strong analytic, inductive, and deductive reasoning skillsAbility to effectively communicate designs and decisions to peers, customers and managementPreferred Experience:Experience installing and using SAS software and solutionsExpertise in deploying and managing JavaEE application Java or Web development experienceProficiency with Python and Ansible Additional InformationTo qualify, applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States, and should not require, now or in the future, sponsorship for employment visa status. SAS is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.\n\t\t]

[\nAvionics and Tactical Networks (ATN) is an operating unit within the Communications division of Northrop Grumman Information Systems and seeks an entry level RF Test Engineer. ATN is located at the Rancho Carmel facility in San Diego, California. Our expertise is in delivering complex equipment to enable modern battlefields and support aviation missions. Our focus is on the world of avionics, radio and electronic warfare product applications to enable networked communications. as part of the corporation's business focus area on Communications, we are the "equipment providers." Our team of communication systems experts is developing next-generation ground radios for land forces, and our Electronic Warfare subject matter experts are creating the next generation of Improvised Explosive Device (IED) countermeasures to keep our soldiers safe when in harm's way. We are seeking a person who is interested in Test Engineering with a digital circuit background. The selectee will work on the Joint Strike Fighter project, and will support the development, integration, testing, and production of Joint Strike Fighter digital avionic products. The selectee's activities will range from hands-on assembly and testing, to analysis of failure trends, and root cause/ corrective action. Designs, develops, and implements testing methods and equipment. Plans and arranges the labor, schedules, and equipment required for testing and evaluating standard and special devices. Provides test area with parameters for sample testing and specifies tests to be performed. Compiles data and defines changes required in testing equipment, testing procedures, manufacturing processes, or new testing requirements. And responsible for testing all customer samples and for special tests that cannot be performed in the test area. ERCOMMS  Qualifications  Basic Qualifications:  * Bachelors of Science in Electrical Engineering or related Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics (STEM) discipline with 5 years experience; Masters with 2 years experience.  * Knowledge of analog and RF circuit design and troubleshooting concepts.  * Familiar with all common lab test equipment including oscilloscopes, spectrum analyzers, logic analyzer, DMMs, etc.  * Ability to work 2nd shift.  * U.S. Citizenship required.  * DoD Secret security clearance eligible.  Preferred Qualifications:  * Strong ability to quickly analyze, isolate, troubleshoot, and fix problems with digital circuitry.  * Knowledge of automated test equipment design and architecture for low volume production lines.  * Ability to work and thrive in high paced production environments.  * Effective oral and written communicator.  * Working knowledge of microprocessor based designs and how to troubleshoot.  * Working knowledge of Xilinx FPGA based designs for Software Defined Radios.  * Knowledge of Altera products a plus.  * Ability to read and understand schematic, netlist, and gerber data.  * High-level knowledge of sample-data systems and signal processing for voice communications.  * Experience working with TestStand and LabView based ATE.  * Experienced giving PowerPoint presentations.  * Ability to work with part vendors on root cause and corrective action for failing products.  * Ability to coordinate and work on a large number of tasks simultaneously.  * Highly motivated and quick learning individual.  * Must be able to work well with others. Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. Because, after all, we are in the business of securing a great deal more than just our place in the market. column5: [\nTest and Automation Engineer IISentient Energy, Inc. equips the Smart Grid with \u201cEyes and Ears\u201d, making it much more reliable and sustainable. Our monitoring systems give electric utility companies unique and detailed insight into operating status and fault conditions along the entire distribution grid. Deployed on top of Advanced Metering Infrastructure (AMI) or Distribution Automation (DA) communications networks, our products leverage the foundational capital invested into the Smart Grid, making it more valuable and increasing Smart Grid investment returns. Privately held, Sentient Energy is headquartered in Burlingame, California.We are recruiting for a Manufacturing Test and Automation Engineer with responsibilities for manufacturing test development and support plus engineering design verification test support.\xa0Principal tasks include:Develop, install, and maintain production test fixtures for our Master Monitor sensor products, computer boards, sensor components and power supplies for use at our components vendors and local contract manufacturer.Provide ongoing manufacturing test support, including Python programming, integration of new product tests, resolution of technical issues, and providing documentation and drawings.Work closely with the engineering team to develop test specifications for new product releases.Troubleshoot products, digital, and analog circuits to the component level with engineering support.Make recommendations to improve, and implement, new production test procedures.Develop strategies to improve test throughput, robustness and to lower the cost/time needed to develop fixtures and processes for new products releases.Support engineering design verification activities and provide test reports to help verify product designs and qualify new products for release.\xa0Qualifications:Successful candidate will have 5+ years of experience in the electronics manufacturing industry and minimum BSEE degree.Linux based application developmentPython programming, test equipment interfaces, database interfaceAbility to lead project development, prioritize development activities, direct resources\xa0Additional qualifications considered:Electronics laboratory experience (use of test equipment, understanding of test methodologies, ESD precautions, etc.)Ability to test and debug analog and digital circuits to component levelAbility to read and understand electronic schematicsAbility to write thorough test proceduresExcellent written and spoken communications skillsSupervisory experience highly desiredEngineering design experience and/or software development experience desirable.\xa0\xa0\n]

column5: [\nMy client is transitioning their database from MYSQL to SQL. During this time they are moving their current DBA to help with the transition and require coverage to help maintain the MYSQL database. Length of the contract could vary based on how smoothly the project goes. At least 2 months but could stretch past 6 month RESUMES TO india.spencer@rht.com Job Requirements Top 3 technical skills  o Expert in creating, supporting, and scheduling cron jobs and developing, validating, and executing SQL  (cron is a Linux utility which schedules a command or script on your server to run automatically at a specified time and date. A cron job is the scheduled task itself. Cron jobs can be very useful to automate repetitive tasks.) o Experience with MySQL version 5.2.26, community edition on Linux o Experience diagnosing and resolving database integrity issues, performance issues, blocking/deadlocking issues, connectivity issues, data replication issues etc.  Other criteria  o 5+ years of database administration experience  o Experience with database design, DW principles, ETL development, performance monitoring, and query optimization o Demonstrated ability solving complex database administration issues o Ability to detect and troubleshoot database related CPU, memory, I/O, disk space and other resource contention issues RESUMES TO india.spencer@rht.com\n\t\t]

column6: [\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\tThe Creative Group is a leader among creative and marketing staffing agencies. We specialize in connecting talented, creative professionals with companies looking to hire interactive, design, marketing, advertising and public relations talent. As the creative, and design staffing division of Robert Half, we offer flexible solutions to meet companies' project, contract-to-hire and full-time employment needs. Through our parent company, we also have the resources to support organizations' temporary and full-time staffing needs in the areas of technology, accounting, finance, administrative and legal. The Creative Group is a creative and design staffing agency that is well-connected to the communities we serve. We have built valuable relationships with the top industry organizations, including AIGA, HOW Magazine, Graphic Design USA and The American Advertising Federation (AAF). We also have an exclusive relationship with The Wall Street Journal. For this reason, working with The Creative Group gives companies and individual professionals a unique advantage over other creative and marketing staffing agencies. [\nOur client is currently seeking a Application Analyst. 6 month contract (extensions possible) Must be US Citz/GC to applyDescription:\xa0List the position Requirements:\xa0 * Position is immersed in monitoring tool suites with an understanding of their technical design, functionality and implementation at Client. * Provides input and develops technology roadmap for tools to ensure Client remains current. * Partners and collaborates with Design & Engineering, IT Operations, and Enterprise Architecture teams to drive monitoring technology solutions that meet current and emerging Client platform standards. * Drives standardization and best practices for the design and implementation of monitoring tool suites. * Consults with BTS teams to gather requirements and design, test, and implement technical solutions for monitoring infrastructure and application components. * Works closely with the other BTS teams for the integration of 3rd party monitoring solutions into Client enterprise monitoring systems. * Establishes and maintains working relationships with software vendors to secure technical support and product insight on behalf of Client. * Creates business cases in support of new tool procurement or vendor service required to deliver a monitoring solution requested by business. * Works closely with the Client Service Management team to ensure monitoring tool suites provide timely and accurate data to support the ITIL processes (e.g. Incident, Problem, Change, Availability, Config. Mgmt, etc.) * Consults and provides technical direction to Client Service Provider supporting monitoring tool suites with respect to enhancements, upgrades, patching, or run and maintain services.Must Haves:\xa0 * 3-5 years' industry experience * 1 year experience providing administrative support for HP OpenView software suite (aka HP Operations Manager) (Note: 3-5 years' experience on a similar tool suite is acceptable) o Experience with HP products in this suite include: -OM Windows, OM Linux (v9.x) -Smart Plug-ins (e.g. Weblogic, JBOSS, Tibco, DB) -NNMi (v10.x) -Performance Manager (v9.x) -Reporter (v4.x) -OMi (v10.x) - UD / uCMDB (v10.x) -SiteScope (12.x) * 1 Year experience working in a VMWare environment * 1 Year experience working with Oracle (10g, 11g, 12c) or SQL Server (2005, 2008, 2012) database platforms. * Possess intermediate experience on Windows server platform and/or Linux (RHEL) server platform. * Possess novice/intermediate scripting knowledge and experience implementing solution based on JavaScript , Perl, Python, Groovy, Ruby etc. * Possesses excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills and the ability to interface with leadership and all levels of Client resources (technical & non-technical). * Ability to work independently, with strong organizational and flexibility skills in a team-oriented environment. * Familiar with ITIL / ITSM principles & processesPreferred/ Nice-to-haves:\xa0 * Bachelor's Degree in Business, Computer Science or equivalent job experience desired. * Demonstrated continued knowledge acquisition of emerging technologies * Familiarity with other HP products (e.g. HP Business Service Management (BSM), SiteScope, Service Health Reporter) * Experience working with ServiceNow, a plus\xa0 ID:  516327 Type:  Contract Salary:  Open\n\t\t]

column5: [\nJob Description Our client is seeking an IT Project Manager for a contract opportunity. The IT Project Manager will work closely with the Business Relationship Manager (BRM) to ensure valid transitions from solution development to implementation. During implementation you will build upon and strengthen a collaborative and trusting relationship with IT customers ensuring solutions are implemented on or before agreed upon targets. You will provide consistent communication as customer requests are transitioned from solutions to released and implemented services. Your goal will be to ensure customers have clear and unambiguous expectations of major milestones and decision gates of project timelines DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:  Manage project deliverables from solution transition to release and implementation Facilitate the definition of project charter, scope, goals, and deliverables Manage resources assigned to projects with regard to project efforts; provide a single point of contact for project assignments Work closely with the BRM to understand negotiated, documented, and agreed upon request deliverables Create project plans and project schedules Monitor, plan, and control/mitigate project change and risk Facilitate communication between stakeholders (sponsor, consumer, technical staff, vendors, IT staff, etc.) Facilitate and positively motivate project teams to solidify a sense of accountability for on-time, within budget project delivery Be a change agent to ensure IT delivers excellent customer service Communicate progress, status, and issues to customers and IT management Contribute to near-term and long-term organizational planning and strategy Track and manage project tickets/tasks to ensure timely and agreed upon implementations Assist with User Acceptance Testing Compile plans and work assignments; facilitate and monitor work efforts; identify resource trends and needs; and escalate functional, quality, or timeline issues appropriately Lead a team of technical IT resources with demonstrated progression of increased scope and complexity Perform effectively under pressure and/or opposition Gain and retain senior management's confidence in ability to execute multiple complex projects Present effective executive level and decision-making presentations Explain complex technical concepts in pictures and words that are understandable to a broad audience Demonstrate customer collaboration and engagement techniques Manage multiple tasks independently and prioritize to meet business needs Operate in an Information Technology Service Management, specifically Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL) based, environment Show initiative and act independently to resolve problems Manage multiple priorities and follow through on projects/tasks to completion Establish and maintain collaborative working relationships Communicate clearly and concisely, orally and in writing, with users and technical support REQUIREMENTS: Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university with major coursework in business, computer science, project management, information technology, or a related field. Significant related experience may be considered in lieu of a bachelor's degree. 3+ years of full-time responsible project management experience, including large enterprise-wide projects (multiple projects at a time) Experience with SaaS, In-house to Commercial off-the-shelf, converged infrastructure, network connectivity, data storage, firewalls and proxy, or security (internal and boundary). Valid Colorado driver's license ITIL Foundations certification CompTIA Project+ or Certified Associate in Project Management (CAPM) certification \n]

column5: [\nLet Vaco connect you with a great development opportunity! Our client is seeking a skilled Sailpoint Software Developer for a lead development role. Partner with Vaco, and you'll have an advantage over your competition! Instead of being just another faceless resume, Vaco will promote your strengths to the hiring manager while preparing you for that specific interview.Our recruiters will provide you with great insight about trends in the market - keeping you up to date on compensation expectations, company culture, and growth opportunities. If you're an experienced Software Developer, and you want to partner with the best, apply today!As a Lead Software Developer, you will provide high-level consulting services to clients and prepare programming assignments. You will be responsible for designing, planning, and supervising implementation of complex, large-scale system projects.The position is within the Information Security Identity and Access Management (IAM) team. IAM team focuses on providing solutions and services to the entire organization for user lifecycle management (provisioning / de-provisioning), access recertification, and user authentication/authorization. This role focuses on developing technical IAM solutions utilizing SailPoint IdentityIQ solution suite, and data automation. The primary focus of this role will be for Access Management and SailPoint development, engineering, configuring and implementing IAM solutions using SailPoint Identity IQ.Required Skills: Strong understanding of Identity and Access Management (IAM) concepts2-3 years of strong Java, J2EE development experience, including Java frameworks such as Spring MVC, JSF, Struts, etc.Knowledge of operating systems (UNIX/Linux and Solaris, Windows) and of database management systems (Oracle, SQL Server, etc.)Experience with Directories (LDAP, AD)Experience with using web servicesStrong technical and analytical skills with the ability to analyze system functionality and resolve production issuesProven ability to work independently or in conjunction with a teamStrong interpersonal skills and strong written and oral communicationPreferred Skills:2-3 years of hands-on development experience with SailPoint. Experience should include integration of application/resources utilizing the SailPoint out-of-the-box and custom connectors, developing user provisioning/de-provisioning workflows, developing/customizing rules that aid in data collection, and configuration, troubleshooting of SailPoint platform.2-3 years of prior working experience in automating manual and semi-automatic processes via scripting language such as PowerShell, Perl or PythonFamiliarity with leading IAM concepts such as Least Privilege, Privileged Access, Roles and Data mining, Segregation of Duty (SOD), and Role Based Access Control (RBAC).Working knowledge of platform provisioning (groups/roles/accounts/permissions)Experience with C/C++, .NET, C#, PL/SQLEducational Requirements BS Computer Science or equivalent work experienceCISSP certification a plusJ2EE certification a plus\n]

column5: [\nQualifications:In-depth experience in security aspects of multiple platforms, operating systems, software, communications and network protocols is desired. Experiences and qualities desired include: - Demonstrated competency in verbal, written, and presentation communications and interpersonal understanding. - Demonstrated ability to understand customer's business needs. - Demonstrated leadership of work teams/groups. - Demonstrated ability to work with all levels of employees. - Demonstrated organization and planning skills that include: time management, project coordination and management, and the ability to handle multiple deadlines and associated pressures. - Demonstrated competency in developing effective solutions to business problems. - Demonstrated ability to analyze problems and to make decisions. - Demonstrated concern for quality. - Demonstrated self-starter. - Demonstrated ability to be flexible. - Demonstrated ability to work independently.Responsibilities:Works fairly independently, this role assists in the development of security policies, standards and procedures for multiple platforms and diverse systems environments. Works closely with Specialists in Systems Security and Network Systems Operations to consult with clients, management and staff for risk assessments and implementation of appropriate data security procedures and products. May lead moderately complex projects. Administers information security safeguards. Coordinates investigation and reporting of major data security incidents. Works with multiple business units on multi-project assignments. Guides and advises less experienced Systems Security Analysts. May be monitored on project's progress and results. Errors may cause delay, expense and disruption.Comments/Special InstructionsPalo Alto experience is required, Juniper Netscreen is the secondary experience needed. Other firewall experience is considered but if the candidate does not have the core Palo Alto skills do not submit. If the resume has generic working technologies such as server, workstation, and firewall, they are not going to be strong candidates.\xa0We need a candidate with focal knowledge of Palo Alto and Juniper Netscreen that will need minimal guidance to configure and administer Palo Alto and Juniper Firewalls.\n]

column5: [\nFounded in 1998, Matrix Technology Group is an ERP and IT consulting services provider.Matrix Technology Group provides Services into ERP, BI and Application Development.
