[\nSKIDATA Group, headquartered in Salzburg, Austria, is a global leader in access control solutions. Almost 10,000 SKIDATA systems guarantee quick and secure access for people and vehicles in: ski regions, shopping centers, major airports, cities, sport stadiums, fair and amusement parks. The foundation of SKIDATA\u2019s success is on the one hand based on the more than 1,200 dedicated and skilled employees and the clear focus on research and development. On the other hand, the company stands for responsibility and sustainability and benefits from the global network of the Swiss Kudelski Group. SKIDATA and its 23 subsidiaries and countless partners are present in more than 95 countries.Job Title:\xa0 \xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 Field Service TechnicianOffice location: \xa0\xa0\xa0 Grand Prairie, TXCoverage area: \xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 Dallas\u2013Fort-Worth Metroplex\xa0Job Description:SKIDATA, a leading provider of access solutions for parking facilities and resorts around the world, is currently seeking a driven \u201chands-on\u201d Senior Field Support Engineer to perform maintenance, troubleshooting, installation and configuration of the systems for our customers in and around the Dallas\u2013Fort Worth metropolitan area. \xa0You must be able to show initiative, work independently and explain/understand product offerings to our customers. \xa0Must be willing to learn and keep up with technology.\xa0Duties and Responsibilities: Perform Level 1 field repairs on parking access, software and/or hardware related.Troubleshoots and corrects problems on devices/equipment down to board level.Corrects/fixes minor to moderate software issues on parking/access systems.Understands and troubleshoots the basic setup of a SKIDATA network.Properly identifies all network devices on a LAN (router, modem, switch etc.)Understands and troubleshoots the basic setup of a credit card configuration within the SKIDATA network.Provides good effective communication and customer service.Properly identifies when higher level support is needed.Properly executes troubleshooting instructions from higher level support.Properly maintains vehicle and keeps it in good running condition.Properly maintains his/hers inventory levels.Safely use company provided devices/software (i.e. tablet PC, Laptop, Cell Phone, etc.) to properly communicate with base office. Company provided devices are for business use only. If personal calls need to be made, it should be done using personal devices, on personal time and never in front of customer. (i.e. breaks).Responsible for transactions for assigned FRs (Electronic Service Tickets) in JIRA/Axapta (ERP system) on a per FR basis (materials/parts and labor), to include preventative maintenance visits.\xa0 Also responsible for maintaining and filling out PM Records and appropriate Service Call Report Forms.Effectively communicates with the Service Coordinator/Advisors and Service management team.Accurately accounts for his/her time and all inventory transactions in ISM.Comply with Service procedures and protocol.Other tasks as assigned.\xa0Required:At least 1 year of experience as a cable TV, phone system, security system or other low voltage system installer desired.Proficiency and experience with Microsoft Office family of products (Word, Excel).The most important characteristic is the ability to solve problems by researching internet forums, manuals, and other resources. Willingness to learn through self-education and training.Ideal candidate will have a Bachelor's or Associate's college degree or Technical degree/certification or Military experience in a technical field.Willingness to travel and work with a global team of professionals.Electronics experience\u2026military communications experience is a plus.\xa0SKIDATA is an equal opportunity employer. We do not unlawfully discriminate in employment, and qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin or age.\n]

[\nSeeking a PKI SME to support a VMware and PIV environment.Requirements/ Responsibilities* BS Degree and 15+ Years or MS Degree and 13+ Years* DHS Public Trust clearance (active DOD TS can be substituted)* VMware VCP5-DCV and MCSE 2012 Server Infrastructure certification* CompTIA Mobility+CE, CompTIA Security+, and ITIL Foundation * Subject matter expertise in planning, designing and implementing PKI Infrastructure and Single Sign On (SSO) solutions* Provide engineering support PKI Infrastructure and Single-Sign-On SSO solutions for 3rd party applications* Engineering, planning, designing and implementing internal use Certificate Authority (CA) for Non-Person Entity (NPE)* Engineering, planning, implementing, deploying and supporting VMware Infrastructure* Engineering, planning, implementing, deploying and supporting Cloud Hosting VMs and solutions* VMware ESX/ESXi 5/6 vSphere, Microsoft Windows Server 2008/ 2012 Enterprise* Windows 7/10, Microsoft Exchange 2008, IIS 6.0/7.0, Active Directory 2008* McAfee Host Based Security system (HBSS), ePolicy Orchestrator, Host Intrusion Prevention (HIP)* Supporting applications with PIV authentication requirements* Troubleshooting all PIV/Authentication related issues* Maintaining PIV provisioning application* Mobile support experience* Tier 3 support to virtual and physical application, Web, DB infrastructures* Patching and maintaining Windows serversPreferred* Tanium, Bomgar, Invincea, Xceedium, NetApp NAS and SANs.* Dell / HP / IBM Servers, IBM SAN, EMC\xb2 SAN, F5 Big-IP Global Traffic Manager/Local* Traffic Manager appliances, Cisco ASA firewalls, routers & switches* Providing engineering support for Bomgar enterprise* Engineering, planning, implementing, deploying and supporting Xceedium appliances in managing privileged credentials* Engineering, planning, implementing, deploying and supporting Invincea End Point client security protection\n\t\t]

[\nPosition: Information Risk Analyst (ZD1883)Location: Jersey City, NJDuration: 9 months \u2013 2yrsRate: DOEPosition SummaryThe Information Risk Analyst is responsible for performing risk assessments of applications, infrastructure, business and technology vendors against a defined risk framework. These assessments will be conducted either through a formalized risk assessment program or through other risk reporting activities (e.g., policy exceptions, risk acceptance). The Information Risk Analyst will have the ability to identify risks in the way that a business and technology utilize information and the supporting technological systems.ResponsibilitiesSchedule and perform information risk assessments using our methodology; identify, document and communicate control deficiencies in business processes and technology systemsWork with the business and technology to agree cyber security risk findings identified through the risk assessment processProvide risk remediation recommendations that the business and technology may implement to mitigate identified control gapsPartner with business and IT to ensure that risks are clearly articulated in a manner that is understood by business and technology audiencesEvaluate management responses to ensure that remediation plans and tasks adequately address identified control gapsDocument risk issues in the designated risk registerAssist the business and technology groups through our process for policy exceptions and risk acceptance\xa0Experience5+ years of risk assessment experience in one or more areas: application, infrastructure, vendor risk managementFinancial Services Industry experience a plus but not requiredProficiency with Information Risk Management best practicesTechnical background required \u2013 it can be app dev, sys admin, database \u2013 but whatever it is, experience in an enterprise environment.Information Security experienceFinancial Services experience is preferred (knowing about settlements, clearing and financial regulations is a big +)Prior experience performing Risk Assessments is preferred as wellAt least 5-10 years overall experience\xa0Knowledge and Skills RequiredProven knowledge of technical infrastructure, networks, databases and systems as they relate to cyber security riskProven knowledge of security methodologies, policies, standards and best practicesProven knowledge of information technology systems, infrastructure and operationsAbility to explain and articulate technical concepts using both technical and non-technical languageCritical thinking and analytical skillsExcellent presentation skills (MS PowerPoint)Ability to manipulate data in a spreadsheet (MS Excel)Ability to work collaboratively by building consensus and influencing decision making to foster forward progress with projects and initiativesStrong oral and written communication skillsExcellent organizational skills, coupled with ability to be versatile and flexibleSound business judgment and the ability to work successfully with all levels of managementExcellent grammar and style skills; ability to adapt writing style for different audiences and media\xa0EducationBachelor\u2019s degree preferred\xa0Interested candidates may send their resume to james@zarit.com or call 201-633-4041 to discuss.\n]

[\nRobert Half is looking for a Citrix Engineer for a 3 to 6 month contract to hire here in the Houston area. PEOPLE  1. Lead departmental and enterprise-wide projects with an emphasis on new technology. 2. Demonstrate leadership experience within a Citrix Server Engineering team. 3. Provide mentoring and guidance to other Citrix Server Engineers. 4. Complex problem analysis and recovery. 5. Aid in coordinating all incident response events from detection to final remediation. 6. Provides an escalation point to other Citrix engineers and technical consulting to the Help Desk, Application groups, business units, internal customers and other Server Engineers with regard to Citrix server hardware, software and capabilities. 7. Responsible for recommending new technologies for possible business applications. 8. Responsible for managing large enterprise scale systems from all technologies 9. Technical consultation on complex projects and general questions 10. Perform other duties as assigned. QUALITY/SAFETY  1. Performance monitoring, technical support and advanced trouble-shooting of servers.  2. Data integrity, backups, restores and disaster recovery strategy, planning and execution. 3. Provide proactive Server support including firmware/BIOS updates, Support Packs, researching the latest customer advisories, implementing recommendations; ensuring the desirable server performance. 4. Package, test and deploy application packages and configurations to clients. 5. Maintaining and creating standards and documentation for Server and Storage environments. SERVICE  1. Demonstrate effective use of time management skills. 2. Interact and communicate effectively with customers, team members, and management.  3. Demonstrates and supports the Methodist vision, mission, and customer service 4. Adheres to system, division and department policies, procedures, guidelines and standards.  GROWTH/INNOVATION  1. Provides strategic and advanced planning, design, and implementation of Microsoft and Unix Server systems, server virtualization and hardware. 2. Responsible for maintaining an advanced awareness of the latest technologies and trends in the Microsoft / UNIX system stack, virtualization and hardware platforms.  3. Design and document options for new application and infrastructure implementations that could beneficial and within the vision of IT Infrastructure. Job Requirements EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS 1. 8 + years IT experience. 2. 5 + years Citrix server administration experience in a large networked environment. 3. Solid hands on experience with Microsoft server operating systems 2003, 2008, 2012 4. Solid hands on experience working with Microsoft desktop OS - Windows 7 32 / 64 bit 5. Understanding of Microsoft Active Directory, DNS, Networking and Powershell 6. Solid understanding of deploying Citrix servers using VMWARE ESXi Environment. 7. Experience in supporting a large Citrix Environment including Netscaler application delivery controllers 8. Solid understanding of Windows Server Operating Systems, NTFS Permissions, Performance Analysis and Active Directory configuration/support. 9. Excellent troubleshooting, root cause analysis and permanent problem resolution skills. 10. Ability to manage detailed tasks efficiently and effectively 11. Strong project management skills. 12. Excellent customer service skills. 13. Excellent verbal and written communication skills 14. Ability to communicate technical proposals to supervisors and management 15. Ability to handle multiple tasks in a fast paced environment. 16. Creating/managing Server / Desktop Operating System images for different Citrix environments using Citrix Provisioning Server 17. Implement, and Support Citrix Desktop / Server Provisioning infrastructure and orchestration / automation. 18. Implement and support Personalization virtualization infrastructure 19. Managing the delivery of hundreds of application using XenApp IMA & FMA technologies 20. Monitor all components of Citrix infrastructure to maintain performance and reliability 21. Managing Rollup and Hotfix deployment across the Citrix infrastructure 22. Manage the delivery of hundreds of Desktops using pooled and dedicated delivery methods 23. Provide application break fix working with support application support teams and managing customer coordination. 24. Upgrading and maintaining all the tools and infrastructure necessary to provide the above services SPECIAL KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES REQUIRED 1. Solid hands on experience working with Citrix XenDesktop and XenApp 2. Solid hands on experience working with Appsense (Environment, Performance, and Application manager) 3. Must be able to learn new applications / programs quickly 4. Interacting with customers at various levels within the organization (including the executive level) 5. Ability to connect with Microsoft, Citrix and other solution partners for technical solutions 6. Microsoft App-V is a plus\n\t\t]

[\nRole: ERP Program ManagerLocation: Glenview, ILDuration: Full Time Permanent PositionJob Summary:The ERP Program Manager is responsible for the on time, on budget, within scope management and delivery of Microsoft Dynamics AX implementations for all parts of the business. They will need to effectively anticipate and manage issues and risks. The program manager manages horizontally across multiple parallel projects involved with the program. Ensuring that cross-project work effort remains feasible from a business standpoint and realizes benefits. Responsible for defining, acquiring, allocating and optimizing resources across all\xa0 projects, as well as any additional work that is required. To be successful the Program Manager will need to have a high level of strategic and organizational awareness.Qualifications/Skills:Bachelors or Master\u2019s Degree in Information Systems, Information Technology, Computer Science or Engineering or equivalent.10 + Years of demonstrated experience implementing ERP systems including 4+ implementing Microsoft Dynamics AX2012.Reference able Project and Program leadership capabilities including at least 3 full life cycle implementations. One of which was global or multi-country.Significant prior experience in addressing both the business and IT activities associated with an ERP project, including:Process MappingRequirements gathering and gap analysisOverall solution definition including process, information, people and technology componentsTest plan developmentBusiness and system implementation planning and executionOrganizational Change Management and readinessKey ResponsibilitiesDevelopment of an effective planning process, including an integrated project schedule that encompasses all aspects for the ERP Program.Making timely, effective decisions at the project level and communicating those decisions both up and down the program structure, while approaching needed decisions in a logical and thoughtful manner, weighing conflicting information where necessary.Directing and motivating the Project Teams.Implement and lead an effective project change management process that pro-actively identifies project changes and incorporates an appropriate impact analysis and approval for such changes across the ERP program team.Creating and maintaining a financial management process that incorporates actual financial performance to forecasted performance and justifies all variances; accurately forecasts expenditures in alignment with the project budget and supports the budgeting process throughout the project lifecycle.Actively directs the development and maintenance of plans, practices and assignments to identify, quantify and contain the occurrence and potential impact of risks and risk events on the execution of a program and its likelihood of success.Be an escalation point for resolving project and program issues.Develop and maintain an effective status management process and regularly report progress to the StakeholdersDefine an affective resource planAbility to assess and guide staffing decisions\xa0\xa0Personal Attributes:\xa0Strong leadership skillsStrong business acumen with technical backgroundStrong customer service orientationStrong collaboration and teamworkExcellent written and verbal communication skills with a strong customer focusHighly motivated and self-directedStrong interpersonal skills with ability to engage and build strong relationships with business and IT leaders, project team members and usersExcellent multi-tasking skills with capability to adapt to rapidly changing environments.Results oriented\xa0Thanks & Regards...Muzeeb KhanOffice: 414 \u2013 446 - 7026Email:\xa0mkhan@encore-c.com \xa0\n]

[\nThe position is part of the Myuhc 2.0 API QA team (OBAPI). Day to day responsibilities are listed below, along with associated skills.PROJECT: This project is part of the Myuhc 2.0 Redesign. This project was approved by our business partners to redesign the Myuhc member portal. Part of the new design is being done by the Rally Health team, and the other part is being done by Optum Technology. This project is being done to revamp the myuhc experience for a more modern and dynamic experience for our members.IDEAL BACKGROUND: I would like somebody that is a quick learner, can communicate well, and can get work done on time. Candidate should have a computer science background with Java experience. Specifically they will need experience in automating of test cases during a sprint or as part of regression activities. The individual will be responsible for testing the APIs that are used by both Rally and Myuhc. Individual should have 3-5 years of QA experience.Skills Required\u2022 Understanding of APIs\u2022 Use of SOAP UI\u2022 Ability to query the data base\u2022 Exposure to ATDD\u2022 Ability to create feature files and run them\u2022 Understanding of requirements/Acceptance criteria\u2022 Analyze acceptance criteria to write test scenarios\u2022 Understand data flowsSkills Requested\u2022 Exposure to Agile methodology\u2022 Good communication skills\u2022 Work independently\u2022 Quick learner\u2022 Team player\u2022 MotivatedPersonal QualitiesCreative Problem SolvingGood Organization SkillsAble to MultitaskSelf DrivenScripting/Automation MentalityQA Mentality (Not just following provided Acceptance Criteria, but to look beyond it)\n]

[\nQ2 Software\xa0is focused on empowering returns on relationships for community-centered financial institutions and their retail and commercial account holders. We do this with the most comprehensive, secure and adaptable smart banking platform of its kind, designed to deliver a compelling, consistent user experience on any device and enable customers to deliver secure, innovative services and increasingly, to generate new sources of revenue.\xa0\xa0Named as one of Austin\u2019s fastest growing companies and one of the best places to work, Q2 offers our employees a culture fueled by engaged, motivated and dedicated team members.Q2 Software is seeking a\xa0Python Data Migration Developer\xa0that will join an existing data migration team that\u2019s responsible for converting the client\u2019s online banking data from their legacy system onto the Q2 platform. Additionally, the team is responsible for handling user data involved in mergers and acquisitions. The candidate will leverage proprietary Python/SQL framework to accomplish these activities.\xa0\xa0The Analyst will follow the Q2 standard Data Migration Process to analyze incoming data sets, work with clients to determine requirements and customizations, and design/create the Python/SQL code to successfully convert the client\u2019s data onto the Q2 Platform. We are seeking an analytically minded individual passionate about data and one with a keen eye for detail! This role is working in one of the most visible departments at Q2 and you will have the opportunity for a lot of career growth and development. This position also offers the opportunity to travel 15 \u2013 20% in working with our financial institution clients.\xa0RESPONSIBILITIES:Perform gap analysis on incoming data sets, offering guidance to clients on how to handle gaps and other data related challengesQuickly troubleshoot complex technical issues and roll out fixes with minimal bugsMap incoming data fields to the Q2 online banking platform through the creation of data filters and/or translations to ensure the data fits the Q2 modelCommunicate complex mapping challenges or date related issues to clientsLeverage proprietary Python tools to create or update custom conversion frameworksManage multiple projects while occasionally receiving escalated cases from management and prioritize accordinglyTroubleshoot client project issues in a timely manner and escalate unresolved problems to the appropriate resourcesThoroughly document and track production environment modificationsEstablish relationships with other partner teams that impact technical support including Implementation Teams, Data Center Operations, QA, and DevelopmentFollow internal change control processes to implement any required production modificationsPerform other duties and responsibilities as assignedMentor junior team membersEXPERIENCE AND KNOWLEDGE:Minimum of 4\xa0years of previous data migration experience required3+ years of experience writing tools using Python or similar scripting language3+ years of experience with MSSQLExcellent communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills requiredStrong knowledge of XMLStrong knowledge of common banking terminology and best practicesKeen attention to detail while keeping an eye toward the big pictureNeed a team player with the ability to work weekends if necessary and the possible occasional late night or early morningAbility to deal with ambiguity, tight timelines and demanding constraints and resolve issues in a timely manner within a high-pressure environmentAbility to travel up to 20% domestically\xa0\xa0\n]

[\nSystem Soft Technologies is widely recognized for its professionalism, strong corporate morals, customer satisfaction, and effective business practices. We provide a full spectrum of business and IT services and solutions, including custom application development, enterprise solutions, systems integration, mobility solutions, and business information management. System Soft Technologies combines business domain knowledge with industry-specific practices and methodologies to offer unique solutions, and enable clients to compete with global standards. column5: [\n  Be a part of shaping our future. In the midst of rapidly growing populations, rising development around the world, and increasing demand, the way we are managing energy and water resources will shape the future of our planet.\xa0 Itron's decades of experience is helping to ensure success in creating a more resourceful world.\xa0      Itron's West Union, SC location is seeking a Test Engineer that performs the set-up, calibration, testing and troubleshooting of circuits, components, instruments and mechanical assemblies. Determines and may develop test specifications, methods and procedures from blueprints, drawings and diagrams. Tests and troubleshoots assemblies and/or final systems. May complete rework on assemblies and/or systems as a result of testing. Prepares technical reports summarizing findings and recommending solutions to technical problems. May assist in the selection and set-up of specialized test equipment.  Maintain, troubleshoot and restore proper operation of production equipment. Perform mechanical and electronic preventive maintenance. Maintain positive attitude and be mindful of influence on co-workers. Maintain communication with production supervision and support staff regarding the status and capabilities of the equipment. Demonstrate leadership and initiative towards meeting company objectives. Enter data in spreadsheets and text files. Assist Engineers and Support Staff on special projects. Conform to company policies. Stay aware of product/process trends. Qualifications Experience:  This position requires a minimum of 1-2 years of related experience Education:  Associate's degree or equivalent experience. Travel:  1 - 10% Physical Demands:  While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit or stand, and use hands to finger, handle, or feel small and medium sized components. The employee is frequently required to reach with hands and arms, climb or balance, stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl, and to lift weight or exert force up to 50 pounds. The employee in this position works in an environment where they may be exposed to fumes or airborne particles, outdoor weather conditions, there is a risk of electrical shock, and there is vibration. The employee may be required to work with toxic or caustic chemicals, may be subject to higher noise levels, or work near moving mechanical parts. Itron is an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action Employer. Qualified applicants are considered without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, citizenship, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, medical condition, veteran status, disability, genetic information, gender identity or other characteristics protected by law. If you require an accommodation in order to apply to this position, please contact your local recruiting representative at 1-800-635-5461 or email  Accessibility@itron.com . CB1 #LI-JO1 #DICE \n]

[\nETL LEAD/ARCHITECT \u2013 WOODLAND HILLS, CAContract- 6 months to 1 yearTemp to Perm or Client might consider fulltime if great candidate.P&C Insurance experince is Ideal Client is seeking an experienced ETL Lead/Architect to drive design and development in Informatica for an existing project in Woodland Hills Client has commenced a Personal Lines Modernization program based on the Guidewire PolicyCenter / ClaimCenter administration system. As part of this program, Client is laying the foundation for a Guidewire ODS that is based on an industry-standard model to allow for plan expansion by source system, products and lines of business. This GW ODS serves multiple use cases, including potential near-real-time consumers and batch consumers. The ODS is a strategic asset and spans Policy, Claims and eventually other areas across the enterprise.WHAT THIS ROLE DOES: Architect, design, develop, performance tune and maintain ETL objects and scripts using Informatica Power center. Provide Informatica subject matter expert (SME) for the ODS. Manage multiple technical project workflows and ensuring data quality from end-to-end.PRIMARY JOB RESPONSIBILITIES: Architect and design Informatica objects and workflows. Assessing requirements and defining the strategy, technical architecture, implementation plan and delivery of data integration projects. Design, develop and maintain ETL data integration process with the ODS team Design ETL Framework for Audit Balance Control, Error handling and ODS Reconciliation Analyze and provide technical solution for the ODS from data integration and design perspective. Work with other departments on solidifying the solution from data and work flow perspective to ensure an integral end-to-end solution. Responsible for the ETL data integration process which is accomplished through the use of Informatica Power center, Oracle and Autosys Scheduler. Implement the data mappings captured from legacy Claims applications to Claims Center and to ODS base model. Establish interfaces, developing and modifying functions, programs, routines, and stored procedures to extract, transform, and load data Coordinating actions among developers, production control, DBA, infrastructure team and project vendor to implement the ETL scripts and objects. Validates ETL by developing and executing test plans and scenarios including data design and data quality. Perform and maintain performance of data warehouse by identifying and resolving data conflicts, optimizing databases, networks and hardware. Incorporate metadata and data lineage to support BI enterprise data reporting. Optimize the ETL design by implementing mappings, sessions and workflows and managing the reusable components efficientlyREQUIRED SKILLS College degree in Business, MIS, or related discipline preferred Informatica Power center 9x, Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle, Requirements Analysis and Design, Data Conversion, Data Modeling with relational and dimensional structures Self-managing and ability to lead project solution end-to-end. High analytical skill and experience to support transitioning data architecture in a legacy and service oriented environment. Strong communication skill and ability to interact at all levels including management level communication. Excellent verbal communication skills Excellent written communication/process documentation skills Excellent interpersonal skills Ability to prioritize and organize multiple tasks Ability to remain organized with multiple interruptions Ability to lead other technical team members and knowledge share Ability to recommend and present solution with justifications to management and related teams.REQUIRED EXPERIENCE At least 7-10 years progressive work experience with minimum 5 years of hands-on design, workflow, development and performance tuning experience in data warehouse, SQL Server/Oracle, and Informatica Power center Subject matter expert experience with Informatica Power center including architecture, design, ETL trouble shooting and performance tuning. Experience in Stored Procedures and Autosys scheduler is preferred.\n]

[\n\t\t\tRESPONSIBILITIES:Kforce has a client seeking a Senior Analog Test Engineer for a growing company in Tucson, Arizona (AZ). We are looking for candidates nationwide willing to relocate to the Tucson, AZ area. Once again, the position is in Tucson, AZ. The Analog Test Engineer will be responsible for specification, development and support of automated test and laser trim solutions for both new product introductions and legacy products.Responsibilities:* Design and develop production test systems for monolithic, hybrid and open-frame products* Prepare comprehensive test requirements, plans, procedures, and hardware to be utilized in a manufacturing operation* Develop reusable object oriented test software* Establish software rigor to ensure repeatable source/revision control* Work with design engineers, technician and marketing personnel to develop a comprehensive test solution at the lowest possible cost* Work with design, QA, and manufacturing teams to maintain quality standards* Regularly communicate with cross functional team on status and raise critical issues in a timely manner* Maintain integrity, serviceability, and calibration of both manual and automated in-house qualification test stations* Perform other related duties as requested or requiredREQUIREMENTS:* BS degree in Electrical Engineering* Five (5) years' experience in test engineering in an automated production environment* Experienced in test equipment control and data acquisition* Experience with ATE Testers such as Eagle and/or Teradyne are plusses* Experience with GPIB interface* Working knowledge of descriptive and inferential statistics* Understanding of safety requirements while working with or around high voltage and/or high current test systems is a plus* Knowledge of analog systems and op amps* Knowledge of power analog and power op amps preferred* Ability to generate test development schedules and execute to those schedules in support of product development programs* Gage R&R and Correlation experience* Proficient with object oriented programming or scripting languages including VB6/VB.net, Python or Perl* Experience with C/C++, SQL* Familiarity with digital interfaces including, Ethernet, SPI, RS-485, I2C* Experienced in software development in a team environment under source/revision control* Experienced user of test equipment including Vector Network analyzers, spectrum analyzers, oscilloscopes, etc. * Knowledge of Engineering Change documentation and processes* Familiarity with Laser trimming or active laser trim processesKforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.\n]

column5: [\nSenior Business Applications Developer (C#/Web/SQL) Job Description Are you passionate about software? Are you constantly pushing yourself to learn new technologies to develop better, faster and more efficient applications? Then CoStar is the place for you. Everyone at CoStar is deeply committed to delivering high-performing applications that change the way our users consume and use commercial real estate data. We are THE leading data provider to the $11 trillion commercial real estate industry. Every day customers use our data and products to make multi-million dollar investment decisions. Our team in our headquarters Washington, DC office is growing and searching for a Senior Business Applications Developer who can take us to the next level. Are you up for the challenge? Mission The Senior Business Applications Developer (C#/Web/SQL) is responsible for designing, developing and troubleshooting high performance and high availability applications supporting internal users and business processes using C#, web, Microsoft SQL Server and related technologies to meet the company-s strategic objectives. The role involves a mix of maintenance and new development while both adhering to and advancing CoStar-s processes, practices and technologies. Objectives * Learn CoStar's data, processes and products. * Analyze technical requirements by CoStar-s product strategy, propose designs, and contribute with technical feedback. * Design and implement new web-based and WinForms experiences in new and existing applications from the UI through to data storage by leveraging C#, the .NET Framework, modern HTML/CSS/ECMAScript/Typescript and libraries thereof, targeted platforms and browsers, and Microsoft SQL Server features. * Plan, implement and extend back-end C# Windows services and even NodeJS-based services. * Design and develop using Object Oriented, Set Oriented, and Functional design principles and software design patterns to attain high reusability and maintainability. * Troubleshoot issues with basic investigative or advanced debugging techniques. * Adhere to CoStar-s general functional, performance and availability software requirements. * Adhere to CoStar's established processes and practices for solution delivery. * Facilitate discussions among other developers to exchange and promote new ideas and improvements. * Continually evaluate emerging technologies to identify opportunities, trends and best practices that can be used to strengthen CoStar-s technology platform and development practices. * Develop database SQL scripts, stored procedures and SSIS packages as required. * Maintain and support CoStar-s products that are released to stakeholders and customers. * Communicate professionally and effectively to build consensus among different teams working on software development projects. Competencies, Knowledge & Skills A strong candidate demonstrates many of the following: * Works with minimal supervision or assistance to complete tasks * Strong analytical and problem solving abilities * Experience in Enterprise-scale software development environments * Expert knowledge of fundamentals in relevant computer architectures, networking, and common protocols * Expert knowledge of the concepts and design patterns of Object Oriented, Set Oriented, and even Functional Programming * Expert knowledge of the .NET Framework architecture and the C# language * Expert knowledge of JavaScript runtime/engine concerns and the HTML DOM * Expert knowledge of server-side web-technologies including WebAPI, ASP.NET MVC, ASP.NET and even SignalR and NodeJS * Expert knowledge of web-based technologies including ECMAScript 2016+, modern HTML & CSS and even TypeScript and websockets * Expert knowledge of JavaScript-based libraries including Knockout, Angular, Durandal * Expert knowledge of server/workstation programming concerns including logging, installation/deployment and development of Windows services * Advanced-level skill in troubleshooting and tool-assisted debugging * Strong working knowledge of the Microsoft SQL language and relational data modeling * Strong working knowledge of ADO.NET, Microsoft SQL and stored procedure development * Strong working knowledge of SDLC * Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Team Foundation version control and planning tools and even Git version control * Strong at requirements analysis and management * Experience with Microsoft SQL SSIS * Experience in software testing (Unit, System, Integration, Functional, Performance) * Working knowledge of feature/behavior differences among versions of relevant technologies * Strong ability to clearly communicate thoughts and ideas within and across teams * Strong ability to work well with other developers and management * Adaptability/Stress tolerance * Ability to juggle priorities * Awareness of emerging technologies DC Office Benefits * Work for an environmentally conscious company in an environmentally friendly building that is LEED Gold Certified * Available Segways and bikes for personal use - free * $100 / month in Metro SmartCard Benefits * Beautiful roof top terrace with expansive views of the city; great for lunch and after work hangouts * Green roof * One block walk to Metro train station * Electric vehicle charging stations onsite * Underground parking * Complete fitness center with locker rooms onsite - free * Onsite Yoga - free * Fresh fruit, juice, vegetables, and yogurts stocked daily - free * Full HD video conference system between any CoStar office *LI-MC1 CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing\n\t\t]

column5: [\nOverview: \xa0  We are looking for an Application Security Assessor/Penetration Tester to support our Prime Cyber Program for FDIC in Arlington, VA.  The Mid Application Security Assessor/Penetration Tester will be responsible for performing various technical security assessments, educating the client on the inherent risks, and providing meaningful hardening and mitigation strategies. Job responsibilities include network and web-based application penetration tests, physical security assessments, logical security audits, and hands-on technical security evaluations and implementations. Additionally, this person will be expected to develop subject matter expertise or focused capabilities in the topics of database security, wireless security, or application and development security. Demonstrated technical experience with: \xa0  * Web Application Penetration Testing  * Network Penetration Testing  * Vulnerability Detection and Remediation  * Linux, MS Windows  * Network Switching and Routing Technical writing experience: \xa0  * Application assessment reports  * Standard operating procedures documents  * Formal policy and procedure documents Responsibilities: \xa0  * Conduct network and web-based application penetration tests  * Conduct physical security assessments  * Conduct logical security audits and hands-on technical security evaluations and implementations  * Develop subject matter expertise of focused capabilities in the topics of database security, wireless security, or application and development security Qualifications: \xa0 Requirements: \xa0  * 5+ years of IT experience to include 3+ years of experience in information security with specific application penetration testing experience  * Bachelor's degree in an IT related field or equivalent education or work experience.  * Working knowledge of TCP/IP ports and protocols  * In depth familiarity with Windows and UNIX operating systems  * Familiarity with web proxy tools such as Burp, Paros, and Fiddler  * Experience looking for security issues such as Cross Site Scripting, SQL Injection, Cookie Manipulation, Buffer Overflows, etc  * Familiarity with penetration testing tools and tool suites such as Burp Suite Pro, Kali Linux, nmap, Metasploit, Nessus, tcpdump, wireshark, Nikto, etc  * Excellent written and oral communication skills  * Self-motivated and able to work in an independent manner  * Must be able to obtain "Public Trust" level clearance. (SF-85 and SF-86 submission required) Other Qualifications: \xa0  * Familiarity with Open Web Application Security Project (OWASP), National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) Special Publications, and Open Source Security Testing Methodology Manual (OSSTMM)  * Database administration, device configuration hardening and compliance verification experience a plus  * OSCP, CISSP, GIAC, GWAPT, GPEN, CEH, or CCNA certification a plus  * Familiarity with scripting in UNIX shell, PERL, or Python a plus  * Advanced degree in an IT related field a plus  * Working knowledge of firewalls and other network security products  * Knowledge of applied cryptographic protocols  * Familiarity with XML, SOAP, and Ajax  * Ability to conduct source code reviews Clearance: \xa0 US Citizen - Must be able to obtain "Public Trust" level clearance. (SF-85 and SF-86 submission required). Options: \xa0  Apply for this job onlineApply  Share  Email this job to a friendRefer  Share on your newsfeed \xa0 Category:  IT Security\n\t\t]

[\nDescription \xa0  CSC Covansys Corporation    has an opening for a  Programmer Analyst Senior Professional  (Ref# PASP120SN)  to work in Southfield, MI and various unanticipated locations throughout the U.S.\xa0 Duties: \xa0\xa0Codes, tests, debugs, implements, and documents programs.\xa0 Analyzes, designs and writes specifications for programs. Will accept any suitable combination of education, training, or experience as per the requirements cited herein.\xa0 40hrs/week, 8:00AM - 5:00PM. \xa0  Application Instructions:  \xa0 To apply, please MAIL resume to referenced address, ensuring to indicate the position reference code  (Ref# PASP120SN)  for which you are applying. \xa0Mail to: CSC Covansys Corporation, Attn: W. Mazoway, Director-Talent Acquisition, 25800 Northwestern Highway, Suite 525, Southfield, MI \xa048075. \xa0 Department:  Applications Clearance:  None\n\t\t]

column2: Strategy Consulting - Human Capital - HR Transformation Manager
column5: [\nAre you passionate about delivering goals to your client that go above and beyond their expectations?\xa0 Does the opportunity to work with the world\u2019s leading businesses excite you?\xa0 Our HR Operational Excellence team is thrilled to render results that help our clients transform their HR practices in ways that lead to significant savings, a leading edge on competition, and greater efficiency.\xa0  \xa0 Work you\u2019ll do As a Manager for the HR Operational Excellence team you will use your knowledge and experience of HR operations and processes to optimize business results through the alignment of HR service delivery and strategy. Help businesses achieve their strategic objectives for performance and growth by: Maintaining a hands-on approach to ensure deadlines are met and key deliverables are always accurate Leading your team to deliver superior results for your client, while navigating your client effectively Managing all aspects of the project, including monitoring and identifying any project issues early to be able to mitigate any risk for your client Designing workplans for large complex global engagements Forging strong relationships with both the clients and project teams that will contribute to your growth and development. The HRT team At Deloitte Consulting LLP, helping our clients exploit new technologies like employee engagement tools, advanced workforce planning and analytics we empower HR to better support the business and create value. HR organizations now reduce costs and improve operating effectiveness through process improvements, shared services, outsourcing and employee self-service, but that\u2019s only part of the story, we help them to drive the value this delivers and help the business achieve its strategic objectives in performance and growth.   Learn more about our HR Transformation practice . \xa0 HR Operational Excellence Team Credibility with the business starts with delivering HR services with excellence.\xa0 To stay current in this world of disruption, HR needs to apply design thinking to their processes, digital technology to their applications and deliver services through the lens of the employee experience while still stretching every operational dollar to its fullest value.\xa0 Working with Deloitte enables you to bring these trends together in an operating model that is focused on delivering impact that the business will value.\xa0  \xa0 Qualifications Required: 6+ years related experience  External consulting experience Knowledge of HR function, processes, and best practices Experience in one or more of the following areas:\xa0 HR Shared Services, Outsourcing Advisory, Business Case, Metrics & Benchmarking, HR Processes, M&A and/or HR Program Management.\xa0  Up to 80% travel required\xa0 Preferred: 8+ years of related experience Bachelor\u2019s degree strongly preferred How you\u2019ll grow At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there\u2019s always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world.\xa0 From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs at Deloitte University, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career. \xa0 Explore Deloitte University, The Leadership Center. \xa0 Benefits At Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits.  Learn more about what working at Deloitte can mean for you. \xa0 Deloitte\u2019s culture Our positive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best work every day. We celebrate individuals by recognizing their uniqueness and offering them the flexibility to make daily choices that can help\xa0them to be healthy, centered, confident, and aware. We offer well-being programs and are continuously looking for new ways to maintain a culture where our people excel and lead healthy, happy lives. \xa0 Learn more about Life at Deloitte. \xa0 Corporate citizenship Deloitte is led by a purpose: to make an impact that matters. This purpose defines who we are and extends to relationships with our clients, our people and our communities.\xa0 We believe that business has the power to inspire and transform. We focus on education, giving, skill-based volunteerism, and leadership to help drive positive social impact in our communities.\xa0  Learn more about Deloitte\u2019s impact on the world. \xa0 Recruiter tips We want job seekers exploring opportunities at Deloitte to feel prepared and confident. To help you with your interview, we suggest that you do your research: know some background about the organization and the business area you\u2019re applying to.  Check out recruiting tips from Deloitte professionals. Deloitte is one of the leading professional services organizations in the United States, specializing in audit, tax, consulting, and financial advisory services with clients in more than 20 industries. We provide powerful business solutions to some of the world's most well-known and respected companies, including more than 75 percent of the Fortune 100.  At Deloitte, you can have a rewarding career on every level. In addition to challenging and meaningful work, you'll have the chance to give back to your community, make a positive impact on the environment, participate in a range of diversity and inclusion initiatives, and find the support, coaching, and training it takes to advance your career. Our commitment to individual choice lets you customize aspects of your career path, your educational opportunities and your benefits. And our culture of innovation means your ideas on how to improve our business and your clients' will be heard. About Deloitte As used in this document, \u201cDeloitte\u201d means Deloitte LLP and its subsidiaries. Please see www.deloitte.com/us/about for a detailed description of the legal structure of Deloitte LLP and its subsidiaries. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law. Disclaimer: If you are not reviewing this job posting on our Careers' site (careers.deloitte.com) or one of our approved job boards we cannot guarantee the validity of this posting. For a list of our current postings, please visit us at careers.deloitte.com.\n\t\t]

[\nOne of Collabera's premier clients - Nation's Leading Financial Institution is looking for SAS Architect, the job specs for which are as mentioned below.\xa0Job Title: SAS ArchitectLocation: Charlotte, NCDuration: 12 \u2013 18 months \xa0Job DescriptionSeeking a SAS architect to function in a SAS, SAS Visual Analytics, SQL Server, Unix/Linux environment.Candidate needs to have at least 10 years of IT experience with at least 5 years working on SAS projects. Candidate will be expected to take business requirements and come up with the required data integration processes/architecture as well as front-end visualizations.IT experience of at least 10 yearsAt least 5 years working on SAS and related productsExpertise in importing data into SAS from Excel, XML and flat filesExpertise in SAS/SQL \u2013 accessing relational databases to import data into SASExpertise in Data scrubbing, manipulation and formatting to generate SAS data sets or data files to be consumed by SAS reporting layerExperience using SAS Enterprise Guide (EG) and job scheduling within EGExperience in job schedulers (Autosys preferred)Experience with ETL tools (preferably Informatica) and SAS ODSHands-on experience with data visualizations/reporting within SAS Visual Analytics will be a plus.Experience with visualizations in Tableau or other SAS products will be considered.If this position sounds interesting, please click on \u2018APPLY\u2019 to submit your resume for consideration.--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Contact Person: Ashish Bansal (ashish.bansal@collabera.com)Contact Information: 312-840-8167\n]

column5: [\nNeeded: UL's\xa0PureSafety OHM Functional Consultant/BA; 10+ months; Chicago, IL 60603; $90-$95/hr; skirkwood@htpartners.com\xa0Horizon Technology Partners has an immediate opening for a Sr. Functional OHM (Occupational Health Manager) Consultant / Business Analyst with expertise in UL's PureSafety OHM (or other Occupational Health) Solution or their safety based cr360 Package. Your skills are needed to assist a large energy company located in Chicago, IL 60603. In this position you will be responsible for providing Functional Implementation Support to the OHM team as they migrate from an on premise PureSafety OHM system to SaaS based cloud solution comprised of UL's OHM for their Medical department and cr360 for their Safety Department. Your role will be to provide Implementation (Subject Matter Expertise) on the PureSafety OHM solution/modules. This will include providing analysis to identifying, evaluate, and implement system enhancements and procedures needed as well as development of Process Maps, conducting GAP analysis, Test Script Development, User Interface design, and participate in UAT testing. Please note: Experience in implementation of Occupational Health Manager systems (preferably experience in PureSafety or cr360 product) is expected.\xa0Responsibilities will include:- Requirements Management and act as a liaison between business and IT team- Development of High level business requirements, detailed functional requirements, Traceability Matrix- Development of Testing Strategy, update test cases and scripts\xa0Business process areas include:- Regulatory Medical Testing- Safety Manager- Industrial Hygiene (IH)- Absence Case Management- Occupational Incident Case Management\xa0Functionalities:- Case Management- Hearing Conversation- Pulmonary Function- Medical Surveillance- Vaccinations- Absentee- Encounter Log- Employee Demographics- Industrial Hygiene- Safety Manager (including OSHA Logs and reporting)\xa0Interested Candidates should forward their resumes to: skirkwood@htpartners.com\n]

[\nClient is looking for a senior Java developer to join the front office reference data technology team. Reference data is a key shared service and is used extensively by rates, credit, securitized products and other businesses, with a large set of requirements for strategic expansion.  The team is responsible for design and development of a global system which acts as a front office view of instrument, book and counterparty data for trading, risk and pricing applications. This system enables client to migrate our infrastructure and the organization from regional and business silos to a global cross-business solution which can accommodate current and expected growth.  The candidate will be working on all components of the Unity Reference Data system (Takara) in areas which support the credit, rates, mortgages and equities businesses, and core software infrastructure. Responsibilities include: \xa0  * Implementation of software APIs used by other teams within Nomura  * Assisting other technology teams with adoption these APIs and coming up with effective technical solutions  * Implementation of real time indexing and context sensitive search services handling very large data sets (millions of records)  * Implementation of services handling very large volumes of queries and updates  * Development and configuration of intelligent caching and data distribution strategies  * Improving the existing codebase and the software development process Technical skills required: \xa0  * 2-5 years of core Java server side programming experience on Unix/Linux platform.  * Strong design skills and a deep understanding of design patterns and software development best practices  * Expertise in service oriented architecture and design, messaging protocols, concurrent programming and relational databases  * Familiarity with distributed in-memory caching, C#, Spring and Maven  The candidate must be a team player with good communication skills, and be able to work effectively within a global team  Princeton Information is one of the nation's top five privately-held IT consulting firms, in business since 1985. Princeton Information services a clientele of primarily Fortune 500 companies nationwide. With annual revenues over $120 million, Princeton Information operates across the US from multiple regional offices.  Our Commitment to Our Consultants  As a privately held company, Princeton Information is solely committed to the success of clients and consultants - not to any shareholders. PI's success is grounded in the relationships we build with our consultants. We seek the best people; provide career path counseling; as well as the most challenging opportunities in business and in IT. As part of its culture of loyalty and commitment to its consultants, Princeton Information is committed to doing all we can to ensure our consultants have the best possible search, placement and work experience possible.  Our Services  Working with one Princeton Recruiter will gain you access to over 500 open requirements with the top clients in the US across all industries (finance, insurance, pharmaceutical, commercial, telecom, media, manufacturing) nationwide. Our local recruiters have in-depth knowledge of our clients and opportunities. They will work with you to find you the best possible opportunities for you and your career.  Our Relationships  Our relationships with our clients, as well as our consultants, are critical to our success! We have a robust sales organization that ensures that Princeton has the inside track on what attributes a person needs in order to be successfully placed and engaged at our clients. We know the technical and non-technical skills that our clients are looking for and we ensure that you are educated about the client prior to your interview with them. Princeton is committed to going above and beyond to ensure that each meeting you have with a client is a successful one!\n\t\t]

column2: Staff Software Engineer (Cloud Platform) - Foster City, CA
column5: [\nGuidewire is transforming the P&C insurance industry, and we are advancing the state of our technology to meet the rising demands of our customers. Do you want to play a critical role in developing Guidewire Cloud Platform? At Guidewire, we work in an agile fashion to deliver market-leading software that meets the needs of our growing customer base. You can contribute your skills, expertise, ingenuity and passion to help us succeed in our mission.We are looking for a seasoned software engineer with extensive experience designing and building applications and the leadership skills to guide technical aspects of development.\xa0Role ExpectationsWork with small, cross-functional teams to produce and release new cloud-based services, features and improvementsProvide technical leadership during design and implementationStay current with new technologiesWork boldly with a sense of urgency; embrace mistakes, learn from them, and drive the team toward successMentor less experienced software engineersRequirements10+ years of a relevant software development experience3+ years of hands-on experience designing and developing hosted solutions (SaaS, PaaS)Understanding of core AWS (or any equivalent like Azure or Google Cloud Platform) services, uses and architecture best practices is desiredSolid understanding of cloud design considerations and limitations in the areas of distributed systems, load balancing, message queuing, service discovery, networking, data storage and securityBlend of enterprise and consumer-oriented application experience would be idealStrong programming skills (preferably with Java or/and JavaScript/Node.js)BS/MS in Computer Science or equivalent\n]

[\nSilicus is looking for a Front End Developer who enjoys client-side development and building great frontends and user interfaces using JavaScript, HTML5, Angular, Node, React and other front-end libraries and frameworks. Our ideal candidate will work in a fast-paced agile environment, wear many hats, quickly learn new technologies, change directions and promptly shift between projects when needed.\xa0\xa0You\u2019ll be a great fit for our team if you like developing web and mobile app front ends that offer engaging user experiences. You\u2019ll work as a part of fast moving agile team, participate in user-centered research, conceive features, rapidly develop prototypes, design beautiful UI, write excellent JavaScript code and run A/B experiments. We work in highly collaborative, tight-knit teams and you\u2019ll have the opportunity to inspire, lead, and mentor your teammates.\xa0As a Front End Developer, you will:\xa0Have 4+ years of experience in building high-traffic, responsive, customer-facing web application front ends, preferably in an Agile, DevOps environmentUse HTML5, JavaScript, Angular, React, CSS and SASS/LESS skills for creating interactive user interfacesLeverage experience with client-side JavaScript libraries and frameworks like jQuery, Angular, React, Backbone, Ember or MeteorDevelop process flows, wireframes and prototypes to effectively conceptualize and communicate user interface strategies and detailed interaction behaviorsParticipate in development of dynamic web or mobile apps including SPAs with microservices and anti-fragility architecturesHave exposure in building web application and services on Microsoft Azure, AWS or Google CloudHave excellent communication skills \u2013 writing, presentations, and interpersonalCOMPANY DESCRIPTIONSilicus is a technology services company helping organizations create and sustain innovation, growth and agility with next generation cloud, software, digital, and data solutions.Our global team of over 600 professionals across seven offices delivers consulting, development, solution implementation, user experience design, and managed services.Our commitment to delivering technology for customers around the globe with innovation and agility has spurred exciting growth and landed Silicus on the Inc. 5000 list of fastest growing private companies for the last several years \u2013 successfully posting year-over-year growth of 40%!At Silicus, every voice is heard, the best ideas win, and talent trumps tenure. Our teams blend proven technology experts with trailblazing talent and provide team members with unlimited opportunities to accelerate their careers and expand their skill sets by learning, engaging, and mastering emerging technologies. Come, join the experience.\xa0Visit us at www.silicus.com to learn more.Silicus is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate based on race, ethnicity, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran, genetic information, marital status or any other legally protected status.\xa0CONTACT INFORMATIONLeena Gajjala-Corporate RecruiterE: leena.gajjala@silicus.comP: (713) 353-7429\n]

column2: Senior Staff Engineer (Data and Services Platform)
column5: [\nSenior Staff Engineer (Data and Services Platform)Location: SeattleCompensation: Deluxe compensation package - generous base, bonus, sign-on, incredible benefits, other perksDuration: Permanent/Direct Hire\xa0Founded in 1986, The TRIAD Group is a Bellevue, Washington based professional services firm that adheres to the principles of service, integrity, and\xa0confidentiality. We provide our client companies with permanent, temporary, and temporary-to-permanent staffing.\xa0Our Seattle client (Streaming Media and Entertainment Giant) is looking for a highly skilled engineer, with a proven track record, who takes pride in quickly\xa0bringing high-quality code to market; an imaginative, self-motivated engineer, who enjoys learning and applying new technologies, and who thrives in a\xa0dynamic, engineering-oriented work environment.\xa0OVERVIEW:You will work with some of the most exciting, new technologies to provide rich content to our our client's video streaming applications, at massive scale.You will also create brand new data and services platforms that help to advance digital entertainment and the art of storytelling. You will work within a\xa0team of experienced and diverse software engineers and partner with designers, client engineers and business teams to deliver entertainment experiences that\xa0delight our audience.\xa0If you\u2019re excited about building large, distributed computing platforms from the ground up, or if the promise of real time, streaming big data fills you with\xa0delight, this role holds plenty of opportunity for you.REQUIREMENTS:BS or MS in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or other equivalent technical degreeAt least 5 years industry experienceExcellent analytical and problem solving skillsExpertise with one or more of C, C++, C#, Objective-C, Java or JavaScriptExperience in distributed computing architecture and implementationExperience in big data architecture, modeling and implementationExperience with cross-platform, multi-language contentA creative zeal for digital entertainmentSTUFF WE LIKE:Node.js and JavaScript, REST, NoSQL, Storm, Kafka, polyglot expertise, Jasmine, Jenkins, Linux\xa0Qualified candidates - Please select "apply now" and send us an updated resume.\xa0\xa0\xa0Keywords:C, C++,\xa0C#, Objective-C, Java, JavaScript, REST, Distributed Computing Architecture and Implementation, Node.js, NoSQL, Storm, Kafka, Jasmine, Jenkins, Linux\n]

[\nOverview:Aerojet Rocketdyne is an innovative company delivering solutions that create value for its customers in the aerospace and defense markets. We are a world-recognized aerospace and defense leader that provides propulsion and energetics to the space, missile defense and strategic systems, tactical systems and armaments areas, in support of domestic and international markets. Additional information about Aerojet Rocketdyne can be obtained by visiting our website at www.Rocket.comAerojet Rocketdyne  seeks a  Senior Analyst, Procurement (Senior Buyer/Subcontracts Administrator) . Ideally, this position will be based at our facility in  Canoga Park, CA , but our other locations in Camden (Arkansas), Gainesville (Virginia), Huntsville (Alabama), Redmond (Washington), Sacramento (California) or West Palm Beach (Florida) can be considered.This current opening may be filled at this level as posted or at one level higher. Essential Job Functions (Including % of Time for Each):Under limited general direction, the Senior Buyer/Subcontracts Administrator determines approaches to objectives demonstrating a complete understanding and application of principles, concepts, and practices.50% - Procure critical path commodities in support of various aerospace program. Manage subcontracts for these complex procurements. Perform as IPT liaison and/or representative on specific programs. Assigned commodities could include any of the following: castings, forgings, raw materials, valves and/or machined parts.20% - Create and issue all types of fixed or variable subcontracts, including incentive or award fee. Lead source selection teams, conduct formal cost/price analysis, cost audits, fact finding and formal negotiations, as required for major subcontracting activity.10% - Plan, conduct and direct projects or major portions of projects, including coordination of efforts with other staff members.10% - Train and/or mentor less senior buying personnel, along with delegating less complex workload, as necessary.5% - Lead in the development of work statements, proposal bills of materials, risk assessments and policy & procedure development, as necessary. Perform audit of PO files and documentation of sub-level buyers.5% - Active participation in company and departmental initiatives, including strategic sourcing and supplier board activities.Requirements:Requires a Bachelor's degree in an appropriate discipline and six (6) years of directly related experience, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.Requires U.S. Citizenship. As a Government Contractor, this position requires the employee to have access to premises which are, OR requires the employee to perform duties that are, subject to national security requirements of the United States under government contracts that impose US Citizenship requirements for such positions. Must be able to satisfy federal government requirements for access to government information. Having dual citizenship may preclude you from being able to meet this requirement.Additional Requirements:Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Demonstrated in-depth knowledge of government contracting requirements, FAR Certified Cost and Pricing data and other pertinent government flow downs. Demonstrated understanding of the Program Office and Project Management roles within an integrated product team (IPT) environment is required. Must possess a high level of understanding in all relative business matters and have the ability to effectively interact with all levels of management internal to the company and external to suppliers and customers alike. Preferred Qualifications:Knowledge of space products and the unique processing associated with these items. Familiarity with types of valves, machined parts and/or forgings and castings, how they function, how they operate and manufacturing processes associated with these commodities. Work Environment/Physical Requirements:Employees in these positions must possess mobility to work in a standard office setting and to use standard office equipment, including a computer; stamina to sit and to maintain attention to detail despite interruptions; may occasionally lift/carry/push/pull up to 15 pounds; may require minimal walking, climbing, stooping, crouching, and/or bending; and vision to read printed materials and a computer screen, and hearing and speech to communicate in person and over the telephone. May require the ability to travel by air or auto. May require the use of personal protective equipment such as safety glasses, safety shoes, and shop coat. These positions may be expected to work varying shifts and hours to ensure successful operation of activities in the organization.\xa0 Department:  Procurement/Purchasing - Other\n\t\t]

column2: Lead QA Automation Engineer in Seattle, WA
column5: [\nDescription:We are looking for a\xa0Lead QA Automation Engineer\xa0(Cloud Services) for one of our fortune 500 clients. This position is\xa0housed in Seattle, WA.This is a long term contract opportunity with a possibility of converting into permanent role. NO Visa Sponsersip is offered.Our client's Cloud Services and Architecture team is transforming the way technology services are organized and delivered within the company by building new cloud delivery systems for existing technology services and integrating public cloud services into the service framework. The development arm of the team designs and builds portal interfaces for services and the API management and orchestration system that abstracts proprietary infrastructure service APIs.Group's vision:\xa0This team is moving to a continuous integration deployment model. Automated test framework. When code is submitted, it is NOT touched by humans as it goes through the process of development, QA and testing.However, before going into production, this person will review and ensure that it passed all tests prior to it going into production. Process is automated up to the point of human contact so that we can ensure integrity. Up to this point, everything has been done in Python. Doesn\u2019t mean the next portion has to be done that way, it could be Ruby, Javascript etc. Python would be the ideal. Jenkins is used. Code versioning is done in GIT. NOT looking to hire remote.\xa0You: This position is a senior member on the team, responsible for setting the direction for the architecture of the automated test framework that validates code for release as part of our CI/CD pipeline. The role requires familiarity with existing test frameworks and the ability to integrate those with our current deployment model. Person will need to have a heavy test automation background. If not proficient in Python, they will have to know how to atleast read Python.Responsibilities:Help to define architecture, strategy, and roadmap for our automated test framework\xa0Develop or lead the development of the automation frameworkDevelop and execute moderate to highly complex scripted automated tests, and manual tests where applicable\xa0Write requirements and functional specifications for moderate to highly complex automated test plansServe as a high-level technical resource and \u201cgo-to\u201d person for less experienced QA engineers\xa0Basic Qualifications (Must Haves):5 to 8 years of progressively related years of experience in software development and/or QA engineering\xa02-4 years of Python development, or equivalent scripting language (Ruby, JavaScript, etc)\xa02-4 years of work in a Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment environment\xa0Advance level knowledge of software QA engineering processes, test automation, building and testing frameworks, and consumer-facing applications and databases\xa0Modern API methodologies (REST, microservices)\xa0Agile development processes (Scrum)\xa0Continuous Integration tools and processes, including Jenkins framework\xa0Code versioning / checking management, including Git systemPreferred Qualifications ( Good To Have):Advanced JavaScript knowledge, including NodeJS and AngularJS\xa0Configuration management through Chef, Puppet, Ansible, etc\xa0Familiar with Cloud technologies (AWS, GCP)\xa0At least 2 years of project or team lead experience\xa0\n]
